story:
Who We Are

After 28 years of marriage and as our 2 biological children were flying from the nest, we began praying in earnest about what God had next for us.  On our 3rd mission trip, we believe God answered those prayers when we met Ian on a visit to the Robin’s Nest Children’s Home in Jamaica. Despite having Cerebral Palsy, being non-verbal and non-ambulatory, Ian was a delightful 8 year old boy. He communicated quite well with eye gaze, expressions and gestures. God led us to begin the adoption process and 16 months later, we brought him home. Two years after adopting Ian, we again felt God leading us toward another adoption, this time through our local DCS.  Jeremy and Lucas (ages 9 and 6) were in foster care and needed a forever home. They began visiting on weekends in March, 2011 and their adoption was final in August. Due to past trauma, neglect and abuse in their lives, Jeremy and Lucas have many challenges to overcome. God is using all our boys to grow us in ways we never would have imagined.  Because of each of the boys’ unique and special needs, it has been difficult to find activities that we can all do as a family. A friend sent us a link to Victory Lane Camp and our interest was piqued when we realized that there were appropriate activities for all the boys but mostly the Christ-centered resources for the entire family.

What We Need

The cost for a family to attend Victory Lane Camp is $2000. To help families experience this opportunity, Victory Lane Camp establishes campaigns for each family to reach this goal. The Humphrey family has already received donations from other outside sources, so they only need to raise $1500.

About Victory Lane Camp

Victory Lane Camp empowers and equips families with special needs to heal through their disability so that their future together builds healthy communities. For more information about Victory Lane Camp, please visit our website.

Other Ways You Can Help

Victory Lane Camp families need more than just financial assistance to go to camp this summer. We need your help to get the word out to your communities!

  • Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and Pinterest and share our message with your friends and family! We want to get the word out about how Victory Lane Camp empowers and equips families!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help the Upchurch family meet their goal!

Thank you for empowering and equipping this family to attend an experience that would have otherwise been out of reach.

*Thank you to an anonymous donor for donating $500 to help the Humphrey family come to Victory Lane Camp*

story:
This is my best friend Myra and her son Miles.  Miles is a 5 year-old boy born with the severest form of Spina Bifida, known as myelomeningocele.  Miles’ condition affects various body systems, including musculoskeletal, cognitive, gastrointestinal, urological, neurological and ophthalmological. He is partially paralyzed from the chest down and does not walk, crawl, or sit independently. His upper extremity movement is limited and fine motor skills are severely impaired. His cognitive and social skills range from the equivalent of a child between 18 to 24 months, and he is entirely dependent on caregivers for all aspects of life. 

Despite countless surgeries, tests, procedures, and hospitalizations Miles always has a smile on his face.  He has the world's best laugh and is loved by everyone he meets.  He's gorgeous inside and out with a vibrant and lively spirit. He takes everything that comes at him with incredible grace and simply just enjoys life- something many of us take for granted all too often. He is loved by everyone he meets

Myra is the strongest and bravest person I have ever met.  She is an excellent mother and caregiver for Miles.  One of her greatest dreams would be to see Miles be given the chance to walk.  The Upsee will give her and Miles the chance to experience something they never thought they could.  This device will simulate the feeling of Miles walking with Myra's help.

http://www.fireflyfriends.com/upsee

story:
The Best Gift for All Women

If you are a woman this book is a 'must have'.  If you are a man and care about women, this is a 'must have' gift to give to women in your life - you sister, daughter, friend, mother, and partner. 

"Read it, share the information with your friends and daughters, and not only will you change your life, but you will change the life of those around you." 

Dr. C. Chandler

Age Doesn't Matter, Breasts Do!

At least 1 out of every 8 women will develop breast cancer, not because of inheriting a breast cancer causing gene, but because of many other reasons that often can be prevented.  This is the reason that the book is extremely important to every woman whether she is 20 or  younger, 40, or 60 or older.  It's never to early for women to make breast cancer prevention an important part of their lives. 

Exciting Times for Women’s Breasts!

There are many words that can be used to describe what’s happening today – exciting, revolutionary, groundbreaking, and lifesaving are just for starters! Thanks to the many advances in technology and research, these words represent something that we know is fact–women finally have the opportunity to learn the quality of information they need to help them reduce their chances of breast cancer and improve their health in immeasurable ways!



The Book

This is the first book to put the research together is a way that all women deserve. Your Breasts, Taking Charge of Keeping Them Healthy at Any Age describes the intimate connections between breast health and health of the digestive and immune systems and lifestyle and environment.  By having this powerful information, women can make choices thatare best for their breast health and the health of every other part of them. It's a win-win situation!

Sixteen Chapters Loaded with Great Information! 

A comprehensive review of the research has been rolled into 16 chapters that makes Your Breasts, Taking Charge of Keeping Them Healthy at Any Age a special, carefully written resource for all women. Complex information has been translated into an optimistic, easy, enjoyable, user-friendly ‘read’ that offers women even more than breast health information. 

The book  gives women the support and resources to succeed!  It helps them create their own, personal health plan and break through personal barriers to success. The book also includes much needed information about several other women's health problems and reproductive cancers, 


With the Information

Women are able to share the wonderful information with friends, family, colleagues, daughters and over time, breast health and breast cancer prevention will no longer be ignored. It will FINALLY become an important and routine part of women’s health care.  

"I’ve been waiting for a book to come along that my patients can use to help them sort out the correct from the incorrect information and be able to learn about breast health. I’m relieved that I finally have such a book I can recommend.” 

Dr. Sharon Pushkin, OBGYN

Your Help Is Greatly Appreciated

With your help, we will be able to print 1,000 copies and market the book, particularly to nonprofit organizations, groups and others who work with women, breast cancer prevention, environmental, and other related issues.    If we raise more, we will translate the book into Spanish and begin to market it as well.

Pre-Ordering a Book Is A Great Way to Help! 

Please consider pre-ordering one copy of Your Breasts, Taking Charge of Keeping Them Healthy at Any Age for only $20 which includes S & H. If you would like to order more than one copy, take 10% off each additional copy or choose a perk.  It's  a great gift for you or someone you care about and it makes the perfect donation to an organization committed to women’s health or breast cancer prevention.

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, donations are always welcome! $5, $15, or ? is much appreciated.If you are unable to contribute or would prefer not to have a book, please tell a friend, post a message on Facebook or even post a link to our campaign page. 

Anything you can do to support the book is greatly appreciated! 

THANK YOU VERY MUCH.

Barbara Kass WHNP, MSN

 A Little About Me

I've had the honor of being able to specialize in women’s health care for over 35 years and make preventive and integrative medicine the foundation of my approach to that care.  During these years I was fortunate to  provide clinical services, write, teach, direct women's health related programs, and evaluate the care being given to women by their health care providers. And like so many, I have lost family, patients, friends and colleagues to breast cancer. 

All of these experiences combined with watching the ways in which women's breast health continues to be ignored led to me the research, and ultimately, to writing the book.  Previously authored books include Say Goodbye to PMS, The Fertility Awareness Workbook, and the textbook A Total Wellness Approach to the Care of Peri and Post Menopausal Women.

story:
Our Story

I was in a car wreck in 04.The next thing I knew, Iï¿½m waking up in a rehabilitation hospital with both my legs gone and my body was soo sore!! Now I didnï¿½t exactly wake up, I would just open my eyes and someone new was there each time. I was too out of it to even think why I was there. My grandma told me that everyday I for about 1 ï¿½  months, I was taken to surgery and sedated to wash all the debris out of my legs. Then they would always have to give me 3 to 4 pints of blood after the surgeries just to replace what I lost. When the nurse would come in to clean my legs, they would lift them up and they said I would ask what those things were. The nurses replied, ï¿½those are your legsï¿½. Then I would just turn my head away. . The doctor had a meeting with my family and told them they have done everything they can do yet I wasnï¿½t responding to anything. I was really worried about school. It was my senior year, which is all I have been waiting for, for 12 years and I am in the hospital. I was being fed through a stomach feeding tube which I would throw it up every time theyï¿½d give it to me. So I was really skinny!! <!--[if gte mso 9]>

story:
Short Summary

Going through high school I had my life planned out. I was going to go to Fresno State University and become a sign language interpreter. The end of my senior year (2008) I was sure I found my soul mate, Willie Gardner. The, in my mind, cutest boy in school, number one on the football team, a lot of girl wanted him and he was mine. Luckily, we were both accepted to Fresno State—although he did not have a football scholarship for that school. He left his scholarships and moved with me to Fresno, California. Life seemed perfect at the time. We got our own apartment, and went to school.

After only 10 months from our first date, on January 22, 2009, my eighteenth birthday, we got married. One month after marriage we decided we wanted kids, we got pregnant nearly instantly. The one thing he didn’t realize was that with pregnancy comes hormones. He started pulling away, and decided he wanted to get separated. I was extremely stressed out and ended up going into preterm labor at 22 weeks. Labor was stopped and I was put on bed rest. At this point my husband decided it would be perfect timing to leave me in Fresno and move back down to San Diego with his mother. My mom then of course came up and moved me back down to her house in San Diego. I gave birth to my 3lb 6oz baby  boy, Willie Jr. at 30 weeks pregnant.

After having our son we decided we would give it another try. After all, this was my one true love, right? My heart could never be torn from him, and unfortunately he knew it. He started to become extremely controlling and abusive. It got to the point that if I even answered his phone call by saying, “hello” instead of, “hi babe” I would pay for it. I finally got the nerve to call the police. After the report (he ran away when I called) he came back swore it wouldn’t happen again and I apologized for calling. But, nothing changed. As time passed, I called the police 3 more times.

I became pregnant again, this time not planned, even though I was on birth control. He left again. I couldn’t afford the rent on my own, so I moved back with my mom. I had my daughter, Natillie, full term at 6lbs 14oz.

What We Need

I am a single mother of two kids, not receiving any help from the kids’ father. He up and moved to Las Vegas and has gotten arrested multiple times since. He comes around every few months to see my babies. Willie Jr. is going to turn three on September 28, 2012 and has caught up in size to a full-term child. The only thing that has not caught up is his lungs. I have been receiving government help by having my children and myself on Medi-cal, and food stamps. Now, according to the government, I make too much money to have any help. I can handle the food, but health insurance is getting cut off as well. My son, who has severe asthma is in the emergency room at least once a month, if not more, with troubled breathing and oxygen lowering as low as 85%. My daughter, who just turned one year old, has started showing signs of asthma, but not near as severe. I am asking for help to be able to afford health insurance and help with the cost of medications and co-pays for my children. Unfortunately, unlike Medi-cal, other health insurances do not cover 100% of prescription costs or hospital visits. I am asking for $8,000 dollars to help me get insurance for the kids as well as put money away for the times he is admitted into the hospital.
 
 
 

What You Get

For $30 contributions I will knit a beenie cap, you can decide the color and if you want a flower on the side, or even a puff ball on top!

 

For $50 contibutions I will crochet a you a scarf of whatever color you would like!

 

For $80 contributions I will crochet a pair of slippers, any color any size.

 

For $120 contributions you can pick any two of the previous perks.

 

 For $250 contributions I will crochet a baby blanket

 


For $300 I will incorporate a name into the baby blanket

 


If any of you really want to help me and my kids, for $600+ I will crochet a full sized adult afghan.

 

All of these perks will be personally crocheted by me, Molly Gardner. Since I am only one person and can only crochet so fast, the time frame that these will be sent out will vary. I will however, let you know as quickly as possible how many projects are ahead of yours and keep you up to date with pictures on the progress I have made on your perk! :)

 

The first three perks will be sent out within 5 days of receiving contribution, the $250 and $300 perks will be sent out no later than 6 weeks. The $550 perk time will vary, but will average about 15 weeks.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not only will it help to have your contributions, but since I do not know much about picking insurance it would be great to have input on what to look for in a good insurance. Even, if you could help with a referral to a website for a certain health insurance carrier, that would be much appreciated. Thank you so much for taking the time to read through my campaign. Also, a great thank you to those of you who decided to contribute your money, or useful information. Thank you.

story:
Hi, I'm Chef Kenny. I've spent the last ten years developing great tasting recipes that contribute to health and well being. My goal is to help all those who have struggled to eat healthier with my new cookbook "Shake Lunch Up".

"Shake Lunch Up" offers up healthy shakes, soups, salads, sandwiches, and lunchtime meals, with easy to read recipes and beautifully styled food photography by New York photographer Will Vaultz (www.willvaultz.com).

These tasty lunchtime recipes focus on using fresh produce, whole grains and lean meats and time saving easy to follow recipes. All celebrate the Southern flavors I grew up with as well as the Southwestern, Thai and international flavors I use as a professional chef. "Shake Lunch Up" also offers delicious lunchtime meal plans and great tips on packing wholesome meals for family and work. The cookbook also highlights natural healthful and convenant supplements for people on the move.

Why did I write "Shake Lunch Up"? Well, ten years ago I found myself seventy pounds overweight. Fast food was my weakness. Processed and fried foods were a part of my daily diet. My midday cravings often resulted in poor food choices at lunchtime that set me up for failure the rest of the day and made it impossible to maintain an active lifestyle. I new in my spirit and heart that I needed to make a change but struggled with how to make healthy daily choices.

Through my love of cooking I discovered the benefits of eating whole foods, I lost the weight and I didn't look back. However, I haven't sacrificed the family recipes, foods and flavors that I love, I've simply learned to recreate them in a new way.

"Shake Lunch Up"" reflects my journey and passion to share the word with youth and adults that change is possible you just have to shake things up!

The Funding

What is the money for? Most will go towards pre-production cost for the cookbook (food, materials, studio location sites etc.) Additional monies will go towards the postproduction of the book: things like hiring a professional editor, further refinements on the digital editions, and print edition as well. It will also help to continue my work in the community with youth and adults looking to transition to healthier ways of eating through demos and outreach.

Thank you!

Thank you for considering our indie go go project, and for pledging. We really appreciate it and will do everything we can to make the most of your support.

"Shake Lunch Up" also offers delicious lunchtime meal plans and great tips on packing wholesome meals for family and work. The cookbook also highlights natural healthful and convenant supplements for people on the move.
Why did I write "Shake Lunch Up"? Well, ten years ago I found myself seventy pounds overweight. Fast food was my weakness. Processed and fried foods were a part of my daily diet. My midday cravings often resulted in poor food choices at lunchtime that set me up for failure the rest of the day and made it impossible to maintain an active lifestyle. I new in my spirit and heart that I needed to make a change but struggled with how to make healthy daily choices.
Through my love of cooking I discovered the benefits of eating whole foods, I lost the weight and I didn't look back. However, I haven't sacrificed the family recipes, foods and flavors that I love, I've simply learned to recreate them in a new way.
"Shake Lunch Up"" reflects my journey and passion to share the word with youth and adults that change is possible you just have to shake things up!
The Funding
What is the money for? Most will go towards pre-production cost for the cookbook (food, materials, studio location sites etc.) Additional monies will go towards the postproduction of the book: things like hiring a professional editor, further refinements on the digital editions, and print edition as well. It will also help to continue my work in the community with youth and adults looking to transition to healthier ways of eating through demos and outreach.
Thank you!
Thank you for considering our indie go go project, and for pledging. We really appreciate it and will do everything we can to make the most of your support.

story:
*note: Indiegogo was kind enough to allow a one-time goal increase. Please watch the video to find out why I feel I need to raise more funds. Thank you for your love and support!

 

Hi everyone. My name is Heather and I've been living with Lyme disease for most of my life, since I was six or seven years old; I'm 31 now. I was diagnosed a little over seven years ago, at age 24. Since then I've been in and out of treatment, depending on finances, life circumstances, and symptom severity. It's a miracle I'm alive at all; in late 2004 - when I first fell so ill I finally had to concede there was something physically wrong with me and the doctors who'd told me all my life that I was a hopeless hypochondriac were gravely mistaken - I was bedridden, unable to read, write, process information, digest food, or hold a coherent conversation. I weighed 85 pounds and my days consisted of writhing in bed in agonizing neurological pain. To read my Lyme story in full (it's too long and gruesome to recount here), feel free to visit the following URL -- http://lymenaide.wordpress.com/2010/12/11/my-ly...

For the past several years I've been lucky enough to have the financial support of my grandparents for basic daily living expenses; with that money I was also able to afford some Lyme treatment (though never IV antibiotics, which would've been ideal for my severe case; and I haven't had health insurance since my college years). My grandparents passed away recently, however, and family support is waning fast. Most of my family doesn't believe or acknowledge that I'm ill; the few family members who do are unable to support me financially or fund my treatments.

Recently, and for the first time in a few years, I started a part-time job. This gig is only a few hours per week, but it's great, and I feel so blessed to have it. I'm also looking for another job and am hoping I'm well enough to work 20 hours per week; however, to be honest, I'm not certain my body's up for the challenge. I don't have much choice, as I need to do what I need to do to survive, keep housing over my head, keep myself and my two cats fed. I'm also in the very beginning stages of applying for disability. For years I was told I was ineligible, but I just discovered recently that SSA has a little-known program to which I can apply to receive some monthly help. Unfortunately, the application process is long and grueling, and approval could take months or years.

I hate asking for assistance. It's incredibly difficult for me. Anyone who knows me knows I don't even let people grocery shop for me or make me food when I'm too sick to do it myself. It's difficult to accept the fact that I can't work full-time to support myself. True, it's been seven years, but there is still some part of me that's in denial of my disability. I was supposed to go to grad school. I was supposed to have a career by now, maybe a family. Instead I've been in limbo since I graduated college, and without help it's possible I'll stay here for the rest of my life, or worse, deteriorate further.

There are things I want to do. There is a reason I'm here. Deep down this is something I know is true. There is a reason I've suffered through years of excruciating illness, often disbelieved, cast off by both family and friends because this reality is such a difficult one to comprehend. I know when I heal (yes, when - I refuse to allow myself any other language), I'll bring something to this world I never would've been capable of had I lived my life the way I intended: healthy, physically strong, on a clear path, no grueling vision quest as detour. From my own extensive experience with various doctors and healers, I know the best healers have been deeply wounded, have endured an unparalleled darkness. When I emerge from the fires of this, I want to help others access their own healing. What better preparation than a decade-long, neurological, near-fatal illness? Maybe this is my initiation, my schooling. But the fact is that I need to emerge from this place if I ever hope to contribute in the way I so deeply want. And to emerge, I need your help. There have been some desperately dark days lately. Days I want only to give up, because I see no hope of anything different. This is my attempt to walk back into the light. To declare to myself that my path, my journey, my life is worth it. That I - one lone person with no partner or children, no one for whom I must stay - am worth saving.

With your help, I hope to become well enough to accomplish a few key endeavors (it's easy to forget aspirations and goals when you spend years upon years in an illness twilight; this paragraph is, most of all, a reminder to myself): grad school in poetry and/or transpersonal psychology; yoga teacher certification; reiki certification; shamanic studies; massage school; publishing a book of poetry; lots of fiddlin' and perhaps taking on some fiddle students; and seeing the world, as I haven't left the US in over 14 years. Above all, I want to continue being a kind person, as kindness is the foremost lesson illness has taught me.

Thank you so much for reading this, and for your generosity of heart. It means more than I can possibly express.

(Every single dollar counts. No donation is too small. Thank you, thank you, thank you.)

Gratefully,
Heather

 

ps. Please forward this campaign widely! Thank you!!

(Every single dollar counts. No donation is too small. Thank you, thank you, thank you.)
Gratefully, Heather
 
ps. Please forward this campaign widely! Thank you!!

story:
Greetings,

Haiti's children are her future as a nation and as such we, S.H.I, believe they must be given the opportunity to grow adequately in a society where they are.

Indeed they are in deserving rights to be well nourished both physically and morally through exercises, civic instruction and engagements, teaching them co-existence with one another as comrades within their communities.

*  Could we civically sponsor an exercise uniform http://bit.ly/AFFIRM-HAITI  for a child http://bit.ly/SHI-GIVE in HAITI for a $10  contribution only?  Yes, we can!

Every early morning in a lower rural area of Hinche, Haiti we, S.H.I, do early exercise with the children living on our block.  However, there is a little problem...  they do not have adequate uniforms such as running shoes, t-shirts and shorts to properly do exercise in - so, can you help?

THE IMPACT:

By sponsoring a child uniform, you will have ensure them great physical health which will also help their morale health through sports.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

Understandably not all of us can sponsor... hence please, we ask for your participation to spread this campaign.

  • Help us tweet and post on facebook as much as you can.

  • Share this campaign to relative groups that may sponsor, indeed...

This is your,

 
SOVEREIGN HAITI INITIATIVE - (S.H.I).
General:  Wilgëens "AfroLatino" Rosenberg.
(404) 482 - 1622
 
Email:  SovereignHaitiInitiative@gmail.com
 
 
"STAND FOR HAITI'S TRUE SOVEREIGNTY, NOT RUSES OF DEPENDENCY AND OCCUPANCY!"

story:
Our Story

When our baby developed severe eczema, my husband and I went about solving it - not just identifying triggers, but understanding the cause and solving the problem.

 

I published our experience in newsletters, then on a web site - www.solveeczema.org - to help other families.


In the years since, parents all over the world have used the web site information to eliminate their children's severe eczema when nothing else worked.  I have even been thanked by doctors who used the information to help their own families.

 

The ultimate goal was always to find a way to conduct a medical study of the solution, reach the broader medical community, help far more families. 


The Impact

Severe childhood eczema is a worsening global problem. In some parts of the world, eczema rates in children now exceed 30% and continue to climb, with no acknowledged cure.  Asthma and allergies often accompany eczema. Eczema can cause unrelenting itching, pain, chronic sleep deprivation, skin infections, social problems from poor appearance, behavioral effects, even impaired social development. When a child has this miserable disease, a whole family suffers.


Around the world, people are spending billions of dollars in an often vain search for answers and relief.  I believe - with novel interpretation - the bits and pieces of the answer for the majority of children with eczema can be found in existing medical literature and a prospective study of the solution already helping parents in Solveeczema.org can bring those pieces together.


What We Need & What You Get

I am looking for personal sponsorship so I can afford to focus full-time on making a medical study a reality, writing a book and starting a related social business.


I have set a goal of $5,000, essentially a writer's grant so I can put out a self-published book about the solution.  


With more, I could do more:


Over $10,000 - I could finish a book and pay a web designer to make needed improvements to Solveeczema.org that are beyond my ability

Over $36,000 - Support me for a year, to do the above, and allow me to pay for the time of a medical partner to develop a protocol and budget for a medical study so I can get funding for a medical study.  

     While unlikely at this stage of the campaign, any higher level of support would go directly to making medical study progress (Over $250,000 would fund a whole study, start to finish).


More detail:

What I'd like to do (depending on level of support):

*Research Protocol:  Develop, with a medical partner, a specific research protocol and budget for a prospective medical study.  

*Medical Study:  Fund a prospective medical study of the solution in Solveeczema.org for a group of atopic families, measuring quality of life, eczema severity, other allergy and asthma, and skin barrier function for an infant, a sibling, and at least one atopic parent in each family, plus the same for atopic control families who do not implement the solution.  Test period will cover two months prior to implementing the solution, during implementation, and at least six months after.  If indicated and where feasible, solution will be withdrawn for 2 or more families and eczema severity and skin barrier function changes monitored.  This campaign can't fund such a study (unless donations go into six figures, in which case the extra money will go to fund the study itself), but will allow me to focus on getting funding.

*Revise and Improve Website:  Fund professional web design to update and improve the information and add community capability.

*Write book incorporating years of blog entries and new knowledge to streamlined information from the Solveeczema.org site.

*Start Social Business:  To grow funds for research of this and other unsolved problems, where I believe an answer already exists in the medical literature and empirical problem solving is needed rather than new science.  Business opportunities related to solutions would help fund non-profit research on other solutions.



Thank You's for your gracious contribution

Pledge levels and Thank You gifts:

All gifts of $1 or more - Thank you acknowledgement on new page of Solveeczema.org

$50 - Two soap foam pumps, large or small (your choice), the best I have ever found.

$100 - Two soap foam pumps, and your choice of 3 fine bar soaps from a list of my favorites

$250 - Signed copy of my book, Problem-solving Your Child's Eczema, when finished, plus two soap foam pumps, and choice of 3 fine bar soaps from my list

$500 -  Personal consultation by telephone and email for those wanting individual input while implementing Solveeczema.org (up to 2 hours).  (Note:  I cannot give medical advice.) 

$1,000 - Kit of handpicked household and personal care products meeting the criteria of Solveeczema.org + personal consultation (as below) + signed book + thank you in acknowledgements of book 


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this page with others!
Twitter * Facebook * LinkedIn * email * parents groups

If you have benefited from Solveeczema.org and have offered to help in the past, now is the time!  Even if you can't donate much, please spread the word to your families and communities.

Suggest fundraising ideas, ask questions, or send feedback to : 
solveeczema[at]yahoo[dot]com

Parents tell me they couldn't parent normally before they implemented the solution on Solveeczema.org, or that their children never lived a day without pain or slept through a single night because of the intense itching, or that they suffered life-threatening infections, or were ostracized by other children and adults.  And they tell me what a difference it makes to really, truly see and understand where the previously random-seeming outbreaks come from and how to prevent or eliminate them, to have control over what had once controlled them.  Many parents have described how asthma was ameliorated or eliminated along with the eczema, as the underlying basis would predict, and which also deserves further study.


Any level of support will help me take this forward to a degree that will help more people.  My ultimate goal is ambitious but doable:  to ensure no child has to live with eczema unnecessarily, and to show new ways to solve seemingly intractable medical problems.  


*Thank you to Jill Schoff, for sharing the wonderful photo above.  Jill wrote her book Green Up Your Cleanup after using Solveeczema.org for her baby.


I am probably obliged to tell you that donations are not tax-deductible.  If you know of any good organizations that might be appropriate for fiscal sponsorship, please let me know!

story:
Photo ©Rolex Awards/Julian Kingma

Short Summary

You might have heard about Antibiotic Resistance or Superbugs. Have you ever wondered what exactly that is? How it's happening? Why should we worry? and what can you do to prevent this?

Well… the goal of this project is to answer - in a very easy and fun way - all of these and other questions related to Antibiotic Resistance in bacteria.

  • We are a group of multidisciplinary health activists aiming to raise awareness about the importance of appropriate antibiotic use and the threat that superbugs impose.
  • Educating the public about this issue will reduce the inappropriate use of antibiotics and will potentially reduce the risk of superbug related infections.
  • Your contribution will help to create a short animated video delivered in multiple languages describing how bacteria are becoming antibiotic resistant, along with the related medical consequences for this phenomena and what we need to do in order to eliminate this threat.
  • This video will also be used as a publicly available research tool that we will use to measure public understanding about antibiotic use and antibiotic resistant superbugs.

What We Need & What You Get

We need:

  • to raise public awareness about this issue.
  • to reduce the unnecessary use of antibiotics in all sectors.
  • to create multimedia materials in different languages to deliver the awareness and educational messages.
  • your support to create an animated short video aimed at raising awareness and reducing the inappropriate use of antibiotics.
  • your support will help to facilitate the understanding of the public point-of-view about antibiotic and superbugs.
You get:
  • to join the fight against superbugs!
  • to enhance the Antibiotics and Superbugs Awareness Campaign.
  • to contribute in raising public awareness about this issue, while aiding in the preservation of our precious antibiotics to when they are truly needed.
  • to contribute in the understanding of public perception about antibiotics and superbugs.
  • to know that you have truly made an impact on the fight against superbugs!
  • to receive some of our perks as a small 'thank you' for your big contribution.

$50: Thank you via Twitter. With your contribution, we will graciously be thanking you by posting a Tweet mentioning your support on our Twitter feed.

$100: Recognition (name or logo). With your contribution, we will list your name or your organization's name/logo at the end of the video to acknowledge your support.

$200: Recognition and Postcard. With your contribution, we will list your name or your organization's name/logo at the end of the video to acknowledge your support.You will also receive a hand written postcard to thank you for your kind support.

$500: Recognition with polo jersey.

We will list your name or your organization's name/logo at the end of the video to acknowledge your support. You will also receive your very own limited-edition polo shirt representing the Superbug Slayers Polo Team.

©Rolex Awards/Thamir Alshihri

$1,000: Donor recognition. Our donors will be listed at the end of the video to acknowledge their significant support. Any scientific publication related to the proposed video will acknowledge the donors for their financial support.Donors will also receive a limited-edition polo shirt for Superbug Slayers Polo Team.

    The Impact

    The World Health Organization has highlighted the importance of education to limit the unnecessary use of antibiotics as part of its Combating Antimicrobial Resistance Strategy. http://www.who.int/world-health-day/2011/policybriefs/en/

    The Antibiotics and Superbugs Awareness Campaign aims to raise public awareness and remind medical practitioners about the importance of appropriately using antibiotics. This activity is non-for-profit, with the ultimate aim of combating superbugs and eliminating their threat.

    The proposed animated video in multiple languages will be used, alongside other multimedia materials, to educate and raise awareness about antibiotics and superbugs. This will potentially help to reduce the unnecessary use of antibiotics, which fuels the emergence and spread of superbugs.

    Understanding public perception on why antibiotics are misused and what they know about antibiotic resistance, will help to customize the Antibiotics and Superbugs Awareness Campaign to fulfill gaps in knowledge and improve practice.

    Risks & Challenges

    Producing an educational video in a very creative and impactful manner can be challenging, particularly when explaining a very complicated scientific issue such as antimicrobial resistance. When our target is achieved, we will be working with professional storytellers and animators to produce a video that will be effective, yet easily understood by all.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Visiting our page means a lot!!!

      You can still help us achieve our goal by spreading the word about our campaign through social media networks with your friends and family.

We are a group of multidisciplinary health activists aiming to raise awareness about the importance of appropriate antibiotic use and the threat that superbugs impose. Educating the public about this issue will reduce the inappropriate use of antibiotics and will potentially reduce the risk of superbug related infections. Your contribution will help to create a short animated video delivered in multiple languages describing how bacteria are becoming antibiotic resistant, along with the related medical consequences for this phenomena and what we need to do in order to eliminate this threat.
This video will also be used as a publicly available research tool that we will use to measure public understanding about antibiotic use and antibiotic resistant superbugs.
 
What We Need & What You Get
 We need: 
to raise public awareness about this issue.
to reduce the unnecessary use of antibiotics in all sectors.
to create multimedia materials in different languages to deliver the awareness and educational messages.
your support to create an animated short video aimed at raising awareness and reducing the inappropriate use of antibiotics.
your support will help to facilitate the understanding of the public point-of-view about antibiotic and superbugs.
 
You get:


to join the fight against superbugs!
to enhance the Antibiotics and Superbugs Awareness Campaign.
to contribute in raising public awareness about this issue, while aiding in the preservation of our precious antibiotics to when they are truly needed.
to contribute in the understanding of public perception about antibiotics and superbugs.

to know that you have truly made an impact on the fight against superbugs!
to receive some of our perks as a small 'thank you' for your big contribution.


$50:
Thank you via Twitter. With your contribution, we
will graciously be thanking you by posting a Tweet mentioning your support on
our Twitter feed.
$100:
Recognition (name or logo). With your contribution,
we will list your name or your organization's name/logo at the end of the video
to acknowledge your support.
$200:
Recognition and Postcard. With your contribution,
we will list your name or your organization's name/logo at the end of the video
to acknowledge your support.You
will also receive a hand written postcard to thank you for your kind support.
$500:
Recognition with polo jersey.
We will list your name or your
organization's name/logo at the end of the video to acknowledge your support.
You will also receive your very own limited-edition polo shirt representing the
Superbug Slayers Polo Team.


©Rolex Awards/Thamir Alshihri
$1,000:
Donor recognition. Our donors will be listed at the
end of the video to acknowledge their significant support. Any scientific
publication related to the proposed video will acknowledge the donors for their
financial support.Donors will also
receive a limited-edition polo shirt for Superbug Slayers Polo Team.




The Impact The World Health Organization has highlighted the importance of education to limit the unnecessary use of antibiotics as part of its Combating Antimicrobial Resistance Strategy. http://www.who.int/world-health-day/2011/policybriefs/en/
The Antibiotics and Superbugs Awareness Campaign aims to raise public awareness and remind medical practitioners about the importance of appropriately using antibiotics. This activity is non-for-profit, with the ultimate aim of combating superbugs and eliminating their threat.
The proposed animated video in multiple languages will be used, alongside other multimedia materials, to educate and raise awareness about antibiotics and superbugs. This will potentially help to reduce the unnecessary use of antibiotics, which fuels the emergence and spread of superbugs.
Understanding public perception on why antibiotics are misused and what they know about antibiotic resistance, will help to customize the Antibiotics and Superbugs Awareness Campaign to fulfill gaps in knowledge and improve practice.
  Risks & Challenges Producing an educational video in a very creative and impactful manner can be challenging, particularly when explaining a very complicated scientific issue such as antimicrobial resistance. When our target is achieved, we will be working with professional storytellers and animators to produce a video that will be effective, yet easily understood by all.

  Other Ways You Can Help Visiting our page means a lot!!!
You can still help us achieve our goal by spreading the word about our campaign through social media networks with your friends and family.

story:
Thomas Helton is my hero. He is donating a kidney to me, Kevin Patton. I am calling on you, my friends and family because we are artists and teachers and although we both have careers and insurance this process is incredibly expensive. I want to do whatever I can to help ease the burden on him as he gives me the gift of life.

By contributing to this campaign you are helping Thomas save my life. Thank you. Thank you from Carmen, my partner of 20 years. Thank you from Cuauhtémoc, my four-year-old son and thank you from Itzel, my one-year-old daughter. Thank you from my students, thank you from the people who have enjoyed my music, thank you from all those I may touch with my work.

In 2006 I was diagnosed with IGA Nephropathy. This is a genetic immune system disorder that attacks the glomeruli, the small capillaries in the kidney that filter the blood. Although I took a variety of medication and endured two grueling courses of IV immunosuppressive drugs nothing worked. My nephrologist at the time, Charles Zacham, finally said to me, "Kevin yours are not the kind of kidneys we try to save." 

Transplant is the only option for me.

 My kidneys were operating at less than 10% from 2012 until they failed completely in 2014. I have been on dialysis ever since.

Although this has been a challenging time, I feel very fortunate to have a community of support and a friend like Thomas. We have known each other since 1996 when we were both working musicians in the Houston jazz scene. When I told him about my desperate situation he did not hesitate to volunteer. He is a true hero, a man of such integrity and generosity. I am humbled by his kindness.  

We are asking to raise $15,000.00. I feel that this may seem like a lot, but the procedure is taking place at the New York Presbeterian/Weill Cornell Medical Center, the transplant center for my region. For example, his stay at the Helmsley Medical Tower, the hospital housing, may cost up to $9000 if he needs an entire month to recover. We are expecting it to take at least three weeks before Thomas can go home. He and his wife Veronica's travel from Houston will cost approximately $1000.00.  Then there is his and Veronica's lost wages. This totals another estimated $8000 for a month of not working.

We are asking for your support, but we know that times are tight and resources are scarce so we would like to offer you an array of gifts as tokens of our profound appreciation for your generosity. These come not only from the work of Thomas and myself, but also from the studios of fellow creatives including visual artists, improvisers, composers, sculptors and social practice artists.  The objects offered here reflect the broad sphere of influence that Thomas and I have had on an international community of makers. Perhaps these gifts might serve as mementos of the life you have helped to save.

story:
Who I am?

My work as photographer and digital artist started in 2011. Step by step I found and improved my own skills with Photoshop and since the town where I live is not rich of locations, I started with digital artworks. I'm focusing a lot on the Digital art world and on photomanipulation, since in Italy this kind of art is not known at best. I've made many different kind of digital art: historical, fantasy, horror, fashion and portrait, but my favourites are : Medieval, Victorian, Roman. When I make some shots with a model, I know what I want, in fact all my shootings are very quick. I prefer to spend on Photoshop about 3-4 hours to make a retouching or to create the surrounding, but I want a perfect picture on camera.


What I Need ?

Unfortunately after 5 years, my Canon is dead. After 650K pics, the mirror is broken.
So, Photography is my "job", but I can't buy another camera because my budget is low. I spent all my free time to help another photographers all over the world to improve their Photoshop Skills with Videotutorials on Youtube and Facebook, but now I need your help. if you want to see my other works and tutorials please join my campaign.


What you'll received ?

If I'll get enough money for a new reflex I'll be able to take new shots and  Stocks, Videotutorials, and I'll can help other photographers and digitalartist.

story:
Nepal Earthquake

On Saturday April 25th, a magnitude 7.8 earthquake shook the small Himalayan country of Nepal, wreaking devastation on its people, its land, and its cultural heritage buildings. The death toll continues to rise, and even more are left injured, hungry, and homeless. This is a long-term disaster - even once rescue efforts are complete, there lie perhaps 5 years of rebuilding ahead, leaving Nepal in need of serious ongoing aid. 
As you may know, I spent 6 years living in Nepal, and still think of it as home in many ways. It is heartbreaking to see the people I grew up with watch their country literally crumble. I am so in awe of their continued strength, hope, and commitment to helping their communities. I cannot be there in person, but I can do my part to help those communities in any way I can. Which brings me to the running bit. 

The Running Bit

I am committing to running 100 km over the month of May, keeping track of my progress using a running app on my phone, and posting frequent updates to ensure I'm holding up my end of the bargain. In exchange, I ask YOU to sponsor this ambitious feat. Any little bit helps, so if you have not yet donated to Nepal, or are willing and able to help just a little bit more, please do. 

The Impact

All funds will be donated to Save the Children Canada, an international charity that has been working in Nepal since 1976 and is therefore exceptionally positioned to offer help. Their Nepal earthquake relief fund will go towards:

  • Life-saving medical care
  • Clean water and urgently-needed food
  • Temporary shelter and protection for children
10% of contributions will be put aside by Save the Children to prepare for future disasters. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you just can't contribute at this time, and that's okay, but that doesn't mean you can't help - 

Help get the word out - please share this page with your friends and family!

Or if you would rather donate directly to a charity, please consider Save the Children or CARE, both excellent and reputable organizations. 

And thank you so much for your support!

story:
About Me

I healed from depression & anxiety and now I am passionate & committed to helping others heal. My healing journey has taken me around the country and abroad, giving me a background of experience and knowledge I can now share with others. Becoming a life coach will empower me to serve others using the unique blend of skills I’ve acquired plus the latest, hottest techniques for living a happy, purposeful life. 

 

WHY THIS IS IMPORTANT

Skills to be happy, peaceful & successful are not taught in schools the way that math and science are. Coaching gives people the tools to revolutionize the way they think & interact with themselves and others so that life is more satisfying, healthy & joyful. 

It is vital that people learn these skills. Addressing problems in families, communities & the world will be much easier if people have a solid grounding in practical skills of joy & health. 

I am very concerned about the amount of violence in our country & world- especially amongst teens. We have a lot of work to do as a people to learn to treat each other with unconditional respect & love. Coaching is a way to teach people to live more lovingly towards themselves and, naturally, that love flows to others. 

I have been practicing coaching for a year using tools that I've gained over years of working with coaches, counselors & healing artists. I am ready to commit to a thorough training that will guide me to coach on a professional level. 

 

WHAT I HOPE TO ACHIEVE

Short term Goal

I intend to work with individuals and small groups to transform their relationship with joy & their dreams so that they can achieve both more often & more easily. 

FUN FACTS

Average goal achievement rate is 30-50%, with a coach goal achievement rates skyrocket to 95%. 

Heart disease is the NUMBER ONE cause of death in the US amongst adults. Numerous studies in the US &  Europe are showing that happiness drastically decreases the risk for heart disease. In a Columbia University study, "researchers found that the happiest people were 22% less likely to develop heart disease over the 10 years of follow-up." Other studies show this number to be closer to 35%.

 

Long Term Goals

I intend to establish a fruitful coaching practice and support myself through graduate school. 

I intend to design a healing modality that combines art & drama with life coaching. This would be an alternative to art/drama therapy that uses coaching techniques rather than therapeutic ones.

I intend to start a coaching program for tweens & teens as they are coming of age so that they can traverse adolescence with the best practices for empowerment & self-determination.

 

What I Need 

$7000 Tuition- 8 month training program*

$850 Certification fee- includes listing on Martha Beck's website & quarterly continuing education classes

$1000 Website & Branding 

$500 Campaign fees

_______________________

 $10,000 total

 

*to see more specifics about Martha Beck's coach training program visit:http://marthabeck.com/become-a-coach/

 

What You Get

Contributing to this campaign will increase your own well-being and happiness!

Check out this great article "Generosity, What's in it for you?" that reveals the health & financial benefits of generosity! 

"Like a healthy diet, exercise, and good genes, generosity may increase your life span."

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/lisa-firestone/generosity-benefits_b_2168059.html

 

In addition to the biological benefits of generously contributing to this campaign, you will receive uplifting, inspiring gifts that will remind you of your power & ability to create the life you want. 

At $75 or higher you will be directly supported to achieve your dreams through coaching that will make a powerful impact on your health, attitude, relationships, career & finances. 

Look to the right for more detail!

There is another session of this program that starts in September- so if I don't reach the goal this time, I will put your money into a savings account and I will keep working at raising funds and enroll in the fall.

If I receive MORE than $10,000, the money will be put towards developing and growing my coaching business. This will include training as a Theater of the Oppressed Facilitator, writing a book, creating a Full-Bodied Joy clothing line & jewelry, working with a high-end business coach and further developing the website, webinars and online classes. 

 

The Impact

"No problem can be solved from the same level of consciousness that created it."

-Albert Einstein

Problems- whether personal or global- are up in our faces every day. We cannot solve these problems unless we change the way we think, feel & behave. Staying in the same cycle of thought, feeling and behavior just creates more of the same. Life coaching specifically targets & transforms dysfunctional cycles so that people & life can change on a fundamental level.

My micro-goals as a coach are to empower people to:

  1. Achieve their dreams
  2. Make a difference in their community
  3. Relate better with their families
  4. Cultivate unconditional self-love

My macro-goals as a coach are to:

  1. Contribute to a society of empowered, creative, happy, healthy people
  2. End cycles of self-abuse that turn into abuse of others & the environment
  3. Redefine business and money exchange to mean authentic service, joy, integrity, gratitude & unconditional abundance. To take the “self-compromise” element OUT of making money.
  4. Awaken the innate creativity & genius in people so they can apply their ideas and passions to remedy the greatest problems we face: poverty, violence, addiction, abuse of our environment, emotional poverty

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help.

Think of anyone you know who values:

  • NATURAL HEALING
  • LIVING THEIR BEST LIFE
  • SUSTAINABILITY- emotionally, spiritually, physically & environmentally
  • THRIVING: JOYFUL, CREATIVE, EMPOWERED LIVING
  • HEALING DEPRESSION & ANXIETY
  • CREATING A HAPPIER, HEALTHIER WORLD

Share this campaign with them.

A email or facebook message about why you're sharing this is always nice. Make it personal!

Another way to contribute: Continue living your best life! The more positivity & inspiration there is out there, the easier it will be for all of us to thrive!

 

More About Me

Education                          

B.A. Emotional, Spiritual, Physical & Environmental Sustainability

B.A. Performing Arts

The Evergreen State College, 2009

 

Current Work                          

I currently work at The Rejuvenation & Performance Institute at Grace Grove Lifestlye Center in Sedona, AZ with several other healers from different modalities helping people through full body detoxes to create life free from pain and medication.

The coaching practice I’ve been building over the past year is:

Full-Bodied Joy Coaching You can see more about this work at: http://fullbodiedjoy.wordpress.com  

 

Past Work Experiences           

Food & Wellness Manager & Musician- Soulscape Theater Project  

Assistant to the Director, Volunteer & Event Coordinator, Graphic Designer- Songwriting Works Educational Foundation “Restoring Health & Community through Music”

Small Business Co-Owner- Piel de Miel Organic Bath & Body Products    

Community health & sustainability volunteer- Cross Cultural Solutions-  Ghana , W. Africa

 

Additional Education & Apprenticeships                         

Grief Ritual Facilitator Apprentice

Divine Openings Guide & Physical Healer Initiation

200hr Hatha Yoga Teacher's Training

Healing with whole foods & Ayurveda Apprenticeship

The Compassionate Listening Project Training

Wealthy Goddess Coaching Program with Kendra Thornbury

Art & Drama Therapy, Improv Theater, Playback Theater & Theater of the Oppressed

Sound Healing

Expressive Arts: Writing, Performing Arts, Costuming, Singing, Dancing, Drumming

story:
Imagine, every three days, having to travel down bumpy roads in Ethiopia for several hours, to be hooked up to machines to have your blood filtered. Now imagine that you used to tirelessly serve the people of your country, but now are hard pressed to have the energy to enjoy your young children. Tezera Mengesha is a man in his mid forties in desperate need of a kidney transplant, and we want to help him get back to his life of helping others.

Tezera Mengesha was born in 1967 in the Town of Nefas Mewucha, in the District of Lai Gayint in South Gondar Zone, Amhara Region, Ethiopia. He lives in the City of Bahir Dar with his wife and 12 year old daughter.

After he graduated from high school, Tezera served his country as a soldier until he became a water professional. His work and passion is to provide clean water to the needy in rural and remote areas of Ethiopia. Tezera used his motorbike as a means of transportation to access remote areas tirelessly, without being concerned about his health and safety. For his hard work and contribution to the rural communities, the government gave him several awards and even sent him abroad to gain knowledge and develop his expertise in rural water supply and sanitation. Based on his experience and dedication to help the rural communities, Tezera was promoted to a Deputy Manager Level at the local Agricultural Office.

Recently, Tezera became sick and was diagnosed with dual kidney failure. He receives dialysis treatment every three days at a cost of 2000 Ethiopian Birr (~$110 USD.) To put this sum in context, Ethiopia is one of the world’s poorest countries: the average Ethiopian monthly salary is $370 USD (World Bank). Tezera did not have savings, and like most Ethiopian’s relies on the monthly salary he receives from the government to support his family.  

The Ethiopian Black Lion Hospital recommended that Tezera have a kidney transplant as a long term solution. The kidney transplant would be done at Apollo Hospital in New Delhi, India at a cost of $33,000 USD. Tezera’s younger brother, Mulat Mengesha, is willing to donate one of his kidneys. So far, dialysis costs have been covered by stretched family members, relatives, and close friends. However, it is impossible for Tezera to raise $33,000 USD for his kidney transplant. Like all of his family members and friends, we are worried and concerned that Tezera would die soon unless he gets a kidney transplant as he cannot keep up with the dialysis cost every three days.

We are a group of friends in Ethiopia and Canada who decided to try to help Tezera by fundraising through Crowdrise. Our goal is to raise $40,000 USD to cover expenses for the kidney transplant and additional expenses like transportation and accommodation, including sending his brother to India for the kidney transplant.

With the help of God and your generosity we can save Mr. Tezera’s life. Please follow the link below for your donation (whatever amount) and send the link to friends who wish to contribute. The funds raised will be transferred directly to Tezera’s bank account in Ethiopia.

On behalf of Tezera’s friends and family, we thank you for your donation from the bottom of our hearts.

Haile, P.Eng. (a friend and former supervisor of Tezera when I was in Ethiopia, currently lives in Canada)

story:
More enduringly than any other sport, wrestling teaches self-control and pride. Some have wrestled without great skill - none have wrestled without great pride

- Dan Gable

 

Wrestling makes the world a better place. Not only does wrestling, more than any other sport, teach pride and self control, but it empowers our youth with character traits such as accountability, discipline, work ethic, and sportsmanship. If you are a wrestling fan, parent, or you have endured the blood, sweat and tears that come with stepping onto the mat to compete, then you know how important wrestling is for our youth and the world.

 

The Shasta Wolves Wrestling Team is kicking off this fundraising campaign to help with our travel, accommodations, competitions, and training costs. We hope you will see our vision and want to help our wrestlers achieve their goals.

 

Though we’ve had a team for many years, we are seeing a renewed enthusiasm and are excited to be grooming a lineup of young wrestlers LOADED with potential. Over the past two years, our wrestlers have shown exponential improvements and expect the forward motion to continue as we build our burgeoning team into a North State powerhouse and source of Shasta High School pride. Several of our wrestlers are aiming to make their marks by placing top four in The North Section Masters tournament, an honor forever remembered on the Shasta Wrestling Wall of Fame.

 

It is our goal to build a team that can compete on the state level. In order to achieve this, we must go where competition is fiercest --and that means traveling to compete with top notch teams and athletes. We have planned a challenging schedule for the 2013-14 season that will include tournaments in Reno, Sacramento, Lemoore, and Bakersfield.

 

Of course, this costs money. And unfortunately, we are not immune to the deep funding cuts from school districts and athletic programs. So, we need your help.

 

Our goal is to raise $10,000. This would fund our program for two years and allow us to focus on year- round training and state level competitions. ALL money raised will go directly to travel, accommodation, tournament entry fees, and training costs including practice gear and other needs the district will not cover.

 

As coach and former wrestler myself, I can confidently say that not a day passes when I do not draw upon a lesson or skill I learned in the Shasta High School Wrestling Room.

 

Alumni Wrestlers, if you are fortunate enough to have found success in life, and you can look back and attribute a small part of that success to Shasta Wrestling, please consider making a donation to help our up and coming generation of Wolves.

 

If you are a family member, friend, wrestling fan, or just a fan of high school sports, and you have seen the positive affects athletics has on our youth, please help by making a donation to our program. Help us continue the tradition of pride, integrity, and excellence that IS Shasta Wrestling!

 

THE PACK IS BACK!

 

Perks: Any donation, large or small, will be GREATLY appreciated. However, we have built in some perks for donations exceeding certain levels.

 

  • Bronze: $100 - $499 – You will receive our 2014 “The Pack is Back” Shasta Wrestling T-shirt

  • Silver: $500- $999- You will receive our 2014 Shasta Wrestling Spirit Pack including a t shirt, shorts, hoodie, sweatpants and a backpack

  • Gold: $1000+ You will become an official sponsor of our home dual meets and tournaments. We will print your name on our Shasta Wrestling Banner and recognize you or your business at all of our home events. In addition, we will include the above Spirit Pack.

story:
My name is Jennifer Swalwell Sun and
I’m a licensed health coach and wellness entrepreneur. I began my career as a molecular biologist and have spent the last 13 years in medical sales and business development.

In 2009, I purchased a medical spa, Serenity Zone Medical Spa,
in Olney, Maryland and began my journey in wellness. Wellness has become my passion,but I have not had the opportunity to help my home community.

I would like to spend 6 months helping residents of Bad Axe, Michigan by hosting health and wellness fairs,offering free corporate and community wellness seminars on healthy eating habits, and most importantly, offering one-on-one and group wellness coaching.

This campaign is important to me because residents in my home community do not have access to wellness resources that are available in most major metropolitan areas. If they don’t have access
to enough quality resources now, when will they? If it’s meant to be, it’s up to me! I will make this happen so my parents, friends, and hometown residents will have access to quality wellness education and nutritional support at a price they can all afford-FREE!!

Contributors will help me reach an under-served community that badly needs wellness education. Adults and children will benefit from wellness education that will serve generations to come. Most
importantly, we will inspire people who have lost hope about their health. We’ll educate and energize people to live healthy and vital lives rather than give up and have no hope.

I also hope to empower and inspire members of this community to join me on my wellness crusade to create a ripple effect of wellness across the State of Michigan and across the USA. We do not have enough doctors, nurses, dietitians and health coaches to help all of the
people who are in need of wellness and disease prevention education. I hope my project will serve as a success model for other health care providers and health coaches to PROVE that together, we can be healthy and have thriving communities of vital citizens.

  • I am seeking $250,000 for the following:

  • 2 FREE Huron County wellness events with paid wellness
         speakers, vendors, and demonstrations

  • FREE One-on-one and health coaching for up to 2500
         people.

  • FREE Corporate Event Health Coaching for Employers

  • Travel and lodging expenses for myself, additional
         health coaches that may be retained to meet demand, and for health fair
         speakers/guests.

Why me?

Why NOT me?

I’ve had big dreams and goals my entire life. In high school, I had a dream to work on the Human Genome Project at the
National Institutes of Health with Francis Collins (my idol). I accomplished that goal by the age of 21 and am a published scientist with Dr. Collins.

I had a dream to own my own medical spa in a small community to deliver best in class 5-star skincare and wellness services. I’ve owned my medical spa for 4 years and it is a 5-star business (just ask Google!).

 

Now is the time to reach my next goal. My goal is to continue to give back as a health coach in the community where I grew up and where my parents still live.

 

Can I inspire other health coaches to return to their home towns to take on the challenge of helping their communities? Yes! Do their home towns have a name as
cool as Bad Axe? Well…no, sorry.

Other Ways You Can Help
 

  • If you cannot make a donation, please spread the word
         and make some noise about this campaign.

  • Do you like to Volunteer? We’ll need lots of volunteers
         at the health fairs!

  • Do you own a grocery store or small farm in Huron County? We’ll need small raw whole food donations for food preparation demonstrations (raw food “cooking” lessons, juicing lessons, smoothie making lessons).

 

Are you a graduate of Bad Axe High School? If so, please email me with your graduation year. The graduating class with the greatest contribution will be given special recognition at the end of the campaign. Step 1: Donate Step 2: Email the amount of your contribution along with the year of your graduation from BAHS to Jennifer_Swalwell@hotmail.com

Class Competition Update as of 9/4/14

$120 Class of 1984 Donations

$50 Class of 1994 Donations

story:
Our Story

Hi, my name is Deke Wright and I am an Iraq war veteran that just recently started a BBQ sauce company with my father. Let me tell you a little about how this all started. Through the years of my childhood I was blessed to have a mother that loved to cook. One of those recipes that she enjoyed making for the family and many of the friends that begged for it was our "secret" family BBQ sauce recipe. This amazing recipe was handed down to her from her father. He made her promise to never give the recipe away and I made the same vow to my mother. Throughout the years we always wondered and pondered over the idea of making and bottling this product to sell publicly but never took that leap. In September of 2009, my mother went to the E.R. for an emergency  appendectomy and was diagnosed with Stage 4 colon cancer. She began aggressive chemotherapy treatments and fought this cancer to the best of her ability. After only 3 months of fighting cancer she lost her battle on January 3, 2010. I have since then tried to start this company from the ground up in her memory. I plan on getting this BBQ sauce into retailers nationwide. We would also like to expand on our line of sauces and add some BBQ rubs. By doing so I also want to help raise money for the Colon Cancer Alliance and help fund my mother's memorial scholarship the Tina Wright Memorial Art Scholarship for Breckenridge, TX High School students that want to further their education in the field of Art. 

The Impact

Our family had to learn about this cancer the hard way first hand. I want this cause to be heard nationwide. There are too many people out there that do not understand colon cancer and the steps to prevent it or survive it. You can help us in this fight and bring this to the national spotlight. Colon cancer is the second most deadly of all cancers. Colon and rectal cancer took the lives of 268,783 people between 2003 and 2007. According to the Mayo Clinic, colorectal cancer was expected to kill more than 51,000 people in 2010. My mother was one of those people. When we reach our goal I will be able to reach out to more retailers and distributors. This money will also help with my marketing and advertisement funds (as of now I am under capitalized). With my sauce making it into more stores around Texas and hopefully nationwide. Someday, I will be able to donate more and more of my profit to the Colon Cancer Alliance. I have been working with the CCA in the design of my label by adding their logo to it. I will also be able to raise the scholarship total and be able to hand out more than one scholarship yearly. By reaching this goal I will be able to expand my customer base and help bring awareness to this preventable, treatable and beatable cancer. With your help we can do this!

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for $15,000 to help bring this company's nose above water. I was under capitalized to begin with and this money will be used towards getting an E-Commerce website designed and launched. I will also be able to get product pictures taken professionally and ads placed online in various blogs, magazines, and print. I will also work towards expanding on this recipe to create new flavors of BBQ Sauce. If my goal is not reached I will use the money to better my company. I will fulfill all of the perks and incentives given to every contributor. Our top contributors will have the chance to help design labels and taste new sauces being developed even have the opportunity to have the sauce named after them!


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help spread the word about our company and this campaign. Also check out and "like" our Facebook page "www.facebook.com/dwbbq"  and our website "http://www.dwbbq.com". Don't forget to share this with all of your friends! Thank you for your time!

story:
Short Summary

 I want to start a foundation in the name and memory of my mother. This foundation's purpose will be to raise awareness on the benefits of medical cannabis and more specifically, Rick Simpson Oil for virtually any disease. We will also raise money for medical marijuana growing operations to supply patients with medicine at little to no charge, and financial assistance for those that are devastated by the extreme cost of western medicine. I really want this to happen as I believe I, along with the help of others, can save many lives and bring a quality of life that is unattainable by living in a hospital being given horrible pharmaceuticals. I have spent my fair share of time in hospitals and I can say it is not at all a comfortable, fun environment. This will take a lot of work but I believe I can do this, and it will be well worth it.

story:
Hi There!!

We're the Saddlers. I'm Wendy, and my hubby is Ricky. We are both Bible Believing Born Again Christians, who could really use your help. Thanks to several injuries that have taken place over the years, I have Degenerative Disc Disease, spondolytis, Spondolothesiosis, and painful nerve issues, which means I can no longer work. My Hubby, Ricky may possibly have Prostate cancer, is the ONLY one working, so I have had no choice but to apply for disability (SSI).

The judge on ths matter will approve this, but only if he sees a RECENT MRI and/or an EMG of my neck, shoulder, and arms. I am going back before the judge by no later than Spetember, and if I can get either of these tests done, and he sees the condition Iam in, he will approve me for SSI. In the meantime, Ricky is undergoing treatment for an Enlarged Prostate, and he's going to have to undergo a biopsy, which is not a thrill to him, but he knows he needs it. Problem is that these tests/treatments cost LOTS of $$$, and since we have NO insurance, we need help and help now.This is where I need the Lord the most, and I believe that He could very well use you to assist us in this endeavor, which is why I am reaching out to all of you.

If I can get $500, or more before September, and get these tests done, you would be greatly used of the Lord to help me out. (If you have any typing work that needs to be done, I have experience doing research for blogs, office work, and typing up resumes, so maybe we can work something out in this area. I also hae some cool stuff on E-Bay that needs to be sold, so I will post the links here.

 

My husband is a Professionally Ranked tennis Instructor with the PTR, and is available for lessons within the PA /NJ area: in particular the lower bucks county, Trenton, Cherry Hill Southeast PA areas.) Once I am able to get these tests done, I can get my disability, and hopefully  help my hubby with his health issues.

If anyone out there wishes to help, PLEASE feel free to do so, and do so generously.

THANKS!! :D

If I can get $500, or more before September, and get these tests done, you would be greatly used of the Lord to help me out. (If you have any typing work that needs to be done, I have experience doing research for blogs, office work, and typing up resumes, so maybe we can work something out in this area. I also hae some cool stuff on E-Bay that needs to be sold, so I will post the links here.
 
 My husband is a Professionally Ranked tennis Instructor with the PTR, and is available for lessons within the PA /NJ area: in particular the lower bucks county, Trenton, Cherry Hill Southeast PA areas.) Once I am able to get these tests done, I can get my disability, and hopefully  help my hubby with his health issues.
If anyone out there wishes to help, PLEASE feel free to do so, and do so generously.
THANKS!! :D

story:
We are in need of your help:

As many of you are already aware, the pregnacy with our first baby has been rough. In recent weeks I have had to go on moderate bedrest due to high blood pressure, early contractions and significant swelling. Because of this and the inability to walk around for more then a few hours per day, I am no longer able to work full time. We are in desperate need of help with one thing. The birth of our baby girl. Eric is working everyday to keep our bills up to date but we are finding it difficult to pay for the birth itself. The birth is going to cost $3000.00. It is very hard to ask for help in this form but here I am. Every dime will be forever appreciated.

Thank you,

Emily and Eric
