story:
Our Project

In sporting circles, its suggested that sports performance is 95% physical and 5% mental; but its the 5% mental that can cause us 95% of the problems.

You might have your own experiences of mental issues getting in the way of your best sporting performance. Our own personal experiences include:

  • being super-anxious before a game
  • lacking confidence in our own ability 
  • losing motivation part-way through a season 
  • struggling to return to competition after a serious knee injury 

Some of these might be familiar to you too? Other common issues might present themselves as:

  • missing an easy golf putt
  • displays of over-aggression on the field
  • losing focus and dropping an easy catch
  • struggling to cope with 1st team selection

It is well known that sports people who develop mental skills are more successful in their chosen sport and we are building a website which will inform and assist people to deal with their mental issues and reach their full potential, no matter what sport or what level. Our site makes understanding mental skills, their benefits and their application much easier for the everyday sports person.

This is why we're building ithinksport.

In our online "mental gym" sports people will be able to identify some of the common issues that they struggle with in sport and learn some new techniques to help overcome them. These techniques include such things as imagery, self-talk, relaxation and goal-setting among others. They will also be able to take some online tests to help identify some of their issues and to measure success of using the techniques over time. We're presenting these website features in a light, modern and interactive way so that people can connect with the content easily and feel confident about trying out the various techniques. 

About Us

"I'm Nico Kolokythas and I have an MSc in Applied Sport & Exercise Science, a BA in Psychology and a BA in Business. I'm also an accredited Strength and Conditioning Coach and I regularly work with elite athletes in my role at a University in the UK. I'm also a Head Coach of a Men's University Basketball team. I have a passion for sport and I practice Wing Chung Kung Fu. I'm really excited about the ithinksport project as I know from my own personal and work experience that this site will really make a difference."

"I'm Ali Mahoney and I also have an MSc in Applied Sport & Exercise Science and a BA in Sport Studies. I'm currently doing an MSc in Applied Sport Psychology at a University in the UK. I have worked in sport for many years and have recently been teaching Sport Studies at a college in Malta. Nico and I have been developing this project for a couple of years and are now ready to bring it to life. I really wish I had access to a website like this when I was competing in sport as it would definitely have helped me with a number of issues that I didn't even know I had."

Find out more about us on our LinkedIn profiles: Nico & Ali and follow us on Twitter.

Where are we now?

We've been working with a web developer and graphic designer to build the framework and the layouts for the Alpha version of our site. So far we've funded this from our own pockets and from winning a small business competition. 

Now we just need to fund the final coding to go live and launch to bring our content, layouts and tests to life. Other news is that we've partnered up with a local organisation called CEMAS who will be building a mobile app for us for FREE once the site is live! 

For the academics out there, here is a great article from two Canadian Sport Psychologists on the potential for delivering mental skills training online.

So, if you believe that knowledge about the benefits of mental skills should be more widely available to sports men and women across the world then please back us!

Rewards

We hope you will be inspired by our project and be tempted with our great rewards including some awesome limited edition clothing. No matter how big or small your contribution to this project, you will be helping us to make a difference to the performance of many sports men and women.

ithinksport tshirt
ithinksport polo shirt
 
 
ithinksport hoody

Risks and Challenges

Any project has risks so we understand that you might be reluctant to part with your money to support us. Let's take a quick look at what could realistically go wrong:

- Nico and I could fall out 
- We might not build the site in time 
- It might cost us more than we've estimated to finish building the site

Nico and I have been friends and work colleagues for over 10 years. There are not many people we would choose to work with, so we feel that we're totally solid as a team and on the same wavelength.

Its well known in web development that things always take longer than planned. We've learned a lot in the past couple of years about what goes into building a site like this but with our great web developer and graphic designer we're certain and he's certain that the site can be finished within our set time frame.

Again, cost estimations for website builds can dramatically increase as time progresses and as plans change. However, we've nailed down exactly what needs to be done for the Alpha version launch and are sure that this funding will do the job.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not in a position to make a financial pledge for the project please use the share tools to help promote our site to your friends, colleagues, co-workers and anyone you think might be interested. Alternatively you might want to drop us a line if you think there are other ways that we can find support for our project. It would be great to hear from you!

story:
Who We Are and What We Do

Hyer-United is a humanitarian organization with the stated mission of providing medical support to doctors and nurses in rural regions of the Republic of Artsakh where even the most basic medical supplies are unavailable. Through a partnership of a network of health professionals in the greater Los Angeles area and Armenia, we provide medical supplies to various disadvantaged regions of the Republic of Artsakh.

The Republic of Artsakh is an independent nation in the southern Caucuses with an Armenian majority that fought and won a deadly independence war from 1988 to 1994 that cost 30,000 lives. Due to total military blockade, today its economy is largely based on aid provided by the Republic of Armenia, which itself is under heavy economic constraints. It has grave deficiencies in most basic areas of need including medicine. Though it has an incredibly strong willed population, it is also significantly dependent on organizations like ours for its continuous survival. 

We are a grassroots organization without any ties to any political, religious, or other community organization. Our only mission is to help the most vulnerable segment of the population in our native Armenia and Artsakh.

Our members include members from various other non-profit Armenian community organizations, including members of the Unified Young Armenians, Homenetmen, and Armenian Students' Association.

You can see the successful and transparent results from a recent project, led by several of our members, focused on a different region of Armenia; Shirak: http://igg.me/at/gyumri

Below you can see the results of our several months of work from our organization when we sent our most recent package of medical supplies. With your help, we are hoping to repeat this effort on a much grander scale


What We Need From You

Through our partnerships with various medical professionals and local pharmacies, we are able to receive much of our supplies for free or highly discounted prices. Our main costs include our shipping cost and the cost to cover some of the items that we get for low, subsidized prices. What we need from you is help in bridging the gap, in covering the above mentioned costs.
Your donations in their entirety will cover our costs directly related to sending these medical supplies, and they will be spent in the uttermost efficient manner. We personally cover almost all operation costs out of pocket, ensuring all our fundraising efforts go are directly into buying and shipping supplies.
In the same manner demonstrated in the previous mentioned Gyumri Education Fund campaign, every step of our operation will be taken in the most transparent manner.
Every Donor, regardless of amount donated, will receive a financial breakdown, and well as photographs of how our funds were spent.

Our most recent Shipping Costs: A total of $213.97 Shipping costs

Current Shipment
A sample of our most recent donations, waiting funding for shipping, to be send to the Republic of Artsakh


The Difference You are Making
In your efforts to contribute to this worthy cause, you are helping one of the most vulnerable, war torn, and militarized regions on the entire globe.
You are helping a population that lacks some of the most basic everyday needs. The help you will be providing will not be simply improving the difficult lives of the local communities, rather it will be saving lives by providing supplies that otherwise would not exist in the region.

Geographical location of the primary hospital we are currently helping, located about 20 km outside of Berdzor, Artsakh Republic




Conditions of the primary hospital in the region which we are currently focusing on



Other Ways to Contribute
If you are currently unable to contribute financially, there are many other ways you can contribute:
1. If you able to supply us with any medical supplies or equipment, used or brand new, please contact us at: HyerunitedArmenia@gmail.com
2. Spread the word about our campaign and encourage others to join
3. Follow our Hyer-United Facebook Page to keep up with our various projects
4. Check out OneArmenia, a highly transparent and popular non profit organization focused on various important humanitarian projects in Armenia.

story:
For Every $85 Raised, We Will Match The Donation 1-for-1 By Giving An Additional Tool To Underfunded Fire Departments To Double The Impact Of Your Donations!

How You Can Help A Firefighter And Get Cool Gifts In The Process!

We are currently looking to raise as much money as we can to equip as many firefighters as possible with this simple yet effective tool. For every $85 we can put a tool in the hands of a firefight in North America. With your help, we can make every firefighter's job much safer and easier.

We have set our campaign threshold at $20 000 but there is no limit to how far we can take this crowdfunding campaign as we have the production capabilities to get a Snagger Tool in the hands of everyone who needs one!

We have set up exciting perks to make sure you can show the world you've helped a firefighter and so can they!

How Many Different Things Can The Snagger Tool Do?

See for yourself here:


A Brief History Of The Snagger Tool

The Snagger Tool was developed in 2007 to help make handling fire hose safer and more efficient. Since then, the tool has been re-engineered to be lightweight aluminum and has been tested by numerous firefighters in a wide range of challenging situations. We have launched a crowdfunding campaign to help raise awareness and equip firefighters across the continent with this simple and effective tool.

The Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign will allow us to train and equip many firefighters, helping to make a dangerous job safer. For individuals or organizations interested in donating $170 (cost of two tools) or more to the campaign, you can decide which city, Fire Department or individual will receive the tools you sponsored

With 39% of all fire fighter injuries occurring as a result of handling firehose the Snagger Tool makes the job much safer and easier. The tool is the Swiss army knife of firefighting; providing a quick and accessible solution to problems firefighters face on the ground every day. The goal of the this campaign is to provide as many Snagger Tools to Fire Departments as possible, with one being donated for every $85 raised.

What Makes The Snagger Tool Different?

What makes the Snagger Tool valuable is its ability to handle a variety of tasks, from handling hoses on ladders to breaking tempered glass, while being lightweight and readily available in a pocket at all times. In doing so, the firefighter can be prepared for multiple challenges that arise, while lowering workplace injuries.

Any and all your donations will be greatly appreciated and will go toward equipping and training firefighter with this simple, yet effective Tool. We'd like to extend a Thank You in advance for helping from the whole Snagger Tools team for any help you can provide!

If you are a firefighter interested in receiving a tool or a fire department that would like to sign up to be recipients of the tool, please contact us at the e-mail below to be registered on our list, it's first come first serve so sign up before it's too late!

E-mail: snaggertools@gmail.com

Or tweet at us @SnaggerTools

story:
$100 DONATIONS GET A FREE LIPSTICK!

We have just a few hours left to raise funds and we have more incentives!!!!! All supporters who donate at the $100 level will receive a free lipstick of our choice along with their original four shades of their choice. So help us spread the word and get closer to our goal. Every penny counts and no matter what our final number is, we're gonna work to take this show on the road. If you have already donated and want to increase your donation to get to $100, go for it and we will honor the free lipstick!    

All Lipstick selections are made at the end of the campaign via survey. We will reach out to you once our time runs out. For now, we still have a chance to raise the funds so please help by sharing! After all, sharing is caring. 

   

 Who We Are

The Lip Bar is a luxury cosmetic bar that caters to our consumer’s individuality through our highly pigmented and responsibly made products. We aim to encourage self-expression through beauty. The Lip Bar maintains the idea that beauty doesn’t have to compromise health. In that, our lipsticks offer a unique blend of natural ingredients like shea butter, avocado oil and jojoba oil, designed to moisturize, soften and amplify lips all while setting consumers apart with intoxicatingly bold colors.

 

Purple Rain

Femme Fatale


Infusing the allure of nightlife and the innocence of nature, The Lip Bar plays on lipstick indulgence with cocktail inspired cosmetics. Serving Top Shelf Beauty with long-lasting sultry hues, The Lip Bar offers naturally blended lip colors with a lavish product experience. Because we know that true beauty equals health, all of our products are blended with ingredients like shea butter, avocado oil, jojoba oil and vitamins A, E, C, and F that won’t only look good on, but provide value-added benefits like retained moisture and baby soft lips.

 

Vision: To become the most sought after boutique, cosmetic brand by eradicating stereotypes that beauty is one-size-fits-all.

 

Mission: To challenge the current standard of beauty by creating a lipstick experience that is unsurpassed in craftsmanship, quality and color.

Blue MF


Company History

 Determined to challenge the current standard of beauty, founder, Melissa Butler dreamt up the idea of The Lip Bar after being fed up with toxic and boring makeup. So she allowed her dreams to guide her and she began studying the chemistry of cosmetics. The goal was to create a product that was for the young and savvy but also for the health conscious consumer. Founded on the idea that women can be whoever they want to be, The Lip Bar launched in 2012 releasing 12 handmade bold and bright shades that allowed women to express themselves through beauty. Filled with some of the best ingredients found in nature, The Lip Bar reinforced the fact that beauty does not have to come with the price of health. The two ideals that lay the foundation of The Lip Bar come packaged in an intricately designed and environmentally friendly package to provide our patrons with the ultimate cosmetic experience. 

COCKTAILS ON THE ROCKS

Amaretto Sour

Purple Rain

Cosmo


Our Pledge  

We pledge to provide people with non-toxic cosmetics that will allow them to creatively express themselves.

We pledge to never test on animals.

We pledge to praise individuality.

We pledge to challenge the standard of beauty.

We pledge to make makeup fun!

We pledge to provide a cosmetic experience that is unlike any makeup you’ve ever experienced. And whichever one you have in mind, think of The Lip Bar times 1,000,000. Well maybe not that much but definitely times 3.7 (we like those numbers).

 

Virgin Cocktails

Gin-ger & Tonic

Baby Bellini

Chocolate Spritzer

Why We Need Help

With your help, we will be able to spread our idea of self-expressive and non-toxic makeup to women nationwide. We will get a Lip Bar Truck, and tour nationwide with our message of being comfortable enough to be yourself. With our self expressive products, we will encourage women every where to step into their own beauty and if wearing our products helps you do, that, then we have products just for you!

 

What YOUR Money Will Go Towards:





The Lip Bar is a cosmetic company that has lifestyle components. Based on the essence of a bar, we look to engage our patrons through a fun and free environment- as makeup should be. In order to spread our message of non-toxic cosmetics we want to get a Lip Bar Truck to serve up Top Shelf Beauty to people everywhere. With The Lip Bar truck we'll be able grant the ultimate cosmetic experience with our mobile cosmetic bar. Patrons will be able to get onto the Truck, try on product, make purchases and lounge in a fun space. We'll need the following to make that happen.

  • Used Truck
  • Implement Truck Renovations:
    • Bar Setup ( we want it to look like a bar, stools and all)
    • Storage within truck
    • Seating area within truck
    • Décor of truck
    • Branding on outisde of truck ( logo and website info)
    • Equipment to produce lipstick on the truck
    • Fees ( If we meet our goal, we have to pay the man first)

POWER TRIP 

DARK & STORMY

SCOTCH & SODA

VESPER

WHISKEY SOUR

BOURBON BLUES


Rewards

**FREE SHIPPING ON ALL ORDERS TO THE U.S.

Pick from one of these awesome "cocktails" to complete your makeup collection. They make great gifts and would be appreciated by any lady in your life. With a wide range of nudes, red, purple and even blue, we have something for everyone!  We've attached other pics to give you different views in different lighting.  See below for a color description of each.  

  1. Gin-ger & Tonic : Taupe
  2. Chocolae Spritzer: Light Brown 
  3. Amaretto Sour: Gorgeous Camel
  4. Baby Bellini: Pinkish Brown 
  5. Café au Lait: Whitish Nude with a hint of pink 
  6. Purple Rain: Purple 
  7. Femme Fatale: Fuschia  
  8. Cosmo: Red 
  9. Blue MF: Vibrant Blue 
  10. Whiskey Sour: Burnt Orange
  11. Scotch & Soda: Burgundy
  12. Vesper: Dark Pink
  13. Bourbon Blues: Navy
  14. Dark & Stormy: Charcoal

10-14

 

T SHIRTS WILL BE FROM SMALL TO 2XL. Please specify your size in your order.

 


Risks and Challenges

The Lip Bar is already a functioning, actively growing company— and while we've only been around a little over a year, the company has made its footprint in the sand by providing quality cosmetics to people who want to express themselves through beauty! The Lip Bar is a small business with big plans and we have yet to receive any injection of cash which is why we need your help to continuously grow! We don't want to go to a bank or pitch to someone who doesn't understand how the simple stroke of your lipstick can change your perspective.

Because we want to provide the very best experience to everyone we encounter, our products, our theme, heck our entire existence is based on the consumer. It's based on your being the very best YOU. So we provide high quality cosmetics that will allow your to celebrate your individuality and feel good about it.

And in order to spread our message, we think a mobile bar is not only cool but will do the job! Buying a used vehicle to go on a nationwide tour poses problems in terms of mechanical capabilities and costs. To prevent the unknown as much as possible, we are looking to purchase a certified used truck and to be super precautious, we’re going to have a mechanic further analyze the condition of the truck.

Lastly, because people already have their favorite cosmetic that they are loyal to, it would be remiss for us not to mention the commoditization of the cosmetics industry. We face this feat by not only providing a superior product in terms of quality, color and craftsmanship, we also provide an experience and a belief that is incomparable to any other cosmetic retailer.


Stay Connected With Us and Share our Campaign on the following channels

 

 Twitter

 Instagram

Facebook

 Pinterest


FAQ's

~How and when do I choose my rewards?

Thank you so much for donating to the campaign, if you're wondering how to let us know which reward you want, you may want to wait. We have a few tricks up our sleeves! As we reach different milestones, we will release new shades that you will be able to choose from.  So what we're saying is, you don't want to prematurely pick- you may miss out on potential colors. So we ask that you wait until the end of the campaign where all of the colors will be unlocked and you'll be able to choose which lippies you want. WE WILL SEND OUT A SURVEY VERIFYING LIP COLORS, T-SHIRT SIZES AND MORE AT THE END OF THE CAMPAIGN. UNTIL THEN, KEEP SHARING AND CHECKING FOR UPDATES.


Which cities will the Lip bar Mobile go to? 

Right now we are planning our tour but we know that if you all help us reach our goal, we will certainly be making stops in NYC, Philly, DC, Detroit, Chicago, Atlanta and we're working on adding LA, San Fran and Miami! Stay Tuned. 


When do I get my rewards?

At the end of the campaign, we will begin shipping your rewards.
story_txt:
$100 DONATIONS GET A FREE LIPSTICK!
We have just a few hours left to raise funds and we have more incentives!!!!! All supporters who donate at the $100 level will receive a free lipstick of our choice along with their original four shades of their choice. So help us spread the word and get closer to our goal. Every penny counts and no matter what our final number is, we're gonna work to take this show on the road. If you have already donated and want to increase your donation to get to $100, go for it and we will honor the free lipstick!    
All Lipstick selections are made at the end of the campaign via survey. We will reach out to you once our time runs out. For now, we still have a chance to raise the funds so please help by sharing! After all, sharing is caring. 
    Who We Are
The Lip Bar is a luxury cosmetic bar that caters to our consumer’s individuality through our highly pigmented and responsibly made products. We aim to encourage self-expression through beauty. The Lip Bar maintains the idea that beauty doesn’t have to compromise health. In that, our lipsticks offer a unique blend of natural ingredients like shea butter, avocado oil and jojoba oil, designed to moisturize, soften and amplify lips all while setting consumers apart with intoxicatingly bold colors.
 
Purple RainFemme Fatale



Infusing the allure of nightlife and the innocence of nature, The Lip Bar plays on lipstick indulgence with cocktail inspired cosmetics. Serving Top Shelf Beauty with long-lasting sultry hues, The Lip Bar offers naturally blended lip colors with a lavish product experience. Because we know that true beauty equals health, all of our products are blended with ingredients like shea butter, avocado oil, jojoba oil and vitamins A, E, C, and F that won’t only look good on, but provide value-added benefits like retained moisture and baby soft lips.
 
Vision: To become the most sought after boutique, cosmetic brand by eradicating stereotypes that beauty is one-size-fits-all.
 
Mission: To challenge the current standard of beauty by creating a lipstick experience that is unsurpassed in craftsmanship, quality and color.


Blue MF


Company History
 Determined to challenge the current standard of beauty, founder, Melissa Butler dreamt up the idea of The Lip Bar after being fed up with toxic and boring makeup. So she allowed her dreams to guide her and she began studying the chemistry of cosmetics. The goal was to create a product that was for the young and savvy but also for the health conscious consumer. Founded on the idea that women can be whoever they want to be, The Lip Bar launched in 2012 releasing 12 handmade bold and bright shades that allowed women to express themselves through beauty. Filled with some of the best ingredients found in nature, The Lip Bar reinforced the fact that beauty does not have to come with the price of health. The two ideals that lay the foundation of The Lip Bar come packaged in an intricately designed and environmentally friendly package to provide our patrons with the ultimate cosmetic experience. 
COCKTAILS ON THE ROCKS

Amaretto SourPurple Rain



Cosmo



Our Pledge  
We pledge to provide people with non-toxic cosmetics that will allow them to creatively express themselves.
We pledge to never test on animals.
We pledge to praise individuality.
We pledge to challenge the standard of beauty.
We pledge to make makeup fun!
We pledge to provide a cosmetic experience that is unlike any makeup you’ve ever experienced. And whichever one you have in mind, think of The Lip Bar times 1,000,000. Well maybe not that much but definitely times 3.7 (we like those numbers).
 

Virgin Cocktails

Gin-ger & Tonic
Baby Bellini


Chocolate Spritzer



Why We Need Help
With your help, we will be able to spread our idea of self-expressive and non-toxic makeup to women nationwide. We will get a Lip Bar Truck, and tour nationwide with our message of being comfortable enough to be yourself. With our self expressive products, we will encourage women every where to step into their own beauty and if wearing our products helps you do, that, then we have products just for you!
 


What YOUR Money Will Go Towards:







The Lip Bar is a cosmetic company that has lifestyle components. Based on the essence of a bar, we look to engage our patrons through a fun and free environment- as makeup should be. In order to spread our message of non-toxic cosmetics we want to get a Lip Bar Truck to serve up Top Shelf Beauty to people everywhere. With The Lip Bar truck we'll be able grant the ultimate cosmetic experience with our mobile cosmetic bar. Patrons will be able to get onto the Truck, try on product, make purchases and lounge in a fun space. We'll need the following to make that happen.

Used Truck
Implement Truck Renovations:


Bar Setup ( we want it to look like a bar, stools and all)
Storage within truck
Seating area within truck
Décor of truck
Branding on outisde of truck ( logo and website info)
Equipment to produce lipstick on the truck
Fees ( If we meet our goal, we have to pay the man first)


POWER TRIP 
DARK & STORMY


SCOTCH & SODA

VESPER
WHISKEY SOUR
BOURBON BLUES

Rewards
**FREE SHIPPING ON ALL ORDERS TO THE U.S.
Pick from one of these awesome "cocktails" to complete your makeup collection. They make great gifts and would be appreciated by any lady in your life. With a wide range of nudes, red, purple and even blue, we have something for everyone!  We've attached other pics to give you different views in different lighting.  See below for a color description of each.  

Gin-ger & Tonic : Taupe
Chocolae Spritzer: Light Brown 
Amaretto Sour: Gorgeous Camel
Baby Bellini: Pinkish Brown 
Café au Lait: Whitish Nude with a hint of pink 
Purple Rain: Purple 
Femme Fatale: Fuschia  
Cosmo: Red 
Blue MF: Vibrant Blue 
Whiskey Sour: Burnt Orange
Scotch & Soda: Burgundy
Vesper: Dark Pink
Bourbon Blues: Navy
Dark & Stormy: Charcoal


10-14


 
T SHIRTS WILL BE FROM SMALL TO 2XL. Please specify your size in your order.
 



Risks and Challenges




The Lip Bar is already a functioning, actively growing company— and while we've only been around a little over a year, the company has made its footprint in the sand by providing quality cosmetics to people who want to express themselves through beauty! The Lip Bar is a small business with big plans and we have yet to receive any injection of cash which is why we need your help to continuously grow! story:
With a mission to serve those less fortunate, and improve health conditions throughout Africa, the Medical Students Association of St. Christopher Iba Mar Diop Medical School has undertaken  a project to transform the Maternity Ward of the Philipe Maguilene Senghor Health Center  in Dakar, Senegal. 

Why is this project important? 

Childbirth in Africa

Our belief is that every woman deserves to give birth in a safe and nurturing environment.  However, too many women continue to give birth in unhygienic and stressfull conditions. Surviving childbirth is one thing, but too often women are left scarred by the traumatizing effects of their experience.  This is an aspect of maternal health that is mostly neglected yet deserves attention. 

Located in the suburban low-income district of Yoff, P.M.S Health Center serves over 5,000 women and newborn babies annually. It has increasingly become a key referral facilty for maternal health in Dakar, serving women within a  100km radius. It is run by a team of dedicated and highly qualified Ob/Gyn specialists, residents, midwives and medical students who have a passion for advancing maternal and reproductive health. 

Receiving little-to-no state funds, the health center struggles to meet the demands of the nearby populations in adequate health care. The maternity ward is often over-crowded (up to 20 births/day) and supplies are often lacking, leading to rough and unpleasant working condtions for patients and personnel. 

By contributing to this make-over project, you will be radically improving the birthing experience of these brave women and their babies.  

The renovation plans include giving a new life to the delivery room, newborn station, on-call room, consult room, and labor room: 

- New medical equipment and supplies

- Paint and decorations

- Labor assistance materials

In addition we will be training midwives to offer pre-natal preparatory courses.

story:
My name is David Haase. I find myself tasked with raising $196,000 for Electro Convulsive Therapy. I live just south of Denver, Colorado. Here is my story.

ECT(Electro Convulsive Therapy) is usually an elective treatment that can be given when traditional treatments such as medications and talk therapy have not worked. Currently, it has an 80% success rate. For 30 years(and that's just when I was diagnosed.)I fought the good fight against chronic clinical depression and acute anxiety. I'm running out of strength to fight.

It costs $196,000 for the first 3 month treatment. That is after what my insurancepays.

Over the last few years my Depression hasbecome chronic and pernicious. I have been unable to work for 6-7 years. I've tried every sort of medications and combination of medications. ECT seems to be my last option for relief. I have applied for Medicare and Medicaid but the hearings are 20 months away and I must be able to work before then or I would end up homeless.

I'm taking a big risk posting this for the public to see. My deal for my 2 boys custody with my ex-wife is only temporary(reviewed again in DEC). Also, my ex -wife's husband lives in Seattle. So if I can't get treatment by December when custody is reviewed my boys could end up in Seattle. I can't go into my symptoms here due to that reason. However, I can say that I spend most of my days in bed. My Anxiety is so acute I have trouble doing even simple tasks, like laundry or dishes. I have a great deal of difficulty just going to the grocery store, or anywhere else, for instance, my kid's actvities. I'm nearly totally agoraphobic.

For more information please contact me atECTFUNDRAISER@gmail.com. I also have a website, called Writers/Artists for ElectroConvulsiveTherapy Fundraiser that you can click on below. We feature up and coming writers and artists. If you would like to donate writings or Artwork, submit to the email above. We are a pg-13 website. We also give away books and prints for certain levels of donations.

If anyone can help me on Facebook, my name there is De Haase. I'm not having much success there, I would appreciate it.

 

I am also looking for a Prono Bono Attorney, Law Intern, or even law student to advise and probably run the fund.

If this fundraiser exceeds funds will be used for follow-up treatment and/or we will set up a fund for other folks that are in my situation.

story:
Summary

Hi all, Jamie French here...

I'd like to thank all of the contributors from my previous campaign! Thanks to your help I've successfully been able to  get the breast surgery I was raising money for and the results are just amazing!

This is my second and final campaign for the remaining surgeries I need to aid in the continuing therapy of my gender dysphoria.

  • All contributions are greatly appreciated and will be reward with "perks".

What I Need & What You Get

  • I'm trying to raise approximately $7000 within 60 days, every dime of which will go straight to my surgeon.
  • I'm offering "perks" for contributions... the more generous the donation, the more substantial the "perk".
  • My surgeon will take any amount I give him to hold on to until I've reached the total price of the procedure so every donations counts whether or not I reach my goal.

The Impact

FFS surgery involves any number of surgical procedures that help in the development of feminized features in a face with the naturally occurring traits of a males bone structure.

Specifically I'm raising money for rhinoplasty, (nose job) as well as decrease in the size of my chin and brow ridges.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help spread the word through Twitter, Facebook, or any other networking site.
  • Please feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools in order to help spread the word!

story:
Short Summary

Mike is a young professional who needs a haircut. Some potential benefits include:

  • It will look more professional for biz-nass meetings.
  • He won't have wings. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need money for Mike to get a really good haircut. We aren't talking your run-of-the-mill trim here. We're talking a full out wash, cut, and style. Complete with head massage. This man needs to relax. Here's what you'll get in return:

  • You won't have to look at his shaggy head anymore!
  • Our charity might actually raise money because he will be much better looking and more presentable to potential donors.

The Impact

I'm getting tired of typing. At this point, the benefits are clear, no?

Risks & Challenges

There's no way to know if the cut will be good until it's finished. That's why we asked for so much money-- in case we need to get him a follow-up trim.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Give Mike a high five, a pat on the back, or a warm hug the next time you see him!

story:
Hello, my name is James Celano and I am starting Ben's Buddies, a non-profit 501c3 organization in honor of my brother Ben.  Ben passed away at the age of 44 from colon cancer which had metastasized to his liver.  Ben fought the disease for 3 years, far longer than the doctors expected.  In the final analysis, it is believed that Ben lived so long because of the strong family and friend support network we were blessed to provide.

 

The purpose of the organization will be to bring "care packages" to children in the hospital who are suffering from cancer.  Each care package will include a doll from The Hope Collection. These dolls are made by BRATZ and are bald, giving children without hair a beautiful doll that they can identify with.  We will also be including a children's Bible along with handmade cards from kids ranging from 1st-8th grade.  The cards will be made by a local Christian Academy and the Bibles will be donated from the publishers.

 

We have long dreamed of helping children by bringing hope and a smile to the face of one who may have no reason to smile.  When my brother passed, we found our calling.

 

By contributing, you will be helping Ben's Buddies cover the preparation and filing costs for the 501c3, purchase the dolls, and deliver the Care Packages to local Chicago hospitals.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I have started this campaign to raise the money needed to prepare and file the 501c3 paperwork with the IRS; the preparation and filing costs are expected to be $2000.00.  I already have my Tax-ID, and Articles of Incorporation which have been filed in the state of Illinois. The rest of the money will go to purchase of the dolls and creation of the care packages.

Once we receive our non-profit status, we plan on fund raising from corporations with whom we have worked in my professional career.  Ben’s Buddies will also be holding raffles and walk-a-thons in order to raise money to purchase the dolls from the manufacturer.

My goal is to make Ben's Buddies our full-time endeavor.  If we do not reach my goal, I will contribute from our personal savings in order to fill whatever gap remains.

The Impact

No child deserves to be without joy or hope in desparate circumstances; while it may be a small gift, the doll, children's Bible, and cards are meant to bring a smile to the face of a child who may have no reason to smile.  The doll will be something that they can identify with (if the child has lost his/her hair through chemo) and the children's Bible tells the story of Christ and the hope He has for those who trust in Him.  The hand-made cards are a special, personal gift and can be sent to the child's home after his/her release from the hospital.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute monetarily, I would humbly ask that you pray for Ben's Buddies that we may bring joy and hope to children, that we may remain Christ-Centered, and that in all ways, God's will be done.

Please also feel free to share this link....we appreciate any assistance you can provide.

 

A final note: The image of a flower is from a plant that we received shortly after Ben's passing.  The plant had never bloomed until 5/12/2012, Ben's birthday.  It is a beautiful symbol of who Ben is, the impact he's had on the world around him, and the grace of God.

story:
(english version follows)
Après 30 ans de performance sportive dans diverses disciplines (natation 12 ans au niveau national, vélo de montagne 20 ans élite-expert et trail running) en mars dernier, Patrick s'est qualifié pour le Championnat du monde de XTerra 2015 qui se tient chaque année à Maui-Hawaii. Le XTerra, c'est quoi ? C'est un triathlon en montagne (1,5 km de natation en lac ou mer, 30 km de vélo de montagne, 10 km de trail running). Ce sport exige énormément d'heures d'entraînement. Grâce à son expérience et ses aptitudes des les 3 sports combinés, Patrick a de forte chance de faire un podium lors du Championnat du monde. Pour ce faire, il a besoin de votre aide. Voici les coûts reliés à cette compétition:
- Inscription - 600$
- Billets d'avion - 1400$
- Hôtel pour 5 nuits: 1100$
- Location de voiture: 500$
- Repas: 500$
- Assurance santé d'urgence: 250$
- Transport du vélo par avion: 400$
- Argent de poche, imprévue, autre: 300$
Total : approx. 5000$

Cette épreuve ultime sera l'aboutissement de toutes les années d'entraînement. C'est pour ça qu'aujourd'hui un don serait grandement apprécié pour arriver à payer une portion du voyage, l'objectif est d'amasser 3000$ en 60 jours (si 150 personnes donnent 20$ chacune c'est gagné!).

Patrick va représenter le Canada le 1er novembre 2015. Vous êtes invités à visiter sa page Facebook (Pat Dupras Athlète) pour plus d'info. Merci :-)
*************************************************
After 30 years of performance in various sports (swimming 12 years at national level, mountain bike 20 years elite / expert and trail running) last March Patrick qualified for the XTerra World Championship held each year in Maui - Hawaii. What is an XTerra? It's a mountain triathlon (1.5 km swim in lake or sea, 30 km mountain bike, 10 km trail running). This sport requires a lot of training hours. Thanks to his experience and abilities in all three sports combined, Patrick has a good chance to make it on a podium at the World Championship. To make this possible, Patrick needs your help. Here are the costs associated with this competition:
- Registration - $ 600
- Airline Tickets - $ 1,400
- Hotel for 5 nights: $ 1,100
- Car rental: $ 500
- Meals: US $ 500
- Emergency health insurance: $ 250
- Transportation of bicycle by plane: $ 400
- Pocket money, unforeseen, other: $ 300
Total: approx. $ 5000

This ultimate test will be a great outcome for all those years of training. That is why a contribution would be appreciated to help pay a portion of the trip, the goal is to raise $ 3,000 in 60 days (if 150 people donate $ 20 each it's a done deal!) .

Patrick will represent Canada on November 1, 2015. You are invited to visit his Facebook page (Pat Dupras Athlete) for more info. Thank you :-)

story:
iDiagnostics

project by TIRF Labs, Inc., Cary, North Carolina, USA,

 Dr. Alexander Asanov and  Dr. Luis Vaca

Summary

TIRF Labs introduces cell phone based molecular diagnostics for home use. We know that early diagnosing saves lives, don't we? However, we are reluctant to submit ourselves for examination because it is costly and uncomfortable. Wouldn’t it be wonderful if you could turn your smartphone into a hospital laboratory and perform accurate diagnosing in the comfort of your home? Think of how that could help in monitoring the health of your family, as well as assisting frontier doctors in preventing the spread of Ebola and other infectious diseases. This technology has, in fact, been developed, and is named iDiagnostics.

Medicine today is extremely imprecise and depersonalized. It treats us assuming that we all are the same. However, every one of us is truly unique. We respond differently to everything, including prescription drugs. In the USA we pay $350 billion a year on prescription drugs, but one third of them do not work, often producing toxic side effects. In the research community, it is well understood that medicine should be personalized. In other words, it should be tailored to peculiar features of the molecular machinery of our bodies. iDiagnostics is a tool which will permit medicine to become personalized and accurate, as it should be. Today, in many instances, diseases are diagnosed too late, making it difficult to reverse or prevent the threat. Technologies that allow to precisely diagnose diseases have been developed and are available in centralized clinical laboratories. However, until now using them has been too costly, often uncomfortable, and involved visiting doctors. iDiagnostics will change the situation and allow you to perform precision diagnoses in the comfort of your home. You will know the results in a matter of several minutes, and your doctor will be able to adjust the treatment remotely, without you visiting his office.


What You Will Receive?

This project will result in two main products:

(i) iDiagnostics and test cartridges, shown in Figure 1, and

(ii) Application Development Kit  (ADK) shown in Figure 2.

 

(i) iDiagnostics and disposable cartridges, shown in Figure 1, are designed for home use by everyone. They also can be used by medical doctors, first responders, clinical researchers, and other specialists. We anticipate that by October 2015 several tests, including food safety, allergens in food, prostate and breast cancer, will be approved by regulating agencies and available to our backers. Our adopter-pledgers will receive an iDiagnostics cradle with several cartridges from the list of approved tests. Major models of Android, Windows, and iPhone will be supported; please specify your model at the moment of pledging. Our adopter-pledgers will also receive several free cartridges that our collaborators and we will develop during the next two years. Each of our pledgers will have the opportunity to become a member of the home diagnostics community, which will help to develop new tests and make existing tests more accurate.

  (ii) ADK (Application Development Kit), shown in Figure 2, is intended for researchers who are interested in interfacing their existing tests and developing new applications for iDiagnostics. Our pledgers who support ADK products will receive ADK at special Indiegogo price and also will have the opportunity to sponsor a university student project, which will use the ADK for the development of molecular diagnostics tests. If you do not have a student in mind, but are willing to sponsor one, we will be delighted to assist you in allocating a bright student and an exciting goal.



What Will You  Change?

Your support of the iDiagnostics project will change how medicine works. With iDiagnostics, you and your doctor will precisely know what is going on in your body, how your condition develops in time, and how your body responds to therapy or changes in your lifestyle. Today, there are three problems in diagnosis: (i) under-diagnosing - due to poor sensitivity of traditional tests, in which diseases often remain undetected; (ii) over-diagnosis - due to the high rate of false positive responses, the presence of a disease is erroneously reported, while, in fact, there is no threat; and (3) no-diagnosis - due to high cost and discomfort many of us prefer to avoid diagnosis. Being a sensitive, accurate, and inexpensive technology, iDiagnostics will solve all three problems. Early detection of cancer, Alzheimer's, cardio-vascular and infectious diseases, food safety, and other areas will benefit tremendously from the use of iDiagnostics. Your support will help fight these diseases.

Accurate and rapid diagnosis is essential for absolutely all healthcare actions. Detection of diseases, fighting cancer, heart and neurological diseases, prevention of epidemics, testing new drugs, and many other areas critically depend on accurate and rapid diagnosis. Your support will significantly accelerate progress in these areas.

Today, our doctors and insurance companies possess information about our health. We seldom keep the results of laboratory tests on our files, despite their importance to us in being better diagnosed in the future. For our children, who carry similar genes, the results of our diagnoses have valuable information for their health. iDiagnostics will seamlessly enable yourownership of information about your health. You will own the data and decide whether to email them to your doctor or save on your files. The technological opportunities for these changes have been embedded into iDiagnostics devices. Your support will help you to become the owner of information about your health.


Idea of Cell Phone Based Diagnostics

Our cellphones are powerful computers equipped with super cameras. The idea behind iDiagnostics is to use them with a handheld cradle, which implements a super sensitive bio-detection fluorescence technology, called TIRF microarrays. The use of iDiagnostics is as simple as blood glucose tests available today for diabetic patients. You start the iDiagnostics app on your phone and follow the instructions. The app will instruct you to put your cellphone into the cradle, insert a cartridge, and apply a droplet of saliva, urine, sweat, blood, or other bodily fluid. The fluid will flow inside the cartridge over the TIRF microarray; which will detect the presence or absence of numerous molecular markers. Massive amounts of information will be obtained by taking pictures of the response of the TIRF microarray. The iDiagnostics app will analyze the images, and, in a matter of several minutes, will provide recommendations on what to do. 


How Does iDiagnostics Work?

iDiagnostics is a technology which detects multiple molecular markers in a droplet of saliva, urine, sweat, blood, stool, or other bodily fluid. It is designed to be minimally invasive and maximally precise. Molecular markers are signatures of diseases. They appear in biological fluids several months before a cancer tumor develops, and at least several weeks before a heart attack strikes, giving us enough time to prevent the threat. iDiagnostics employs super sensitive technology, termed silk-enhanced TIRF microarray, to detect molecular markers. Theoretically, thousands of bioassays can be included into a TIRF microarray. However, in most practical cases we do not need more than 20 markers to perform a test with negligibly small rate of errors. TIRF microarrays are capable of detecting markers of three major classes: proteins, nucleic acids, and metabolites. Traditional tests are based on a single class of markers and are often too imprecise. 

Figure 3 shows a photo and the schematics of iDiagnostics. The cradle and cartridge integrate optics, microfluidics, an electrochemical system, electronics, and nanoengineered bioassays into one handheld device, which implements TIRF microarray technology. 

iDiagnostics is based on the phenomenon of Total Internal Reflection Fluorescence (TIRF) (Figure 4), which occurs at the interface between a plastic or glass slide and biological fluid. If the fluorescence excitation light enters the slide at angles of 63 degrees or larger, the light will bounce from the top and the bottom of the slide and excite fluorescence of multiple bioassay spots that are arrayed at the bottom surface of the slide, where the bodily fluid contacts the array. 

Because TIRF is a surface-selective technique, which probes only a sub-micron layer of the fluid,  bioassays that are immobilized at the surface are excited and fluoresce, while molecules and other particles in the bulk of solution are not excited, and respectively, do not fluoresce. This allows for the testing of complex biological fluids, such as whole blood, with no or minimal sample preparation, which drastically reduces the turn-around time between the moments "sample-in" and  "result-out." 

A classical TIRF array, which is shown at the bottom of Figure 4, can use only a sub-micron layer of bioassays. Therefore, the fluorescence signal of classical arrays is low; expensive scientific-grade cameras are necessary to image them. In 2013, after experimenting with a multitude of materials, we discovered that silk fibroin, the same natural protein that spiders use for their webs, tremendously enhances the signal of TIRF arrays. Silk fibroin is one of the few natural proteins whose refractive index is close to that of glass. This property is responsible for the beautiful shimmering of silk fibers in clothing. If deposited onto a glass or plastic slide, silk fibroin captures the excitation light, becomes an integral part of TIRF lightguide, and allows for an increase in the amount of immobilized bioassay molecules by a thousand-fold. Silk-enhanced TIRF arrays fluoresce brightly; cell phone cameras are sensitive enough to detect their response. Additionally, silk is a remarkably stable protein. Its shelf life extends to several months and even years. Silk also stabilizes other biological molecules that otherwise would require refrigeration, a quality very desirable for applications in low resource settings.

For the detection of DNA and RNA markers, iDiagnostics uses bioassays, termed molecular beacons. In the absence of target DNA or RNA, the fluorescence of a molecular beacon is quenched. The left panel of Figure 5 illustrates that upon binding to target DNA or RNA the molecular beacon opens and its fluorescence is dequenched. Irrelevant, non-target DNA or RNA do not open the molecular beacon; its fluorescence remains quenched. For the detection of protein and metabolite markers, iDiagnostics employs immunoassays based on antibodies, as shown on the right panel of Figure 5. For more information about the principles of silk-enhanced and classical TIRF microarrays please visit www.i-diagnostics.net and www.tirf-labs.com


iDiagnostics Technical Specifications

How iDiagnostics Was Born?

iDiagnostics is the result of a 9-year effort by our group of scientists and engineers. We have received $4.3 million in grants from the U.S. government and have developed a super-sensitive technology - TIRF microarrays. TIRF is an exceptionally sensitive technology capable of detecting biological particles down to single molecules. In iDiagnostics, TIRF allows for super-sensitive detection of proteins, DNA, RNA, metabolites, and selected chemical agents. The sensitivity and dynamic range of iDiagnostics is sufficient for detecting virtually all clinically significant protein, RNA, DNA, and metabolite markers. Figure 6 shows our progress in the development of TIRF array biosensors, which spanned from large bench-top instruments created in 2005, through portable sensors produced in 2009, to small handheld devices built in 2011. 

In 2013, as mentioned above, we discovered that silk fibroin enhances the fluorescence of TIRF microarrays so that we can use a cellphone camera instead of expensive cameras. This patent-pending discovery has been incorporated into iDiagnostics.


iDiagnostics Applications

Applications for iDiagnostics include diagnosing and prognosing  cancer, cardio-vascular diseases, Alzheimer's disease and other neurological disorders, influenza, Ebola and other infectious diseases, food safety, biodefense, forensic, environmental, and agricultural analyses. Along with the main goal of home use, family doctors, cardiologists, dentists, first responders, pharmaceutical companies, food safety, agriculture, and environment protection specialists have expressed their interest in using iDiagnostics for their applications. There are thousands of tests that can be developed for the iDiagnostics platform. For a single company it is too difficult, if not impossible, to develop all these numerous applications. Therefore, we invite other research groups worldwide to join our virtual team to interface their existing tests with the iDiagnostics platform and to develop new tests. To facilitate these efforts, we will supply the iDiagnostics Application Development Kit (ADK) shown in Figure 2. An ADK contains all necessary components for the development of diagnostics applications, including hardware, software, development tools, cartridge blanks, reagents, experimental protocols, and description of methods necessary for development. 

In our laboratory in North Carolina we are finishing the development of diagnostic and prognostic tests for breast and prostate cancer. We have developed iDiagnostics tests for food safety and detecting allergens in food. Our long-term collaborator Dr. Vaca from the Institute of Cellular Physiology at UNAM and his group are developing tests for early diagnosing of Alzheimer's disease and hepatitis C. His colleagues from other research groups will develop tests for pancreatic and colon cancer. Dr. Dong from Washington State University is developing iDiagnostics tests for cardio-diseases. The Laboratory of Molecular Virology at the Food and Drug Administration expressed their interest in using iDiagnostics for rapid detection of HIV and other infectious diseases. 

There are hundreds of other exciting applications that will be totally new for the healthcare area. In our laboratory in North Carolina we are working  on the longevity tests. These studies are promising rapid progress in the increasing of longevity and preventing metabolic disbalances that result in premature aging. 

Personalized medicine, clinical and pre-clinical tests of new drugs, disease risks assessment, food and water safety, detection of allergens, environmental and agricultural applications will benefit tremendously from iDiagnostics.

How iDiagnostics Compares with Alternative Technologies?

We have carefully examined the multitude of alternative methods and found that iDiagnostics is a superior technology for home use diagnostics. To the best of our knowledge, iDiagnostics is the only technology which is accurate and rapid, yet can be downsized to an inexpensive handheld device. The projected cost of iDiagnostics is $400, and disposable cartridges are anticipated to cost $1-3. We are not aware of other technologies that could be as sensitive, accurate, rapid, and yet be as affordable as iDiagnostics.
After 9-11 followed by the anthrax letter attacks, the U.S. government invested over $70 billion in bio-defense. There is no analytical technique that has not been tried for bio-detection. However, most of the techniques are too imprecise or too costly. The Department of Defense is monitoring existing and emerging technologies that can be used for protection of the U.S. soldiers against biological warfare agents. In 2013 DOD issued a 663-page document (www.cbrnhorizonscan.com), which  ranked our classical TIRF array biosensors among the most promising devices that are well-suited for military applications. We performed further analysis from the standpoint of civil applications and compared iDiagnostics with alternative technologies that theoretically could be employed for home use. We found that iDiagnostics showed several superior advantages, including (i) the low limit of detection and high sensitivity sufficient for detection of virtually all clinically significant markers, (ii) the broad dynamic range, which covers the entire spectrum of bio-marker concentrations that are clinically significant for diagnosis of diseases, (iii) the capability to simultaneously detect three classes of markers: proteins, nucleic acids, and metabolites. To the best of our knowledge, iDiagnostics is the only technology which is capable of providing precision and rapid molecular diagnosis at affordable cost. 

TIRF Labs Team

The following scientists and engineers have contributed significantly to the development of TIRF microarray and iDiagnostics technologies: Luis Vaca, Ph.D.; Vladimir Omelyanenko, Ph.D.; Angelica Zepeda, Ph.D.; Alicia Sampieri, Ph.D.; Philip Oldham, Ph.D.; W. William Wilson, Ph.D.; Theodore Winger, Ph.D.; David Sachs, M.S.; Hardie Johnson, B.A.; David Landis, Ph.D.; Ryan Sherry, M.S.; Tyson Weiss, B.A.; Zhanna Brotsman, M.S., Grant Leonhard, Timothy Pike, and Alexander Asanov, Ph.D.

Personal Statement of Lead Scientist

I, Alexander Asanov, believe that I am well-suited to lead the iDiagnostics project. This project logically builds upon my prior work. In 2004-2012, I served as Principal Investigator on several BAA and SBIR grants, awarded by NIH and HSARPA. I assembled and led a team of scientists and engineers, who have developed a family of innovative TIRF instruments for molecular diagnostics. My colleagues and I have pioneered several ground-breaking discoveries and accumulated unique experience in using TIRF technology for life-science applications.  I have a broad background in spectroscopy, electrochemistry, surface chemistry, molecular biology, cell biology, nanoengineering, mechanical engineering, and optical engineering, which are key areas for this project. Each of our prior projects resulted in the development of useful TIRF instruments. Our customers from academic and pharmaceutical research groups have generated unique research data using our products, and have published articles in leading scientific journals. I have a record of successful R&D projects in the area of molecular diagnostics and believe that my prior experiences have prepared me well to lead the proposed project.  I am a naturalized U.S. citizen. In 1994, I immigrated from Russia. Although I still speak with an accent, I feel that I am more American than Russian. My second Motherland recognized my accomplishments and rewarded me more than I could have dreamt of in Russia. I want to give back to society and believe that the development of iDiagnostics is the way in which I can demonstrate my gratitude to America and the world.

Open Innovation Approach

In order to make accurate diagnostics available to everyone, we are using an open innovation approach, which involves collaborative efforts with other research groups. We have successfully collaborated with several groups worldwide and plan extended collaboration to better meet the broad spectrum of needs of our customers. Several of our products, including iDiagnostics, have been inspired by our customers and collaborators. iDiagnostics has been developed in collaboration with one of our long-term partners - research group of Dr. Vaca from UNAM. We plan to further extend this approach because we believe that knowledge in the field of life sciences is broadly distributed. Innovations and efficient transfer of them to the market place assumes close collaboration with external research groups. To stimulate the flow of innovations in and out of our company, we will offer to license the intellectual property of our collaborators and will offer them the opportunity to license our technologies.

Why Indiegogo?

Our goal is to make accurate diagnosing affordable for all. Rather than selling iDiagnostics to a big-name company,  we are turning to you on Indiegogo for funding, so that we can guarantee affordable access to this life-saving technology for you and every family around the globe. 

It appears that acquisition of iDiagnostics technology by a large firm would produce too costly diagnostic system, which the majority of population would not be able to afford.  Indeed, the goal of large firms is to generate maximum income for their shareholders. It would be against their rules to sell iDiagnostics at a price that is significantly lower than the current market price for similar systems. 

The involvement of venture capital firms appears to be even less efficient than the possible acquisition of iDiagnostics by a large firm. Unfortunately, the rate of success for a typical venture capital firm is less than 5%, meaning that just one company, which is successful, should cover losses incurred by 19 unsuccessful startups that did not make it to the market.

Valley of Death - is the term that the business development community uses to designate the dramatic period of time that occurs between creating a prototype and manufacturing the product. Indeed, many nice technologies have paved the road of the Valley of Death, because they did not get funds to make the transition to manufacturing. Crowdfunding is a new mechanism, which is changing the game. On Indiegogo you, using your hard-earned dollar, are voting for an innovation, which you want to see in your hands. We believe that iDiagnostics is one such innovation. It will have enormous social impact, save millions of lives, and overall improve healthcare for everyone around the globe. We hope that you will join us. It will be more than just a new technology. There also will be a new community, which will work together to efficiently improve the quality of healthcare.


Budget and Timeline

Disclaimer

Neither human subjects nor laboratory animals are involved in this project. Genetically modified organisms and biologically hazardous materials aren't used either. Our collaborators, who do perform regulated studies, comply with the respective government protocols and rules. 

The field of life-sciences, in general, and the area of molecular biology, in particular, operate with powerful technologies that are improving the quality of our lives. However, these powerful tools, if used improperly, can cause adverse effects.  We believe that scientists should be responsible for the results of their studies. It is our company policy and the responsibility of our workers to foresee the possible adverse effects of our studies and adhere to the highest ethical standards to avoid possible adverse effects. We do not develop and do not support the development of controversial biological applications.  

Compliance with FDA Guidance

TIRF Labs complies with the U.S. Food and Drug Administration guidance, including the following:http://www.fda.gov/MedicalDevices/DeviceRegulationandGuidance/PostmarketRequirements/QualitySystemsRegulations/http://www.fda.gov/MedicalDevices/DeviceRegulationandGuidance/default.htm\

The Software guidance documentshttp://www.fda.gov/medicaldevices/deviceregulationandguidance/guidancedocuments/ucm089543.htm

http://www.fda.gov/downloads/RegulatoryInformation/Guidances/ucm126955.pdf 

Design Considerations for Devices Intended for Home Usehttp://www.fda.gov/downloads/MedicalDevices/DeviceRegulationandGuidance/GuidanceDocuments/UCM331681.pdf

Guidance for Molecular Diagnostic Instruments with Combined Diagnostic and Research Functionshttp://www.fda.gov/downloads/MedicalDevices/DeviceRegulationandGuidance/GuidanceDocuments/UCM346553.pdf

Copyright Credits

We are grateful to the National Institutes of Health, Mr. Michael Astrachan - XVIVO Scientific Animation, Genome British Columbia, The Howard Hughes Medical Institute, and Dr. David Goodsell, The Scripps Research Institute, for their kind permissions to use their videos and images.

Risks and challenges

TIRF Labs has been working on molecular diagnostics for the last ten years and has created a family of TIRF instruments, including bench-top, portable, and handheld TIRF biosensors. We have assembled a group of scientists and engineers with vast experience in all relevant fields. However, a project of such scale as iDiagnostics involves new risks. The research and development have worked, the prototyping and low-volume manufacturing has been done. Now, the risks are associated with the transition from prototyping and low-volume manufacturing to mass production. To mitigate these risks, we are establishing parallel contacts with alternative manufacturing partners and collaborators to assure multiple possible channels for production. If a setback does arise in one of the channels, we will use an alternative channel. iDiagnostics is a sophisticated technology. We are using a number of unique methods and production technologies. We believe that we are able to foresee and minimize risks associated with these methods in order to deliver iDiagnostics to our backers with full satisfaction. Keeping our customers and backers updated about our progress and receiving feedback from them is our priority. If there are unexpected issues or delays, we will inform you promptly.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetary, but feel that you wish to help to iDiagnostics,

  • Please spread the word about iDiagnostics out: tell your family and friends, use Twitter, Facebook, and other social networks.
  • Indiegogo has excellent share tools! Please use them!
