story:
Imagination is everything. But cardboard isn't forever. 

Aragatsavan's elementary students want happy tummies and healthy teeth--who wouldn't? Build them a cafeteria and brushadrome this summer!

In a little village called Aragatsavan located about an hour and a half outside Yerevan, Armenia's capital, 160 elementary school children are poised for a nutrition and health revolution. Children of Armenia Fund (COAF) wants to include Aragatsavan's school in its highly successful cafeteria and brushadrome program by building a space on the campus where 1st-4th graders (ages 6-11) can have a healthy hot meal and brush their teeth every day for a year.

There is currently no system-wide lunch program in Armenia's schools. Students either go hungry, eat a small pastry or simply leave their campus to find food throughout the school day. In 2012, COAF did a survey of 800 schoolchildren in rural Armenia and found that 785 of them had signs of decay on their adult teeth. 

By building a kitchen, cafeteria and brushadrome (tooth-brushing station), COAF is hacking away at these figures one school at a time. Aragatsavan will be the 4th school to participate in the program. 

The brushadrome is a large room with sinks and mirrors where children wash their hands before and brush their teeth after their daily lunch. COAF's program will provide the children with toothbrushes, toothpaste and training for the school nurse to learn how to teach and monitor the kids as they experience the lifelong value of a healthy smile. Additionally, COAF's dental health partners will treat the children's teeth with fluoride once every 6 months to prevent tooth decay, and fund treatments for children whose teeth are already damaged.  

The cafeteria will include a kitchen and several tables with chairs in a sunlit room. Children will not only eat healthy food here, but also participate in COAF's Healthy Lifestyle Club after school program that celebrates and teaches good eating, proper hygiene and lifestyle habits.

Job Creation
Short-term work will be available to the construction team, while 1 cook and 2 kitchen staff will be hired to run the facility long-term.

Sustainability
COAF regards its program as an "intervention"-- since their support becomes minimal after the first year. At that point, the school will have received enough training to be able to sustain the commitment to supporting healthy meals and proper oral hygiene  indefinitely. Aragatsavan's school principal, Anahit Ter-Martirosyan, has already committed to this. 

Project Timeline
Construction will take place during the summer and the entire facility will be ready for the children once school opens in September of 2014!

Note: This campaign is a paid endeavor, created by ONEArmenia for COAF.

--------------

Այս քարոզարշավը միջոցներ է հավաքում Հայաստանի Մանուկների Հիմնադրամի համար, որ վավերացված ոչ առևտրային կազմակերպություն է։ Արշավի և Հիմնադրամի հայացքների համընկնումը, ինչպես նաև որևէ պաշտոնական կապ նրանց միջև պարտադիր չէ։  Բոլոր ներդրումները համարվում են անվերապահ նվիրատվություն և դրանց նկատմամբ որևէ նպատակ չի կարող ներկայացվել։ 

Երևակայությունն ամեն ինչ է։ Իսկ թուղթը հավիտյան չէ։

Արագածավանի տարրական դասարանների աշակերտներն ուզում են ուրախ փորիկներ և առողջ ատամներ ունենալ․ ո՞վ չի ուզի։ Եկե՛ք այս ամառ նրանց համար ճաշարան և ատամները խոզանակելու հարմարություն ստեղծենք։

Հայաստանի մայրաքաղաք Երևանից 1․5 ժամվա հեռավորության վրա գտնվող Արագածավան անունով փոքր գյուղի տարրական դասարանների 160 աշակերտ սննդային և առողջապահական հեղափոխության եզրին են։ Հայաստանի Մանուկների Հիմնադրամը (ՀՄՀ) նպատակ ունի Արագածավանի դպրոցն ընդգրկել իր այդքան հաջող՝ ճաշարանի և խոզանակման հարմարության ծրագրում՝ դպրոցում կառուցելով տարածք, որտեղ 1-4-րդ դասարանցիները (6-11 տարեկան) մեկ տարի շարունակ՝ ամեն օր, կարող են առողջ և տաք սնունդ ընդունել և խոզանակել ատամները։ 

Ներկայումս Հայաստանի դպրոցներում նախաճաշի համակարգային ծրագիր գոյություն չունի։ Աշակերտները կամ սոված են մնում, կամ մի կտոր խմորեղեն ուտում, կամ էլ, պարզապես, լքում դպրոցի տարածքը ուսումնական օրվա ընթացքում՝ սնունդ հայթհայթելու համար։ 2012թ․ ՀՄՀ-ն ուսումնասիրություն անցկացրեց Հայաստանի գյուղական համայնքների 800 աշակերտների շրջանում, և պարզ դարձավ, որ նրանցից 785-ի մոտ հիմնական ատամների փչացման նշաններ կան։

Մեկ առ մեկ յուրաքանչյուր դպրոցում խոհանոց, ճաշարան և ատամները խոզանակելու հարմարություն կառուցելով՝ ՀՄՀ-ն սպառնում է ոչնչացնել այս թվերը։ Արագածավանը կլինի ծրագրին մասնակցող 4-րդ դպրոցը։

Ատամները խոզանակելու հարմարությունն իրենից ներկայացնում է մեծ սենյակ՝ լվացարաններով և հայելիներով, որտեղ երեխաներն ամեն օր՝ նախաճաշից առաջ,  լվանում են ձեռքերը, իսկ նախաճաշից հետո՝ ատամները։ ՀՄՀ-ն երեխաներին կապահովի ատամի խոզանակներով և մածուկով, իսկ դպրոցի դայակին՝ վերապատրաստումով, որպեսզի վերջինս երեխաներին սովորեցնի և վերահսկի նրանց, մինչ նրանք յուրացնում են առողջ ժպիտի երկարամյա արժեքը։

Ի լրումն՝ յուրաքանչյուր 6 ամիսը մեկ անգամ  ՀՄՀ-ի ատամնաբուժական գործընկերները երեխաների ատամների փչացումը կանխարգելելու նպատակով դրանք կմշակեն ֆտորով, իսկ այն երեխաներին, ում ատամներն արդեն խնդիրներ ունեն, կտրամադրեն միջոցներ՝ դրանք բուժելու համար։

Մի լուսավոր սենյակում կլինի ճաշարանը՝ սեղաններով և աթոռներով, ինչպես նաև՝ խոհանոց։ Երեխաններն այստեղ ոչ միայն լավորակ սնունդ կընդունեն, այլև դպրոցից հետո  կմասնակցեն ՀՄՀ-ի կողմից կազմակերպված Առողջ ապրելակերպի ակումբին, որ կքարոզի առողջ սնվելու, մաքրության և առողջ ապրելակերպի սովորույթներ։

Աշխատատեղերի ստեղծում

Ծրագիրը կարճատև աշխատանքով կապահովի կառուցապատողների թիմին և երկարատև աշխատանքով՝ 1 խոհարարի և  խոհանոցի 2 աշխատակցի՝ կազմակերպելու ճաշարանի աշխատանքները։

Կայունություն

ՀՄՀ-ն իր այս ծրագիրը համարում է «միջամտություն», քանի որ առաջին տարին լրանալուց հետո հիմնադրամի աջակցությունը հավասարվում է նվազագույնի։ Այդ ժամանակ արդեն դպրոցը բավականաչափ վերապատրաստում կունենա անժամկետ աջակցելու երեխաներին առողջ սննդի և հիգիենայի հարցում։ Արագածավանի դպրոցի տնօրեն Անահիտ Տեր-Մարտիրոսյանն արդեն տվել է իր համաձայնությունը։

Ծրագրի ժամանակացույցը

Կառուցապատման աշխատանքները կկատարվեն ամռանը, իսկ ամբողջ հարմարությունը պատրաստ կլինի ծառայելու երեխաներին 2014թ․ սեպտեմբերին՝ դպրոցի բացման հենց առաջին օրը։
story_txt:
Imagination is everything. But cardboard isn't
forever. Aragatsavan's
elementary students want happy tummies and healthy teeth--who wouldn't? Build
them a cafeteria and brushadrome this summer!
In a little village called Aragatsavan located
about an hour and a half outside Yerevan, Armenia's capital, 160 elementary
school children are poised for a nutrition and health revolution. Children of
Armenia Fund (COAF) wants to include Aragatsavan's school in its highly
successful cafeteria and brushadrome program by building a space on the campus
where 1st-4th graders (ages 6-11) can have a healthy hot meal and brush their
teeth every day for a year.There is currently no system-wide lunch program in
Armenia's schools. Students either go hungry, eat a small pastry or simply
leave their campus to find food throughout the school day. In 2012, COAF
did a survey of 800 schoolchildren in rural Armenia and found that 785 of them
had signs of decay on their adult teeth. By building a kitchen, cafeteria and brushadrome
(tooth-brushing station), COAF is hacking away at these figures one school at a
time. Aragatsavan will be the 4th school to participate in the program. The brushadrome is a large room with sinks and
mirrors where children wash their hands before and brush their teeth after
their daily lunch. COAF's program will provide the children with toothbrushes,
toothpaste and training for the school nurse to learn how to teach and monitor
the kids as they experience the lifelong value of a healthy smile.
Additionally, COAF's dental health partners will treat the children's teeth with
fluoride once every 6 months to prevent tooth decay, and fund treatments for
children whose teeth are already damaged.  The cafeteria will include a kitchen and several
tables with chairs in a sunlit room. Children will not only eat healthy food here, but also participate in COAF's Healthy
Lifestyle Club after school program that celebrates and teaches good eating, proper hygiene and lifestyle habits.Job CreationShort-term work will be available to the
construction team, while 1 cook and 2 kitchen staff will be hired to run the facility
long-term.SustainabilityCOAF regards its program as an
"intervention"-- since their support becomes minimal after the first
year. At that point, the school will have received enough training to be able
to sustain the commitment to supporting healthy meals and proper oral hygiene  indefinitely. Aragatsavan's school principal,
Anahit Ter-Martirosyan, has already committed to this. Project TimelineConstruction will take place during the summer and the entire facility will be ready for the
children once school opens in September of 2014!Note: This campaign is a paid endeavor, created by ONEArmenia for COAF.--------------Այս քարոզարշավը միջոցներ է հավաքում Հայաստանի Մանուկների
Հիմնադրամի համար, որ վավերացված ոչ առևտրային կազմակերպություն է։ Արշավի և Հիմնադրամի
հայացքների համընկնումը, ինչպես նաև որևէ պաշտոնական կապ նրանց միջև պարտադիր չէ։  Բոլոր ներդրումները համարվում են անվերապահ նվիրատվություն
և դրանց նկատմամբ որևէ նպատակ չի կարող ներկայացվել։ 

Երևակայությունն ամեն ինչ է։ Իսկ թուղթը հավիտյան չէ։
Արագածավանի տարրական դասարանների
աշակերտներն ուզում են ուրախ փորիկներ և առողջ ատամներ ունենալ․ ո՞վ չի ուզի։
Եկե՛ք այս ամառ նրանց համար ճաշարան և ատամները խոզանակելու հարմարություն ստեղծենք։

Հայաստանի մայրաքաղաք Երևանից 1․5 ժամվա հեռավորության վրա
գտնվող Արագածավան անունով փոքր գյուղի տարրական դասարանների 160 աշակերտ սննդային
և առողջապահական հեղափոխության եզրին են։ Հայաստանի Մանուկների Հիմնադրամը (ՀՄՀ) նպատակ
ունի Արագածավանի դպրոցն ընդգրկել իր այդքան հաջող՝ ճաշարանի և խոզանակման հարմարության
ծրագրում՝ դպրոցում կառուցելով տարածք, որտեղ 1-4-րդ դասարանցիները (6-11 տարեկան)
մեկ տարի շարունակ՝ ամեն օր, կարող են առողջ և տաք սնունդ ընդունել և խոզանակել ատամները։  
Ներկայումս Հայաստանի դպրոցներում նախաճաշի համակարգային
ծրագիր գոյություն չունի։ Աշակերտները կամ սոված են մնում, կամ մի կտոր խմորեղեն ուտում,
կամ էլ, պարզապես, լքում դպրոցի տարածքը ուսումնական օրվա ընթացքում՝ սնունդ հայթհայթելու
համար։ 2012թ․ ՀՄՀ-ն ուսումնասիրություն անցկացրեց Հայաստանի
գյուղական համայնքների 800 աշակերտների շրջանում, և պարզ դարձավ, որ նրանցից 785-ի
մոտ հիմնական ատամների փչացման նշաններ կան։ 
Մեկ առ մեկ յուրաքանչյուր դպրոցում խոհանոց, ճաշարան
և ատամները խոզանակելու հարմարություն կառուցելով՝ ՀՄՀ-ն սպառնում է ոչնչացնել այս
թվերը։ Արագածավանը կլինի ծրագրին մասնակցող 4-րդ դպրոցը։
Ատամները խոզանակելու հարմարությունն իրենից ներկայացնում
է մեծ սենյակ՝ լվացարաններով և հայելիներով, որտեղ երեխաներն ամեն օր՝ նախաճաշից առաջ,
 լվանում են ձեռքերը, իսկ նախաճաշից հետո՝ ատամները։
ՀՄՀ-ն երեխաներին կապահովի ատամի խոզանակներով և մածուկով, իսկ դպրոցի դայակին՝ վերապատրաստումով,
որպեսզի վերջինս երեխաներին սովորեցնի և վերահսկի նրանց, մինչ նրանք յուրացնում են
առողջ ժպիտի երկարամյա արժեքը։ 
Ի լրումն՝ յուրաքանչյուր 6 ամիսը մեկ անգամ  ՀՄՀ-ի ատամնաբուժական գործընկերները երեխաների ատամների
փչացումը կանխարգելելու նպատակով դրանք կմշակեն ֆտորով, իսկ այն երեխաներին, ում ատամներն
արդեն խնդիրներ ունեն, կտրամադրեն միջոցներ՝ դրանք բուժելու համար։ 
Մի լուսավոր սենյակում կլինի ճաշարանը՝ սեղաններով
և աթոռներով, ինչպես նաև՝ խոհանոց։ Երեխաններն այստեղ ոչ միայն լավորակ սնունդ կընդունեն,
այլև դպրոցից հետո  կմասնակցեն ՀՄՀ-ի կողմից
կազմակերպված Առողջ ապրելակերպի ակումբին, որ կքարոզի առողջ սնվելու, մաքրության և
առողջ ապրելակերպի սովորույթներ։
Աշխատատեղերի ստեղծումԾրագիրը կարճատև աշխատանքով կապահովի կառուցապատողների
թիմին և երկարատև աշխատանքով՝ 1 խոհարարի և  խոհանոցի 2 աշխատակցի՝ կազմակերպելու ճաշարանի աշխատանքները։
ԿայունությունՀՄՀ-ն իր այս ծրագիրը համարում է «միջամտություն»,
քանի որ առաջին տարին լրանալուց հետո հիմնադրամի աջակցությունը հավասարվում է նվազագույնի։
Այդ ժամանակ արդեն դպրոցը բավականաչափ վերապատրաստում կունենա անժամկետ աջակցելու երեխաներին
առողջ սննդի և հիգիենայի հարցում։ Արագածավանի դպրոցի տնօրեն Անահիտ Տեր-Մարտիրոսյանն
արդեն տվել է իր համաձայնությունը։ 
Ծրագրի ժամանակացույցըԿառուցապատման աշխատանքները կկատարվեն ամռանը,
իսկ ամբողջ հարմարությունը պատրաստ կլինի ծառայելու երեխաներին 2014թ․ սեպտեմբերին՝
դպրոցի բացման հենց առաջին օրը։

story: /

Im posting this for a friend while she is in the hospital with Dane.

 

My little boy Dane is in ICU at Stanford. He's 3.5 yrs old and has a rare form of muscular dystrophy called "CMD Merosin deficient". The cause of this hospitalization is from a unknown virus that any normal/healthy kid would have handled well. His condition has allowed pneumonia in, and threatened his life. He has been ventilated, and been put on breathing support for the past few days. As a single mom, receiving no child support, I've asked for help for the first time from my friends, family and community. This video is to help those of you who want to help get acquainted with Dane, and his current struggle to recover. Meanwhile, all of the generous donations have made it so I can stay with him, eat, and sleep near by. Thank you from the bottom of my heart. Me and my family are SO thankful for the kindness, and generosity. -Tara

story:
Hi, I'm Ken, and I'm here to tell you about Sheri and Kube. I worked with them way back at a restaurant called the Chameleon. Instantly upon meeting them I knew we were going to be friends. She was a waitress with a room brightening smile, who sang happy birthday to her tables in Italian, opera style! I had never seen that before in all my years of tending bar. Sheri genuinely cares about people, whether they were customers at a table, strangers at the bar or just someone coming in looking for work. It didn't matter to Sheri, everyone had the potential to be a kind soul like her and that's the way she lives every day.

Kube is a kindred soul to Sheri, and if they hadn't met, it is this bartenders belief that they would have been on a quest searching for each other until such time that fate had brought them together, or they grew old and perished while still on that quest. Kube is a gentle giant, a towering man with a soft voice and a calm thought. A truer friend of loyalty and support you would be hard pressed to find, and that would be a mission I would not like the task of.

They did find each other and I was fortunate to be in their wedding. Being the artistic types a standard cookie cutter wedding would not do, it would be a Renaissance wedding for these two. I was dressed as a monk, a perfect outfit for the bartender. Most came in period costume which made for a wondrous occasion and beautiful wedding pictures. That was over a decade ago and every day, through thick and thin this loving couple has faced head on everything life could throw at them, with no fear as each knew they had each other when they needed them the most.

Now it is time for the next level of their love, a family. They will be welcoming a precious soul into their lives, a baby boy. What a lucky child this will be, I can not imagine a child that will receive as much love and care as the boy that will complete Kube and Sheri's lives. But as it is often in life, this year hasn't been a banner year for them, but how many of us can say the same thing? There has been great loss and illness, loss of jobs and wages, unforeseen expenses and hardships, like a test has been thrust upon them during these 9 months challenging their will and what a valiant effort was given by both the expectant mother and father! 

I personally would like to see a relief effort given by all the friends they have met along their journey and I am not asking alot as you can see by the low amount I am asking. I pray and hope we meet that goal and shatter that number giving them the added support that will ensure this new family to thrive from the beginning, so that they can keep not only the boy growing safe happy and healthy, but their relationship as well. Theirs is a love that grows stronger in times of strife, but as friends we ask ourselves "is it necessary?" I think not, I think these two have more than earned some overdue peace and security.

Tis the season of good cheer, compassion and charity and I have always been the sort to give until it hurts. I'm not asking that of you, just for you to acknowledge there is a need that you can fulfill here with whatever you can give. I have been out of work for 2 months, and am living on a pittance from unemployment, yet I gave $75 via paypal to help, and I will give on this site as well. I am asking you to give what you can, be it $1, $5 whatever you can, after all, charity begins at home and that is all they want in life, a home filled with love, a healthy child and a bright future. Thank you for stopping by my page, please give and make this holiday season the best they have had so far on their journey through life.

story:
Help:  It's a simple word. It's a complicated action.

Help:  It's also a difficult thing to ask for, and sometimes it seems that because of that, so many people who need it also go without it. It includes any number of services.

Help: Anyone can do it, but sometimes, they need others to join them in providing it. It's an action word. Please take action?

 

Marvin's Story
My name is Marvin Haak Jr, In October 2010 I was diagonsed with a rare colon cancer, Melanoma of the colon. This is an aggressive fast moving cancer that does not respond to conventional treatment methods well. Primary treatments of Maligant Anoreltal Melanoma is surgery.
 
  There has been some reported responses to Radiation treatment but also a high failure rate. My doctors and I are giving the radiation a try as there is little known about this cancer. I have had three surgery's so far as they find cancer, Two colon resections and a left side lower Lymph Node removal.
 
 My doctors are open minded about alternative cancer treatments. But insurance doesn't pay for alternative cancer treatments, they also only cover 70% of my conventional treatments and surgery. This is why I need your Help.
 
 

The Impact

 

The goal of this campaign is to alleviate some of the financial burden off of Marvin. The stress of worrying about money for the costs that insurance does not cover and what they will not cover as far as treatments go is taking my focus away from what should be my main job, healing myself.

 

 Any money raised will go toward uncovered medical costs and alternative treatments that I have started but am now cutting back on due to my funds running out. I have more faith in the alternative treatments working and cutting back on them due to funds is scary. As I feel they are doing more good at fighting this cancer than anything.

 

 

What We Need

 

 My hope is to raise enought funds to get back on track with the alternative healing methods I have started. I know times are tough but I need your help to fight this. Even if you can only offer a dollar, ( I only need 19.000 of you, Hey you never know.) It will be a great help.

 

I truly appreciate any donations you may make. Thank You.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 Please help spread this campaign by word of mouth, Facebook or Twitter friends, Email contacts. Your friends, colleagues, family members. Any help counts toward making a difference.

 Thank you for all your help.

 

Follow my story at: www.caringbridge.org/visit/marvinhaakcancerjourney

story:
Pour la version française, cliquez : http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IInWedV1zWw

Triverdad Needs You 

In 2010, I immigrated to Canada from Togo, and shortly thereafter launched my business, Triverdad Naturalif Ltd. 

My mission is to show the world that the fountain of youth really does exist. It exists in nature--in the plants and trees that surround us. I have the utmost regard for the environment and believe we can all benefit from what the natural world offers.  

As a certified herbalist, I search worldwide for the purest natural and organic ingredients and at the same time, support rural women's cooperatives by contributing shares of Triverdad's profits. For the women of the rural cooperatives the cooperative may be their only source of income.

We need your help to continue sourcing the best ingredients from around the world and developing more formulas from rare and noble plants. We will build stronger relationships within the co-operative networks by ensuring members are being treated equitably. 

A Little Goes A Long Way

With $30,000 CAD, we can expand our product line and make visits to rural co-operatives to ensure the members are receiving their shares and are being treated with justice and respect. Specifically, we will...

  • focus on the development of a new line of anti-aging products (we have over 30 new formulas waiting to be tested).
  • travel to Peru to locate a rural co-operative from which to source the valuable Sacha Inchi Oil. This oil contains no cholesterol yet is an excellent source of Omega 3 and Omega 6. This oil contains the highest level of essential fatty acids, yet the lowest level of saturated fatty acids compared to other oils.
  • travel to Morocco where our argan oil is sourced and meet with the rural women co-operative in order to enhance our partnerships.

We are grateful for your contribution and hope you will enjoy the Perks we are offering. All Perk products ship FREE to the U.S.A and Canada. International contributors, please add $ 15 CAD to your Perk for shipping.

We will ship Freshen Up, Oil Up, Bundle Up and Bundle Up More by December 2013.

Exclusive preview and pre-order form for Line Up contributors will be sent via e-mail November, 2013.

The Impact of Your Contribution

We return 3% of our profits to the rural cooperatives who provide us with ingredients for our products. At Triverdad, we strive to balance a respect for the bounties that nature provides along with ensuring fair trade, sustainable practices, and economic and social justice for all.

Your contribution will help us secure more partnerships and maintain the relationships we have in in Morocco, Peru, Ghana, Ivory Coast, Senegal, and India. 

Why is Everyone Talking about Argan Oil?

The first product I sold at Triverdad was Argan oil. Argan oil is extracted from the kernels of the argan nut. The argan tree grows wild only in Morocco.

Argan oil is a noble oil, meaning that it is both rare and beneficial to our health. Argan oil is rich in Vitamin E, Essential Fatty Acids, Carotenoids, Ferulic Acid and so much more. Triverdad offers 100 % pure, organically sourced argan Oil for both culinary and cosmetic purposes. The roasted kind can be used as a luxurious substitute for salad oil and as a nutritional supplement. Use the un-roasted kind as a substitute for your face, body, or hair moisturizer. Compared to other oils, argan oil is lightweight and absorbs quickly into the skin and hair, leaving it wonderfully soft. Cosmetic argan oil can also help reduce scarring, uneven skin tones, and fine lines.

http://www.triverdad.com/en/products/organic_natural_plants_oil.php

                                                      

Other Ways You Can Help

      • Know someone who would like our products or support our cause? Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
      • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
      • Visit our website: http://www.triverdad.com/ and check out our full line of products and products coming soon.

Did You Know?

I speak Ewe, Mina, Arabic, French and English and when when I am not developing formulas, I can be found playing keyboard, flute or guitar. I have released two CDs and am known in the music world as Yvance Cadoni ( with 2 CDs recorded and released in 1994 and 2001; and on YouTube)

story:
Each year there are 185,000 new amputations performed in the United States alone; one every three minutes...In less time than it took to watch this video another life altering amputation has taken place.  


Our Technology at a Glance...



Our Cause


Improve the lives of amputees across the world, through better technology

The most courageous individuals we know are amputees.  In the face of one of the most devastating events that can happen to a person, these folks get up everyday and inspire others with their courage and determination.  

We want to help our Veterans, Soldiers, Children and Grandparents who have had to face an amputation...

What is most rewarding as a prosthetist is to see someone take steps for the first time after undergoing an amputation.  We want to provide a solution for amputees throughout the world and raise the standard of care in advanced prosthetic socket technology.  Our goal is to provide every amputee a prosthesis with artificial intelligence to reward their courage through increased comfort, control and prevention of injury to their limbs.


Tyler...  Doing what Tyler does.  (Which is pretty much whatever he wants to do!)

The Problem...


For many years advancements in prosthetics have been in knees and feet.  Very little has been done to advance the most important part of the prosthesis, the socket; the portion that the amputee slides their leg into.  The socket determines the comfort level, function and responsiveness of a prosthetic device.  For the last 20 years the most advanced feature about a prosthetic socket was the type of material it was made of…  plastic, fiberglass or carbon fiber.  Crazy... We know.


What is the SMARTPUCK?

The SmartPuck is the world's first and only socket based artificial intelligence system that can actually communicate with the amputee via their smart device.  This intelligent system is on the forefront of bionic prosthetic technology and can improve the fit, function and control of the prosthesis. The integrated sensor system helps protect the amputee from adverse conditions within the socket.

We have an unlimited capacity to expand the functionality and capability of the SmartPuck remotely through over the air updates.


This is the cool part...  We already have a ton of electronics and hardware packed into the SmartPuck.  Through push software packages we can add / change the functions of the SmartPuck.

With your help these APPs are on our hit list to launch early next year!

Puck Concept


We set out to design a socket that would incorporate a microprocessor and a series of on-board sensors that can  communicate with amputees in REAL TIME and advise the user how to remedy adverse conditions. The system is able to provide socket diagnostics and relay written messages and warnings before tissue damage occurs.

"Imagine if you were an amputee and had limited sensation in your limb.  You are out with your family at a family reunion and your smartphone texts you  "Please adjust your prosthesis because excess pressure has been detected on the end of your leg." This dialogue between the user and the prosthesis could save countless surgeries and prevent serious injuries to prosthetic users."

Royce CPO- Adaptec Prosthetics LLC

How Does It Work?


Real simple, the prosthetic socket (part the amputee's leg slides into) is manufactured with a void in the very end of the socket, which is typical in the industry.  The Puck is inserted into the void, the Puck now becomes the bottom of the socket and is open to the environment of the prosthesis so it is possible to access, analyze and control the internal socket!  The vacuum system creates a secure connection between the prosthesis and the amputee so that no movement can occur. This positive linkage allows for better control and more comfort.

Royce and Mike customizing a new SmartPuck Socket back in the lab...

Simplicity In Design


The SmartPuck is very unassuming...undetectable on a prosthesis.  Because the SmartPuck is inside the socket it sets the bar for simplicity in design and function.

"Great engineering is not a device with 50 buttons and lots of cool widgets, Great engineering is a device with one button with 50 widgets working you can't see.”  

David Firth-  Provel Inc.



Green Prosthetic Technology


The SmartPuck system supports the use of 3D printers, which produce no mold material waste.  We promote the use of recyclable socket materials.  The SmartPuck unit is a modular unit so no waste occurs from connection components that are permanently installed in traditional sockets.

Features

Where We Are Today


After years of development we have officially launched the SmartPuck.   We have reached the following milestones:

  • The first release featured an internal vacuum unit that helps suspend the prosthesis to the amputees limb
  • Completed the APP that controls the vacuum system which is currently available on the iTunes store
  • Patent Pending on three products
  • Granted UL (Class II Medical Device) Certification in June 2013
  • We have secured an agreement with Apple to be part of their gifting program
  • We have added a prosthetic fabrication facility to help aide prosthetic clinics around the nation manufacture the sockets that are adapted to fit the SmartPuck (many clinics out source their fabrication)

Most of all we are ready to bring the intelligence feature of the system to life!


What's The Money For?


App Development : To advance the smart socket functionality. We can develop and infinite number of Apps that will give amputees critical information about their prosthesis including :

Physical Pressure - To prevent wounds and skin breakdown so further amputation of the residual limb is not required.

Moisture and Temperature - Monitor conditions inside the socket.

Gait - To ensure appropriate body alignment, reducing stress to the sound limb. 

...and data to justify to insurance that you need and deserve a new prosthesis!

CE Mark Certification : Required in order to provide this technology to amputees in Europe. 

Early Stage Development : Advance SmartPuck technology for above knee amputees. 


Our Journey


It sure would be cool if your leg could talk to you...

The SmartPuck was invented by two clinical prosthetists (the guys who make legs) in Colorado and inspired by amputees that were looking for something better. One of the most secure ways to hold a prosthesis onto a limb is elevated vacuum.  Our team had used existing products on the market and had the same complaint from all of our patients "the vacuum feels good , but it leaks and is too much trouble to maintain the system."  We set out with the goal of fixing the problems with existing elevated vacuum systems and developed the first vacuum system that is designed to go inside the prosthesis. By placing the vacuum pump within the socket chamber, we eliminated 99% of the problems that occur.  One day, as we were working on the Bluetooth configuration we booted up the office computers and there it was... the new iPhone from Apple was released (2007).  The light went off, "why can't we use the phone to control and communicate with the prosthesis".  We have been hard at it ever since!



We Need Your Help!



We respectfully ask for your support in our endeavor to improve the lives of amputees throughout the world by helping us bring the first intelligent socket computer system to life.  We have taken the SmartPuck system a long way, but we need your help and support to realize the full potential of this artificial intelligence system for amputees.  

Today with your help, we can fundamentally change the most important part of prosthetic technology...  the socket.  

We understand if you can't contribute, you can still help us in our quest!

Spread the Word

Please forward this link to anyone you feel could  help us spread the word about improving prosthetic care for amputees by leveraging Indiegogo's awesome share tools!

Refer A Friend

You can still earn a Free SmartPuck Hoodie from our Referral Program by referring  three friends that donate a minimum of $80 each.

How to participate in our referral program:

Simply log in to Indiegogo if you have not already, or create an account by signing up here. Be sure to use the same account you used when you claimed your SmartPuck Perk! Then, look below our main video at the top of this page for buttons to share and copy your Unique URL.

Post our campaign on the internet by clicking the link icon at the top of the page under the video.

OR

Begin sharing on social media by simply clicking the Facebook or Twitter buttons located below the video at the top of the page with your URL pre-loaded.

Get creative!

Hit the Ground Running...  With a SmartPuck

Rob, with the SmartPuck System and his sprint foot getting ready to show this Vet still has it!

Check Out Dave Getting after it at the Garden of the Gods in Colorado Springs...

Testimonials


Robert:  "I have had my smart puck now for about 3 weeks.  I am so happy to have one.  No more loose sockets, no more friction sores, no more painful walking.  It has changed my walking completely.  I am 63 and live on a small horse farm with my wife.  I am very active (have to be) and this system has really, really, helped me to be able to do the work around the place.  It has also helped the chronic back pain.  Not totally eliminated it, but I have had a substantial drop in it.  I wish I could have had this smart puck back in 1987 when I lost my right leg bk."

Mike: "The SmartPuck has changed my life.  I have never had a prosthesis actually feel like it’s a part of me."

Dee:  "What a difference ...the vacuum is the most comfortable socket I have ever had!"

Dave:  "I love the fact I can control my prosthetic with my iPhone,  it is awesome.  I can perform on a completely new level."


Matt:  "This technology is a game changer"


The Good Stuff...



What happens If We Don’t Hit Our Goal?

We will put your hard earned money to the task you have entrusted it to us for.  We will complete the artificial intelligence Applications in layers.  We have the projects broken down into subsets as low 2K.  As soon as a new APP is completed, we simply upload it to the APP stores and let all of the wonderful amputees using our products download the new features.

Shipping

Shipping costs are included in your perk.  All perks will be shipped by Dec 15, 2014

Team


Our team has been dedicated to improving the standard of prosthetic care for the past 30 years.  We want to fundamentally change the expectation of what a prosthetic socket can do... Our goal is to improve the quality of life for every amputee through significant improvements in prosthetic technology!

Partners


                    

                Advantage Development                                                  Shofi Partners


                 

                          Steel Rock Films                                                  City of Littleton



Questions?  We Have Answers.

How Do I contact Someone from the SmartPuck Team?

Visit our contact page of our web site at www.smartpuck.net

Telephone Contact 1-800-460-0288

 


What's The Money For?


App Development : To advance the smart socket functionality. We can develop and infinite number of Apps that will give amputees critical information about their prosthesis including :

Physical Pressure - To prevent wounds and skin breakdown so further amputation of the residual limb is not required.

Moisture and Temperature - Monitor conditions inside the socket.

Gait - To ensure appropriate body alignment, reducing stress to the sound limb. 

...and data to justify to insurance that you need and deserve a new prosthesis!

CE Mark Certification : Required in order to provide this technology to amputees in Europe. 

Early Stage Development : Advance SmartPuck technology for above knee amputees.
story_txt:
Each year there are 185,000 new amputations performed in the United States alone; one every three minutes...In less time than it took to watch this video another life altering amputation has taken place.  

Our Technology at a Glance...







Our CauseImprove the lives of amputees across the world, through better technologyThe most courageous individuals we know are amputees.  In the face of one of the most devastating events that can happen to a person, these folks get up everyday and inspire others with their courage and determination.  We want to help our Veterans, Soldiers, Children and Grandparents who have had to face an amputation...What is most rewarding as a prosthetist is to see someone take steps for the first time after undergoing an amputation.  We want to provide a solution for amputees throughout the world and raise the standard of care in advanced prosthetic socket technology.  Our goal is to provide every amputee a prosthesis with artificial intelligence to reward their courage through increased comfort, control and prevention of injury to their limbs.Tyler...  Doing what Tyler does.  (Which is pretty much whatever he wants to do!)The Problem...
For many years advancements in prosthetics have been in knees and feet.  Very little has been done to advance the most important part of the prosthesis, the socket; the portion that the amputee slides their leg into.  The socket determines the comfort level, function and responsiveness of a prosthetic device.  For the last 20 years the most advanced feature about a prosthetic socket was the type of material it was made of…  plastic, fiberglass or carbon fiber.  Crazy... We know.

What is
the SMARTPUCK?
The SmartPuck
is the world's first and only socket based artificial intelligence system that
can actually communicate with the amputee via their smart device.  This
intelligent system is on the forefront of bionic prosthetic technology and can
improve the fit, function and control of the prosthesis. The integrated sensor
system helps protect the amputee from adverse conditions within the socket.

We have an unlimited capacity to expand the functionality and capability of the SmartPuck remotely through over the air updates.


This is the cool part...  We already have a ton of electronics and hardware packed into the SmartPuck.  Through push software packages we can add / change the functions of the SmartPuck.
With your help these APPs are on our hit list to launch early next year!





Puck Concept

We set out to design a socket that would incorporate a microprocessor and a series of on-board sensors that can  communicate with amputees in REAL TIME and advise the user how to remedy adverse conditions. The system is able to provide socket diagnostics and relay written messages and warnings before tissue damage occurs.

"Imagine if you were an amputee and had limited sensation in your limb.  You are out with your family at a family reunion and your smartphone texts you  "Please adjust your prosthesis because excess pressure has been detected on the end of your leg." This dialogue between the user and the prosthesis could save countless surgeries and prevent serious injuries to prosthetic users."
Royce CPO- Adaptec Prosthetics LLC





How Does It Work?

Real simple, the prosthetic socket (part the amputee's leg slides into) is manufactured with a void in the very end of the socket, which is typical in the industry.  The Puck is inserted into the void, the Puck now becomes the bottom of the socket and is open to the environment of the prosthesis so it is possible to access, analyze and control the internal socket!  The vacuum system creates a secure connection between the prosthesis and the amputee so that no movement can occur. This positive linkage allows for better control and more comfort.
Royce and Mike customizing a new SmartPuck Socket back in the lab...




Simplicity In Design

The SmartPuck is very unassuming...undetectable on a prosthesis.  Because the SmartPuck is inside the socket it sets the bar for simplicity in design and function.
"Great engineering is not a device with 50 buttons and lots of cool widgets, Great engineering is a device with one button with 50 widgets working you can't see.”  
David Firth-  Provel Inc.



Green Prosthetic Technology

The SmartPuck system supports the use of 3D printers, which produce no mold material waste.  We promote the use of recyclable socket materials.  The SmartPuck unit is a modular unit so no waste occurs from connection components that are permanently installed in traditional sockets.



Features







Where We Are Today


After years of
development we have officially launched the SmartPuck.   We have reached the following milestones:



The first release
featured an internal vacuum unit that helps suspend the prosthesis to the
amputees limb


Completed the APP that controls the vacuum
system which is currently available on the iTunes store


Patent Pending
on three products


Granted UL
(Class II Medical Device) Certification in June 2013

We have secured
an agreement with Apple to be part of their gifting program

We have added a
prosthetic fabrication facility to help aide prosthetic clinics around the
nation manufacture the sockets that are adapted to fit the SmartPuck (many
clinics out source their fabrication)


Most of all we
are ready to bring the intelligence feature of the system to life!

Physical Pressure - To prevent wounds and skin breakdown so further amputation of the residual limb is not required.

...and data to justify to insurance that you need and deserve a new prosthesis!

story:
Short Summary

 

Judy is a vibrant 38 year old woman who was recently diagnosed with Polycythemia Vera. 

Polycythemia vera is a disorder of the bone marrow. It causes  overproduction of red blood cells, although the numbers of white blood cells and platelets are also increased.

It is a rare disease that occurs more often in men than women, and is rare in patients under age 40. It is usually associated with a gene mutation called JAK2V617F. The cause of this mutation is unknown.

Symptoms include but not limited to Breathing difficulty, Dizziness, Excessive bleeding, Fullness in the left upper abdomen (due to enlarged spleen), Headaches, Fatigue, Itchiness, Shortness of breath.

Because this disorder is still a relative unknown in the medical world, medical insurance providers do not all recognize or align the necessary treatments and medications to this disorder.

Judy's treatment has been thus far harrowing.  She has been taking several prescription medications, has frequent and painful blood draws (phlebotomies), bone marrow biopsies, DNA biopsies, and more. She has been prone to dizzy spells, blackouts, dangerously high body temps, and more. The Hematologist has tried to get her stabilized with medications and phlebotomies. Each time her red count starts to drop, a monkey wrench is thrown into the mix.

The thick blood caused by Polycythemia Vera is more prone to clotting.  Judy realized this as she suffered several minor strokes early on in the process.  Since these TIA's cause some vein damage, she is also now being treated by a Neurologist for these issues.

Since she works in a medical office, she is susceptible to infections, and one of these infections entered her blood stream through an open cut in one of her fingers.  This again threw treatment off as the Hematologist and Neurologist had to react and rethink treatment options.

With all the bone marrow biopsies, CAT scans, MRI's, medications, and procedures she has needed, and in short order, her medical bills have piled up.  Her healthcare insurance provider does NOT cover most of the treatments and she is going several times per week for these.  She is on several different and expensive medications such as hydroxyurea and coumadin/warfarin which again medical insurance only partially covers.  She continues to work her job at the medical office, and care for others around her while herself being fatigued and trying to make ends meet. She needs help, from some kind hearted person/people in order to meet the demands of the disorder.

This campaign is set up to help Judy pay her mounting medical bills.  All of the donations, 100% will be channeled directly to her doctors/healthcare insurance provider. 

Those unable to donate cash, any and all leads in tracking down a cure for Polycythemia vera would be appreciated.  The medical community does not have a cure for it, but people can and do live relatively normal lives if treated properly.

 

Thank you for reading

story:
Our beloved son, brother, nephew and cousin, Charles Anthony Gonzalez left to the spirit world this morning, July 30, 2012, at 4:00am in Phoenix, AZ. 

He fought a short but courageous battle with cancer and now sits at the right hand of our dear lord Jesus Christ, an angel watching over all of us.  He earned his wings and his place in heaven.

Charles was loved by so many and touched a lot of lives. He was such a gifted and talented musician and athlete. We miss him so much already  :'(

Please find it in your heart to donate to his family so they can travel to South Dakota for a funeral to honor Charles' life.  Charles has family members in Arizona and South Dakota.  Funeral arrangments are pending - there will be a viewing in Arizona and a celebration of is life with his family in South Dakota.

Thank you in advance for your compassion and kindess.

We love you, Charles!

~The Family of Charles Gonzalez

story_txt: 

story:
Hi my name is Randy Oliver and I am doing this campaign for my mother. I have never done this before so please understand that.. The whole reason for this campaign is basically the fact that my families life was turned upside down two years ago. This  has affected my mom and dads life tremendously, And Im doing this for them.

I grew up in a normal family and a normal life, kinda spoiled if you want to know the truth. Then My parents got a divorce when I was 18 and things changed for the worse. I stayed with my dad and took it out on my mom cause I really didnt know what to do. My dad was so depressed and lost his job then we lost the house cars and he bikes. So we basically lost everything that we ever had in a very short period of time.

I didnt talk to my mom for almost a year cause I blamed her, my dad made me make amends with my mother and we tried to have a relationship. What it all comes down to is me feeling like she is going to be taken way to soon.  My parents have know each other since the third grade, and are despite the things that happened they are together and happy.

Then two years ago my mom began to feel numbness in her leg and then completely lost feeling, so they rushed her to the hospital and next thing I knew they said her leg had a blood clot and they were going to amputate!? I didnt understand how fast this could happen, but it brought the family that I let get away from me back together. My mom went in to immediate surgery, they cut her left leg off under the knee and tried to leave as much as they could but it was infected in the blood and then made her delirious. She was basically dying from blood infection, so they took her back for another surgery. Had to take her left leg above the knee this time to get all the dead tissue. She was in the ICU for Two months and basically in a medical coma and doesnt remember anything from us coming by to visit. This was heartbreaking looking at your mother and her looking at you like she had no idea who you were and sometimes looking into a gaze. She got fluid on her lungs and almost died three different times. It was the craziest thing I ever could of imagined for a woman who was just fine a month ago and only in her early 50's....

So the doctors finally got her health under control and brought he back to life again. We eventually got to take her home and she has been home most of the time since. She is now in a wheel chair and needs assistant due to losing her leg. My dad has had to quit his career to stay home with her, and take a job that pays him just enough money to pay bills. All cause its close to home now and he can take care of her more. They have known each other over thirty years and he still calls her his sweetheart after everything they have been through. My dad wants to do everything he can for her but he financially cannot. I cannot afford the things for them either that is why im here asking for any help I can. All I want to do for them is help them pay those medical bills that medicaid doesnt cover, there are a few prescriptions that they cant afford. And I would also like to get my mom dentures, she has teeth falling out and she is ashamed to smile and even leave the house cause of her teeth. Then if I can get enough money raised for her to get her dentures. I would like to help them with these extra bills and even try to give her some sort of self indulging to make her smile again..Maybe that is just a mancure or something of that nature or even a two day getaway to a lake house or something exciting..  Please if anyone can help this is definitely a good cause. I dont know how to repay everyone for helping but prayers will be sent your way!

What We Need

  • The money raised here will be used for Medical expenses, transportation costs, Dentures, and other unforeseen costs.
  • There is no amount that is “too little”, whether its $5 to $5000.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Forward this website and/or Facebook page to everyone you know!
  • Email friends and family and ask for their support

IF YOU CANT MAKE A DONATION PRAYERS ARE GOOD. AND IF YOU KNOW ANYONE THAT CAN OR WOULD LIKE TO HELP PLEASE FORWARD THIS INFORMATION TO THEM FOR ME!

THANK YOU GOD BLESS!!

I would like to help them with these extra bills and even try to give her some sort of self indulging to make her smile again..Maybe that is just a mancure or something of that nature or even a two day getaway to a lake house or something exciting..  Please if anyone can help this is definitely a good cause. I dont know how to repay everyone for helping but prayers will be sent your way!
What We Need

The money raised here will be used for Medical expenses, transportation costs, Dentures, and other unforeseen costs.
There is no amount that is “too little”, whether its $5 to $5000.

Other Ways You Can Help

Forward this website and/or Facebook page to everyone you know!
Email friends and family and ask for their support

IF YOU CANT MAKE A DONATION PRAYERS ARE GOOD. AND IF YOU KNOW ANYONE THAT CAN OR WOULD LIKE TO HELP PLEASE FORWARD THIS INFORMATION TO THEM FOR ME!
THANK YOU GOD BLESS!!

story:
Project Description

VedaBars are based on the ancient science of Ayurveda, the sister philosophy to yoga, which emphasizes health through a properly balanced and nutritious diet.

The idea for the first VedaBar came to me as I was shopping at a local health food store in New York City. I came across the energy bar section, which is a place I never usually go to, only because I’m NOT a ‘bar person’ - I don’t believe that most energy bars are made consciously and are generally over-processed.

I started reading the backs of each of the labels and couldn’t believe what I was reading. So many preservatives, excessive and complex sugars and when I tasted some of them, they ranged from dry and bland to sticky and sweet.    I couldn’t understand why anybody would over-engineer something so simple you can still have great taste with 1/3 the ingredients being used and it can still be nutritious. That was it. The light bulb went on.


VedaBars are made from whole and organic ingredients that you can identify when you open the package. By using whole food whose flavors already play very well with each other, there is no need to add artificial anything.

We’re asking for you help to fund VedaBars because we’ve been getting incredible interest in the bars so we are hoping to upgrade our packaging, increase our production to meet the current demand and broaden our reach new customers in the marketplace 

Project Rewards

For those people pledging $1-$10, we will include your name on our thank you wall on Facebook and on www.vedabars.com

For those people who pledge $15-$30, we will add your name on our thank you wall on Facebook and on www.vedabars.com as well as send you one of each bar to enjoy.

For those people who pledge $50-$75, we will we will add your name on our thank you wall on Facebook and on www.vedabars.com, as well as send you a mixed case (4 of each bar) to enjoy. 
  
If you would like to pledge $100 or more, we’ll send you a mixed case of bars and Deacon will send you a test to determine your body type as well as recommendations on how to stay healthy.

story:
Prohora

Do you suffer from neck, back, shoulders, knees, elbows, and everywhere else pain? Then Prohora Fire and Ice is for you!!! My name is Helen. I am a licensed massage therapist and graduate student. I see people every day who are in pain, mostly neck, shoulders, and back pain. My boss has me pushing a certain topical pain cream (I won't mention which brand) and has asked me to use it on my clients. I HATE that stuff. It has a strong smell and the stuff burns my eyes every time I open the jar.

I started doing research on the ingredients found in most topical pain creams. What I found really shocked me. Chemical compounds that can be found in antifreeze is in one name brand topical analgesic. No Thanks!! No wonder my eyes burned when I opened the jar. I also learned the hard way not to have it on my hands when touching personal private parts (OUCH!!!).

My research started in earnest after that. It took me almost a year to come up with my formula. After a lot of trial and error I had the finished product, Prohora Fire and Ice. An all natural, organic, paraben free, vegan, topical analgesic. The best part is that this cream does not make my eyes water and does not burn any private parts. 


Prohora Fire and Ice is made from organic herbal extracts that have been shown to reduce pain and inflammation. Herbs such as chamomile, stinging nettle, and arnica montana are just some of the ingredients found in Prohora Fire and Ice. It also has the Mediterranean spice called boswellia, better known as frankincense. There is a ton of research material on the benefits of all these extracts. The active ingredients which give Prohora its fire and ice are menthol and camphor.   

Prohora Fire and Ice:

  • Helps reduce muscle pain
  • Helps reduce joint inflammation
  • Has organic ingredients
  • Has pleasant smell

On going clinical trails show remarkable results on Prohora's effectiveness.

What We Need & What You Get

I am seeking $65,000 for Prohora Fire and Ice. These funds will pay for mass production, marketing, and government fees. I have received quotes on the cost of mass production and it is not cheap. But, the good part is that it will be completely turnkey. The manufacturer will take my formula and produce a quality product. They will produce it, bottle it, label it, and file all government forms. Whew, what a huge relief not to deal with the FDA. I have gone cross eyed trying to figure out all the requirements for FDA approval. Attorney fees not included.

For your generous donation you will receive your own bottle of Prohora Fire and Ice.  A $10 donation receives the 1 ounce package of Prohora Fire and Ice and those who donate $25 receive a 4 ounce package of Prohora Fire and Ice.


The Impact

Receiving this money will allow me to introduce Prohora Fire and Ice to the world. I have been selling locally and have had amazing results. Those who I have used this cream on have told me what a huge difference it has made in their lives. It has made a huge difference in my life. I suffer with arthritis in my knees. Prohora Fire and Ice has reduced the inflammation and pain. It has allowed me to walk without a brace.

As a massage therapist my goal is to help people who are in pain. I love my job so much I would do it for free. In fact, I have given my services away on many occasions. What Prohora Fire and Ice allows my to do is help everyone near and far. 


    Risks & Challenges

    I consider myself the artistic type. I hated math classes in school and have struggled to understand number crunching. My biggest challenge has been developing a good business plan to present to prospective investors and banks. I am overcoming that challenge by partnering with someone who has an MBA is an MD and DC. Without her input I would still be at the development stage instead of at the production stage.

    I also value the advice from a very close family member who is a successful business man and who has shown me my worth. He recently told me to not give up. He believes in Prohora Fire and Ice and knows how passionate I am about my product. What I lack in business knowledge I make up for in a strong desire to offer a quality product that has been proven to work.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Help me get the word out!! Tell your friends, family, and co-workers about my campaign for funding my project.

story:
About Us

Cataracts are the leading cause of preventable blindness worldwide. In Honduras alone, there are more than 50,000 people who suffer from cataract blindness. For almost all of these patients, vision can be fully restored with minimal resources and a 20-minute surgery. For 20 years, ECHO Foundation (Eradicate Cataracts Honduras Outreach) has supported Honduran ophthalmology with a three-fold mission: support sustainable practices that increase surgical volumes, contribute to educational and infrastructure improvements, and help grow the ophthalmology sector in Honduras.

 Before and After Cataract Surgery.

In 2013, ECHO Foundation began a partnership with the San Pedro Sula Lions Eye Hospital Fraternidad to increase the number of cataract surgeries performed at their facility as part of ECHO’s Unidos Visión Sustainability Initiative. For the past 10 years, Hospital Fraternidad has performed hundreds of cataract surgeries per year, but has yet to break 1,000. Similarly sized facilities in the developed world routinely perform several thousand surgeries per year. Along the way, we have learned that a major obstacle to increasing the number of sight-saving surgeries at Hospital Fraternidad is outdated, broken, or missing equipment.

To overcome this problem and increase the number of cataract surgeries in Honduras, we are launching a three-year fundraising campaign to bring modern equipment to this non-profit eye hospital. Over the next three years, we will launch twelve fundraising campaigns, each focused on vital piece of equipment. With this new equipment, we expect to increase surgical volumes to 1,500 per year!

What We Need & What You Get

The first step of this three-year program to increase surgical volumes is to replace the current operating microscope at Hospital Fraternidad.

The current microscope is out-of-date and makes surgery more difficult, slower, and riskier. $15,000 will purchase a modern microscope that provides better light and a clearer picture of the eye, making the surgeon’s job easier. The microscope purchased for this campaign will have a teaching head, an invaluable training tool that allows a second doctor or technician to view the same picture that the operating surgeon has during surgery. Donations that exceed the $15,000 goal will be used for additional cataract surgery supplies.

With the successful close of each quarterly campaign, we will work with our partners in the US and Honduras to purchase, ship, and install the new equipment. Finally, we will also collaborate to ensure that there are adequate resources to maintain the equipment that is being placed in the hospital.


This is the only semi-functional microscope at the Lions Eye Hospital (even though there are three operating beds!). It is out-of-date and the image quality has deteriorated. Although the excellent surgeons at the Lions Eye Hospital continue to use it, it gives them headaches as they perform surgeries with it all day.

Perks

For the many of you out there thinking about it:

$25 – Thumbs up! Receive a personalized thank you post card.

$100 – Join the wall of fame! Your name will be displayed on a special wall in the hospital with other supporters (plus the above).

$250 – Wear your support! You will receive one of the 25 limited edition t-shirts designed especially for this project (plus all of the above).

$1000 – Join the club! Become a member of the select group who have supported ECHO at the Buena Vista level ($1,000 and above). You will be publicly recognized on ECHO’s website and receive a commemorative plaque thanking you for your support (plus all of the above).

$5000 – See the impact first hand in Honduras! You will receive an invitation to join one of the quarterly surgical brigades that ECHO runs and see first-hand the great work that local and volunteer doctors can do with the right equipment (plus all of the perks above).

The Impact

Reaching 1,500 cataract surgeries per year is a realistic goal for Hospital Fraternidad with modern equipment because of the following reasons:

1.  There is a clear demand for these surgeries.

2.  ECHO and the San Pedro Sula Lions are organizations with a long-term commitment to addressing cataract blindness in Honduras.

3.  There is a growing team of committed doctors, technicians, nurses and administrators (both in the US and Honduras) working to eradicate cataract blindness.

These factors have produced a growth in the number of surgeries performed at Hospital Fraternidad from 453 in 2012 to an expected 1,000 in 2014. However, the hospital’s main bottleneck relates to the antiquated equipment that its medical staff must rely on or the missing equipment they lack.

ECHO Foundation has a 20 year track record as a protagonist for Honduran ophthalmology. The San Pedro Sula Lions have been working on issues related to Honduran ophthalmology for more than 20 years. There is every reason to expect that the hospital will one day perform 2,500 cataract surgeries per year.

 

Our team of dedicated ECHO and San Pedro Sula Lions members.

Risks & Challenges

Ordinarily, it would be difficult to quantify the impacts placing surgical equipment at a facility in a developing country has on surgical volumes and facility sustainability. This is why we will be working with the San Pedro Sula Lions to closely monitor our surgical impacts, as well as the impact of our expansion program on the hospital’s financial status. We will be updating future campaigns with changes in surgical volume as we introduce new equipment to the hospital.

Keeping functional equipment working and in good condition has historically been difficult at facilities in developing countries. Some of the revenues from increased surgical volumes will be set aside in a maintenance reserve to be used when needed to ensure that the equipment will remain in top working condition.

This campaign is just the first step in turning the Lion’s Hospital into a modern facility that can effectively eliminate cataract blindness in Honduras. Building upon existing in-country resources and working with an established local network will maximize the effect of each capital equipment impact. Even with limited resources, the Lions Hospital has performed hundreds of surgeries per year in the past. Your support in this campaign will allow us to grow the hospital to full operating capacity and positively impact the more than 50,000 poor cataract blind people in Honduras.

Other Ways You Can Help

Your support doesn’t just need to be a donation. It helps us and the people of Honduras if you just share the link and spread the word with your friends and family!

Use Indiegogo share tools to share this campaign. Like our facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Unidos-Vision/423592447707117 and stay tuned to future campaigns and ECHO’s website for updates: www.operationECHO.org

You can also find out other ways you can support and volunteer for the cause by contacting Kyle Coffey through email kcoffey@operationecho.org.

story:
Hi I am Shanina Knighton, a registered nurse with clinical experience in surgical care and research and a PhD student at Case Western Reserve University Frances Payne Bolton School of Nursing. My husband Robert Knighton is a great support to my endeavors so I felt inclined to share with you that he is a civil engineer and has a background in project management, business development, sales, marketing, and education.This is important because I refer to us in everything that I may do.

This campaign is very important to us for numerous reasons. Watching two very important women in our lives struggle in their last days of life was daunting for us. It was not because of the care they received, but because they just wanted clean hands. For example, Robert’s grandmother had a stroke and with the left side of her body not working, she would use her right hand to pick the dirt from under her fingernails in effort to keep them clean. I have watched hundreds and hundreds of patients in my presence not readily have the luxury of convenient ways to clean their hands. In 2011 very few people thought patient’s hands were an important issue, including large companies in this space! Since then there has been an amplification of patient hand hygiene research, resource support, and awareness from infection control leaders and hand sanitizer producers.

Contributions made by you to support our campaign is more important than you know. It will help put your mind at ease the next time your mother, sister, uncle, brother, or child go to the hospital and can’t get out of bed to clean their hands at important times such as after the doctor shook their hand, after using the urinal, or before eating a meal. Our product will serve as a voice for patients scared to ask healthcare workers to clean their hands when they come near you or your loved ones…35 million admissions per year to hospitals alone, excluding our 1.7 million aging adults…Wow! Look at the magnitude of what your contribution can mean in decreasing infections and illness. Remember at some point in our lives we will all be a patient.

The $15,000 that we are asking you to contribute will go towards product development. We have been working on a prototype through Think Box an entrepreneurial resource center at my school and will use the funding to purchase more materials. We have been working with different arduino technology in creation of our first preliminary model to go for larger funding. So you may be asking yourself “They started in 2011, why now?” Our answer is “Mistakes and we spent our money securing our patents.” The labor work done has been paid for out of pocket as well as with some small grant support and competition winnings!

What’s in it for you? The top contributor will have the luxury of helping us to name the dispenser! If you’re not the top contributor don’t worry. We will make sure that your generous contribution is recognized by giving you exclusive rights to see the first finished product right before the launch!

Why will this work? It will work because as we speak I am doing research in this area and I foresaw the challenges of current products on the market. A well respected Infection Preventionist told me I was ahead of my time. My husband and I are resilient people and continue to work diligently and have learned from the word “No.”

What are the risks? We have spoken with other companies in this space in hopes of partnerships and they might try to beat us to market. How do we plan on overcoming this? With your support. Even if you can’t support us financially please spread the word for our Patient Hand Hygiene Smart Dispenser. Be sure to practice when you go to the hospital it can save your life!

And that's all there is to it.

Preventionist told me I was ahead of my time. My husband and I are resilient
people and continue to work diligently and have learned from the word “No.”
What are the risks? We have spoken
with other companies in this space in hopes of partnerships and they might try
to beat us to market. How do we plan on overcoming this? With your support.
Even if you can’t support us financially please spread the word for our Patient
Hand Hygiene Smart Dispenser. Be sure to practice when you go to the hospital
it can save your life!
And that's all there is to it.

story:
I've desired a water birth since I found out I was pregnant, but when our insurance situation changed I was no longer quite sure if I was going to be able to do it. I continually watched birthing videos and asked other women questions about their birthing experience and the more and more I did the more it became settled within me that this was truly the desire of my heart. I had to at least try and see if there were anyway this could happen right? So I recently wrote a letter to the SB birthing center sharing our story and desire and was so blessed to find out that I was provided a 3,000 dollar grant…half way there...a huge help! 

As I was sharing with a friend my desire for this experience and how I was able to get the price lowered by so much they suggested why not build a fundraiser site. I wasn't that enthusiastic about the idea, but then he mentioned what if God wants to use others to raise the funds and what if we your friends want to support you in this. So here we are today with a fundraiser site for Giovanni's water birth and so thankful to have such amazing supportive friends in our lives. 

To be honest the reason I want this birth is simply because I want to solely rely on the Lord throughout the process and  to get to fully embrace the entire experience in the most natural, comfortable, and peaceful setting possible and I believe the SB birthing center would provide just that. 

The peace of knowing that our baby would be with us throughout the entire experience and surrounded by those whom love him truly is our greatest desire. To have the surety that those whom are helping me with the process are there because they truly care about my child and I would just bring so much relief and free me to focus more on the actual experience and of course on our baby.

So for this reason we are asking for your prayers and for your consideration in helping make this dream a reality whether it be by donation or by simply sharing this link on FB you are being a huge help.

Now let the fundraising begin…!

Thank you so much everyone, we so appreciate you all! 

with lots of love,

The Perez's


Ps. Any funds received that exceed our goal will be donated to the sb birthing center to help others who desire to experience a water birth but don't have the means to...

story:
My boyfriend, Jason, became a quadriplegic 5 years ago when he fell off of a bridge. Since then, he has had to face life each day from his wheelchair. After his accident, he lost function everything from the neck down- arms, hands and fingers, trunk, and legs. Thankfully, he has been able to recover a lot of muscle function in his shoulders and arms! He even has recently been able to finish college and graduate with his degree in Mathematics, and is currently looking for a job!  However, being paralyzed, it is hard for him to get the cardiovascular exercise that he needs to stay healthy. Having a hand cycle would allow him to get out into the community, and enjoy an activity outside of his wheelchair. This is a short video of a fellow quadriplegic using his hand cycle in a neighborhood around his home! 

The cost of the bike is $2,799.00 plus tax and shipping- a little more than either of us can afford in our current situations. This is the link to the bike!

http://bike-on.com/product/top-end-force-3-handcycle-2170.htm

 If you would like to help us out, Jason and I would be extremely grateful! If we do not meet our fundraising goals, any money donated to us will be automatically be refunded to you via PayPal- but hopefully we will! If you know someone who might be interested in his story, please pass this along!

story:
Short Summary

We are proud to present the Angel Up Foundation! We are non-profit foundation that will be serving people on a global level. 

It is time to bring integrative, preventative, holistic medicine and practices to compliment traditional medicine.

Right now we have limited access to options that compliment conventional medicine. We want to promote positive change that will unite those that have taken on the passionate goal to help people heal and overcome physical maladies no matter whether it is traditional or holistic medicine. We respect and applaud those who have taken that step towards tireless hours of education and time spent as medical professionals whether they are a physician, nurse or therapist.

We are developing different programs to benefit people on a global level. Our intention is to provide resources and education to everyone who is interested in understanding and taking a step forward in their own health and wellness. 

We will be creating options through educating people on what resources are available that may be outside what we consider traditional medicine. We are developing pilot programs with integrative and holistic practitioners to team up with traditional physicians in different hospital and healthcare settings. We are already partnering with known integrative doctors and practitioners nationally and internationally to provide services as our Global Provider Network.

A part of our vision is bridging the gap through worldwide education of available integrative medicine and preventative therapies while building programs that will provide low-cost health and wellness services to all individuals.

Help us help others live pain free, cancer free, disease free, and live healthier lifestyles by resources you helped build. It is time we come together and build a legacy for ourselves and future generations.
We hope that this is something that inspires you to be a part of the movement of unity and compassion.

The Impact you'll have



This is Don Walker and this is his story. Don Walker was diagnosed with prostate cancer in 2002.  He received 37 rounds of radiation. The cancer went into remission.  In January 2014 the cancer returned.  

Don was given options for treatment...

Option A - Referred for hormone therapy, which Don would not be able to function and possibly put him into a vegetative state and be detrimental to his life.

Option B - To do nothing...which is not an option.

Option C - Receiving integrative and holistic treatments with a clinic of his choice where the use of non-toxic therapies as well as emotional support to help Don get back on the road to health, recovery and a better quality of life.

We can make a difference for people like Don with your help with only $1 dollar.


Our Programs

We want to promote positive change that will unite those that have taken on the passionate goal to help people heal and overcome physical maladies no matter whether it is traditional or holistic medicine. We respect and applaud those who have taken that step towards tireless hours of education and time spent as medical professionals whether they are a physician, nurse or therapist.

We are developing three major programs as a new non-profit organization to benefit people on a global level.

Education

Our intention is to provide education to everyone who is interested in understanding and taking a step forward in their own health and wellness.

To go a step further, we will be partnering with accredited institutions for continued education for all medical personnel required for their certifications and licensing. We want to be able to assist in promoting integrative and holistic practices to assist in bringing more options in health care solutions.

Global Provider Network

We are already partnering with integrative doctors and practitioners nationally and internationally to provide services as our Global Provider Network. Only members have access to our Provider Network. We have agreements to substantially reduce their fees for treatments and procedures to make it more affordable for our membership base.

What We Need From You

Your donations help! You can choose a gift level to donate at and get some pretty cool stuff. Read the gift descriptions to see more on what you'll get. We welcome help from everyone so even $1 donations are welcome! Please donate and save a life today and make sure to share and pass it along.

Other Ways You Can Help Share!

They say that sharing is caring. Donate what you can and pass it on. The more sharing the better the change that people like Don and Terry will be able to keep living....
