story:
We created the Sunrise Pillow to revolutionize your mornings and your nights. It’s simple to use, ultra-comfortable and wakes you naturally. With the Sunrise Pillow's Deep Sleep technology for nights & Sunrise Alarm to start your day, you can effortlessly improve your body's sleep & wake hormones thanks to the power of science & technology. Say goodbye to restless nights and groggy mornings.

 

How you sleep is only half of the equation. Nature's sunrise isn't just to light the way to the work in the morning. The gently rising light starts an invigorating chain reaction that's natural and is key to being your best and feeling vibrant, every day.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Sunrise

In the morning your pillow will simulate a full sunrise. The gradually increasing light falls on your sleeping eyelids telling your body to stop producing Melatonin (the sleep hormone) and begin producing the energy hormone. This mimics the natural wake-up process you get when waking up to nature. By controlling when the sun rises in your bedroom, you can minimize fatigue and grogginess every day.

 

Wireless Audio

Once your sunrise is complete, nature sounds (or your favorite music) gradually increase to ensure you're awake--completing the wake-up experience.

 

Smart Alarm

We all have an internal clock (aka circadian rhythm) that naturally tells us when to sleep & wake up. The Sunrise Pillow detects your sleep cycle and knows to begin the wake-up process when you're sleeping lightly. Your sunrise will start at the optimal time or up to 15 minutes before your set alarm time--to ensure you wake up feeling fully rested, every day.

For example: If you set your alarm for 9:00am but are in a light sleep at 8:50am, your sunrise will start to rise then, rather then letting you fall deeper into sleep and disturbing you later. Traditional alarms aren't smart enough to detect your sleep cycles and go off while you're in a deep sleep. This is why you wake up groggy regardless of how many hours you've slept.

Sleep Score


Take control of your days by improving the quality of your nights. Your sleep score gives you a better understanding of the most important factor of your day; your sleep. With the Sunrise Pillow app, your sleep trends & history show you how exercise, late nights, and even alcohol consumption affect your score, so you can perfect your sleep.


Waking up to the latest technology is one thing, but falling asleep to it is taking it to the next level. The Sunrise Pillow is equipped to wake you with a smart alarm and sunrise simulation but it can also put you to sleep with 6-deep sleep options that are sure to put you to sleep faster.

 

 

 

 


Supercharge your mornings or reboot after lunch. Studies show that exposure for 15-30 minutes of blue light can improve productivity, alertness, and also boost your ability to sleep at night. Blue light suppresses melatonin (the sleep hormone) and shifts your circadian rhythm twice as much as regular indoor lighting. Which can benefit you greatly when you want to focus and get something done.

 

 

 

 

 


The way we’ve been waking up (with ordinary alarms) is unnatural, even harmful and needs to change. Waking from a deep sleep not only sabotages your morning energy & mood but more importantly your daily momentum.

When you start the day off groggy you are more likely to make poor choices that turn into a chain reaction that negatively affects your day, week, and year.

When you wake up improperly you're likely to:

  • Choose bad foods
  • Skip the gym
  • Spread Nutella on everything
  • Rescheduling your diet for another day
 

Outdoors or on vacation, when the sun rises you feel incredibly excited about the day, and even happier. This is simply because a rising light naturally reduces the sleep hormone (melatonin) and increases our energy hormones before we wake up. By experience your own sunrise, you set the tone for a better day every day. Making the right choices from the moment you wake up will give you positive momentum and affect your:

  • Food & drink decisions
  • Work performance
  • Test scores
  • Energy levels - to enjoy more time with your family & friends

The way we look at traditional alarms as normal, is outdated. Virtually throwing away 50% of your sleep is unacceptable. Regular alarms neglect our sleep & wake hormones and this needs to change.

Waking to light has been gaining a lot of good attention in recent years and we want to take awareness to the next level. So please join us by backing this project at any pledge level and let's tell the world that we want to wake up right and wake up to light.

 

 


We used only the highest grade materials when designing the Sunrise Pillow. All of the intelligent components are invisibly embedded deep within premium aerated memory foam. The pillowcase is made with ultra-breathable diamond-quilt fabric to maximize comfort, cooling, and airflow. When creating the sunrise pillow, comfort and materials were at the top of our list.

  

 

 

 

 

 


Both pillow shapes are smart and have the same integrated technology. Make a pledge now and at the end of the campaign, you will receive a survey where you will make your final selection.

 

 


Take a look at the list below to see how the Sunrise Pillow stacks up and even includes the most popular and proven sleep devices on the market.

 

 


A storage pocket holds the wired remote control; an alternative way to control your Sunrise Pillow. Control everything from your iOS or Android device or use the remote control to adjust volume, reading lights, and even snooze. Conveniently recharge your Sunrise Pillow via Micro USB charging port located on the remote control. 

 

 

  • Gyroscope & Accelerometer can detect movement with precision
  • RGB LEDs simulate the natural sunrise and wake you vibrantly
  • Microphone in your Sunrise Pillow is ultra sensitive. It analyzes your breathing patterns, detects snoring and noise disturbances through the night
  • Bluetooth LE to easily change settings, update your Sunrise Pillow's alarm or adjust your sunrise experience
  • Waterproof internal components are housed in a durable waterproof enclosure.


We are Mode | M and we are based in Los Angeles, California. We enjoy being a small design company because it allows us to be agile and listen to feedback, so we can create the most intuitive user friendly products that make a positive impact on all of our lives. Productivity and energy management hold a close place in our hearts because it's a part of our core. Helping the world understand how sleep is the foundation of a better life, we spent thousands of hours sifting through the trends or gimmicks and focused on building only real world proven features that we really think you're going to like. We appreciate the opportunity to earn your business and serving you for many years to come. Thank you for sharing our project with anyone who enjoys a good sunrise.

Where We're Headed

We have selected experienced manufacturing partners with over 33 years of experience. The final stages include approving molds, verification testing and manufacturing.


 

Help Out By Sharing the Sunrise Pillow With Your Friends! (#SunrisePillow) 

Help Out By Sharing the Sunrise Pillow With Your Friends! (#SunrisePillow) Like what you're seeing? Great! Don't be shy about sharing the Sunrise Pillow with your friends. We've made it super simple. Simply hit one of the buttons below. The more people who know about the Sunrise Pillow, the bigger our community will become! The larger the community, the better we'll be able to make the Sunrise Pillow! We can't do this without you!
story_txt:
We created the Sunrise Pillow to revolutionize your mornings and your nights. It’s simple to use, ultra-comfortable and wakes you naturally. With the Sunrise Pillow's Deep Sleep technology for nights & Sunrise Alarm to start your day, you can effortlessly improve your body's sleep & wake hormones thanks to the power of science & technology. Say goodbye to restless nights and groggy mornings. 
Your own personal sunrise is adjustable and can gradually rise for 5-minutes up to 30 minutes, it’s your choice.How you sleep is only half of the equation. Nature's sunrise isn't just to light the way to the work in the morning. The gently rising light starts an invigorating chain reaction that's natural and is key to being your best and feeling vibrant, every day.         
Our bodies are designed to wake up to light SunriseIn the morning your pillow will simulate a full sunrise. The gradually increasing light falls on your sleeping eyelids telling your body to stop producing Melatonin (the sleep hormone) and begin producing the energy hormone. This mimics the natural wake-up process you get when waking up to nature. By controlling when the sun rises in your bedroom, you can minimize fatigue and grogginess every day.Track your movements, playback disturbances, and get a sleep score​ Wireless AudioOnce your sunrise is complete, nature sounds (or your favorite music) gradually increase to ensure you're awake--completing the wake-up experience.Directional speakers ensure only you hear what’s playing. Smart AlarmThe Sunrise Pillow tracks your sleep cycles and wakes you at an optimal time based on your circadian rhythmWe all have an internal clock (aka circadian rhythm) that naturally tells us when to sleep & wake up. The Sunrise Pillow detects your sleep cycle and knows to begin the wake-up process when you're sleeping lightly. Your sunrise will start at the optimal time or up to 15 minutes before your set alarm time--to ensure you wake up feeling fully rested, every day.For example: If you set your alarm for 9:00am but are in a light sleep at 8:50am, your sunrise will start to rise then, rather then letting you fall deeper into sleep and disturbing you later. Traditional alarms aren't smart enough to detect your sleep cycles and go off while you're in a deep sleep. This is why you wake up groggy regardless of how many hours you've slept.Sleep ScoreTake control of your days by improving the quality of your nights. Your sleep score gives you a better understanding of the most important factor of your day; your sleep. With the Sunrise Pillow app, your sleep trends & history show you how exercise, late nights, and even alcohol consumption affect your score, so you can perfect your sleep.Waking up to the latest technology is one thing, but falling asleep to it is taking it to the next level. The Sunrise Pillow is equipped to wake you with a smart alarm and sunrise simulation but it can also put you to sleep with 6-deep sleep options that are sure to put you to sleep faster.  Everything you need to get your best sleep, all in one place.  Supercharge your mornings or reboot after lunch. Studies show that exposure for 15-30 minutes of blue light can improve productivity, alertness, and also boost your ability to sleep at night. Blue light suppresses melatonin (the sleep hormone) and shifts your circadian rhythm twice as much as regular indoor lighting. Which can benefit you greatly when you want to focus and get something done.Set your alarm to "Sunrise with Blue" and wake up extra alert.  


 

 
 The way we’ve been waking up (with ordinary alarms) is unnatural, even harmful and needs to change. Waking from a deep sleep not only sabotages your morning energy & mood but more importantly your daily momentum.When you start the day off groggy you are more likely to make poor choices that turn into a chain reaction that negatively affects your day, week, and year.When you wake up improperly you're likely to:
Choose bad foods
Skip the gym
Spread Nutella on everything
Rescheduling your diet for another day
 Outdoors or on vacation, when the sun rises you feel incredibly excited about the day, and even happier. This is simply because a rising light naturally reduces the sleep hormone (melatonin) and increases our energy hormones before we wake up. By experience your own sunrise, you set the tone for a better day every day. Making the right choices from the moment you wake up will give you positive momentum and affect your:
Food & drink decisions
Work performance
Test scores

Energy levels - to enjoy more time with your family & friends

story:
- LOST EGG FULL COLOUR DISC (artwork by Johnny Mac)  http://albertadiscgolf.websitetoolbox.com/file?id=1328401

Lost Egg Dry Fit Golf Shirt Design http://albertadiscgolf.websitetoolbox.com/file?id=1341078

2012 Lost Egg August 4-5 

Hello,

My name is Elijah and I am running the Lost Egg disc golf tournament. This will be the 12th annual Lost Egg and will be the third one with me as tournament director. The Tournament takes place in the unique terrain of the badlands in Wayne Alberta.

I have been playing and promoting disc golf in Canada for over 15 years and I am passionate about taking Disc Golf in Canada to the next level, It is my goal to eventually make this tournament one of the largest events in the world and attract players from all over the world.

By sponsoring this tournament you will be helping the growth of disc golf and also receive exclusive tournament merchandise.

Minimum donation is only $25 and all tournament sponsors will receive Lost Egg merchandise.

I will have really nice collectible full colour tournament discs and dry fit golf shirts that will be exclusive to players and sponsors of the tournament, (see attached artwork).

Retail cost for the shirt and disc is around $25 each so it's a win win for everyone.

If I reach my Goal of $5000 sponsorship I will guarantee $4000 added cash for the tournament.

I understand that not everyone is in a postion to contribute financially but you can still help by sharing this on your local disc golf website or with your own friends via facebook, twitter etc.

Thanks everyone and I hope to see you in the badlands!

 

-Elijah Isaac

#21256

story:
Short Summary

Sean, who is only 25, was diagnosed with IgA nephropathy after being misdiagnosed with bronchitis. He was alergic to the medicine he received for bronchitis, which may have helped damage his kidneys. Sean is also suffering from Cerebral Palsy that he has lived with from the time he was a baby. He was told by doctors that the only thing he can do now is go on dialysis.  

Doctors are also telling him that he will never be able to work again because of this. Sean has also recently become a father to his new baby boy Adam. He is forced to live with his girl friend's parents, because he is unable to maintain a job or afford to pay for a place of his own.

Sean will need dialysis to keep him alive and does not currently have a job or the money to afford insurance; let alone the cost of a life-long confinement to dialysis. He just recently lost his job from missing too much work because of the constant trips he has to take to the doctor. Many of these visits are to get shots to help his body deal with waste, where his kidneys are not working properly.

I am starting this campaign to help raise money for my brother to be able to  live a meaningful life. I hope that we can raise enough to be able to pay for his medical costs until something more long term can be accomplished. I would like for something to be done legally to help him with the problems he now has to live with; because of a lack of diagnostics done by the medical doctor he went to see when he first starting having issues.

What We Need

I am making the goal $1,000 to help him get started. I would like to get much much more because dialysis costs a lot!

You will be greatly helping to maintain Sean's life and ensuring that his son has a father to help raise him with his mother Jean.

Everything that I raise will go towards helping Sean pay his medical bills. Anything that he receives will help him have a life with his new family.

The Impact

The money that will be raised from this campaign will go towards helping Sean live! Imagine all of the things that he could do for his son and family if only he can stay alive! I cannot even begin to imagine the impact that saving my brothers life will have on him, not to mention his newly born son!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, you can still help by spreading the word through social networks like facebook, twitter, google+, or any other means! If that is not possible then do whatever you can by means of prayer or word of mouth. Thanks to everyone who reads this message and anyone who is able to donate!

For more Information about IgA Nephropathy

http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmedhealth/PMH0001500/

story:
PRE-ORDER NOW ON  SAFE HEART'S OFFICIAL SITE



What is Mobicuff?

Mobicuff is an adapter that converts a sphygmomanometer blood pressure cuff into a smartphone blood pressure monitor. All Mobicuffs sold during this campaign also include one arm cuff with hand pump bulb.

Over 80 Million people in the US have high blood pressure. 

We know taking your blood pressure is not the first thing you think about when you wake up. It might not even be the last thing you do before bed. We at Safe Heart want to help make measuring your blood pressure easier and more fun.

We understand that, though it benefits people to take charge of their own health, it is a lifestyle change - one that busy schedules often will not accomodate.  We want to make an uncomfortable experience as pleasurable as possible through our innovative app.  

We want to empower you to take control of your health!

The Mobicuff is:

  • User friendly 
  • Affordable 
  • Mobile
  • Addictive

What's special about Mobicuff?

Though the Mobicuff is only meant to measure blood pressure, it covers a wide range of health concerns.  Those who simply want to live a healthier lifestyle can use our product to see if their blood pressure matches the positive changes they’ve made in their diet and exercise routine.  For those with pressing health issues -- such as hypertension, diabetes, or sleep apnea -- the mobicuff is a way monitor yourself between doctors visits by letting you check your blood pressure as regularly as you want.  

How does Mobicuff compare to our competitors?

Where We Are

Last year, Safe Heart ran another product campaign, for the iOximeter. Thanks to you, our Indiegogo backers, it is now a successful product sold around the world. This year we're back with our next product, the Mobicuff.

Mobicuff was originally developed by a team of five brilliant scientists from the Oxford Centre for Affordable Healthcare Technology. The team advised by Prof Gari Clifford includes Carlos Arteta, Joao Domingos, Marco Pimentel, Mauro Santos, and Mohammad Ali Maraci. The core technology behind the Mobicuff won the Dell Innovation Challenge in 2012.

We've already completed development, production planning, and identified the manufacturing partners to build the Mobicuff. We are using facilities that are ISO 13485 and ISO 9001 certified, experienced in building other health devices. 

By using a hand-pump sphygmomanometer design, the Mobicuff has no motor, no batteries, and no charger. The hand-pump design makes it more accurate and faster.

Not only does Mobicuff quickly and accurately measure your blood pressure, it motivates you to keep measuring through smart features and perks. By making the experience of taking your blood pressure into an enjoyable one you will be more likely to keep track of your health. Thus, improving your overall health.




Q&A

When will I get my Mobicuff?

If you live in the US or European Union, Mobicuff is undergoing Food and Drug Administration Clearance and EU Product Directive Clearance. We will ship to each market as soon as clearances are received which is currently expected to be October of this year.

How will you ship?

US Customers will receive the Mobicuff via USPS or Fedex Ground. EU customers will receive the Mobicuff via USPS International First Class. International buyers please add $9.95 for shipping.

What Smartphones or Tablets Are Compatible With Mobicuff?

You can use Mobicuff with Android phones and tablets that have a micro-USB charging slot.

How Do I Get The App?

Mobicuff works with the Mobicuff app, which is compatible with Android 4.0 and above. The Mobicuff app will be available for free on the Google Play Store before the Mobicuff devices are shipped.

Will MobiCuff Also Work with iOS Based Devices?

Currently the Mobicuff works only with Android devices. iOS app is on our roadmap but it's delivery partially depends on success of this campaign.

Is Movicuff difficult to use? No way! Ease of use is our top priority. There's no bluetooth so you don't have to worry about pairing. Simply download the Mobicuff app, plug the Mobicuff into your phone and go!

Who owns my data?

You own your data, which is encrypted and stored on your phone. You choose who you share it with.

How will my doctor see the data?

The app has a 1-button export feature that creates a CSV file which you can email to him or her. If you're at your doctor's office already, simply navigate to the history section of the Mobicuff App

How Long Is The Battery Life?

The Mobicuff uses no batteries. It's powered entirely by your phone.

Does Mobicuff Come With A Manual?

 Mobicuff comes with a printed quick start guide and an electronic help guide in the app. Please read carefully before using.

Is There A Warranty? 

Yes, every Mobicuff comes with a 3-year warranty on the adapter, and 1-year warranty on the cuff.

story:
Here’s what’s what…

My name is Eaddy Mays, I’m an actor (ever seen “Blind Side” and “Teen Wolf”?)  I’m a mom.  I’m also a cancer survivor.

It’s been said that from the moment you’re told, “You have malignant cancer,” that you become a survivor.  The thing is, I don’t believe any of us can survive a cancer journey alone.  

Because of the “Teen Wolf” Fandom, I learned that social media can be a great place to find support...strangers become friends...together we make things better.  I met Dev, the Butterfly Effect 5K Run Organizer, on Instagram and when I heard about the Run, I asked if I could help.  And here we are.  

Here's their website if you want to run with me this weekend!!! :D http://butterflyeffect5k.org/

None of us really knows the magnitude of effect we have on the world, but I do know that the effect of love and support has helped me through the darkest times in my life.  So, now I want to affect others who need love and support through their cancer survival and I’m asking for your help with that.

You give AND you get…

To make the giving more fun, I pulled together a few things I thought you might like.  Indiegogo calls them ‘perks’ … I dig that :)  Over there --> is a detailed list.  Just so you know, ALL of the money raised here goes to this charity [it's a 501(c)3] to benefit THYCA, the Thyroid Cancer Survivor’s Association.  Indiegogo keeps 4% of the money raised if we meet the goal and 9% if we don’t (but let’s not even consider that possibility, okay?)  Whatever amount is raised, it ALL goes to the charity, none to goes to me (just fyi, and all that).

The Impact?

The guidelines for setting up this campaign said to explain why this project is valuable to the world...hmm, I can’t speak for the whole world, but I do know that because of your contribution, if even just one person, who has been told they have cancer, can see and feel like they are not alone, that somebody out there cares about what they are going through and that knowledge helps them hold onto hope through the scary, dark times...well, then this campaign is valuable.  When you give, you make an impact and that's important.

The power of You...

Maybe you can’t contribute financially right now.  I get it.  But you can still make a difference.  Spread the word: tweet, retweet, post and talk about this particular campaign.  Share the info, share the love.  That’s important, too.

Thank you.

I appreciate you.  It’s just that simple.
story_txt: Here’s what’s what…My name is Eaddy Mays, I’m an actor (ever seen “Blind Side” and “Teen Wolf”?)  I’m a mom.  I’m also a cancer survivor.It’s been said that from the moment you’re told, “You have malignant cancer,” that you become a survivor.  The thing is, I don’t believe any of us can survive a cancer journey alone.  Because of the “Teen Wolf” Fandom, I learned that social media can be a great place to find support...strangers become friends...together we make things better.  I met Dev, the Butterfly Effect 5K Run Organizer, on Instagram and when I heard about the Run, I asked if I could help.  And here we are.  Here's their website if you want to run with me this weekend!!! :D http://butterflyeffect5k.org/None of us really knows the magnitude of effect we have on the world, but I do know that the effect of love and support has helped me through the darkest times in my life.  So, now I want to affect others who need love and support through their cancer survival and I’m asking for your help with that.You give AND you get…To make the giving more fun, I pulled together a few things I thought you might like.  Indiegogo calls them ‘perks’ … I dig that :)  Over there --> is a detailed list.  Just so you know, ALL of the money raised here goes to this charity [it's a 501(c)3] to benefit THYCA, the Thyroid Cancer Survivor’s Association.  Indiegogo keeps 4% of the money raised if we meet the goal and 9% if we don’t (but let’s not even consider that possibility, okay?)  Whatever amount is raised, it ALL goes to the charity, none to goes to me (just fyi, and all that).The Impact?The guidelines for setting up this campaign said to explain why this project is valuable to the world...hmm, I can’t speak for the whole world, but I do know that because of your contribution, if even just one person, who has been told they have cancer, can see and feel like they are not alone, that somebody out there cares about what they are going through and that knowledge helps them hold onto hope through the scary, dark times...well, then this campaign is valuable.  When you give, you make an impact and that's important.The power of You...Maybe you can’t contribute financially right now.  I get it.  But you can still make a difference.  Spread the word: tweet, retweet, post and talk about this particular campaign.  Share the info, share the love.  That’s important, too.Thank you.I appreciate you.  It’s just that simple.

story:
Quick Summary

Ben's Friends is a 501(c)3 nonprofit that builds support communities for patients with rare diseases. Every month we serve 100,000+ patients looking to connect with others like them.  We have a waitlist of 100+ communities we can't launch because of outdated technology.

The Full Story

There are 300 million people around the world affected by a rare disease.  I am one of those 300 million.

In 2006, at the age of 29, I suffered a rare type of stroke caused by an AVM, which is like an aneurysm.  I made it through the stroke but I still had to deal with surgery, recovery, and waiting for my brain to heal.  

My friends and family did the best they could to support me.  But none of them had been through what I went through so I felt completely alone.  And scared.  That shouldn’t be.  

So I started a free online patient community called AVMSurvivors.org.  There, I finally met others who understood what I was going through.  

We became a family of survivors, helping each other with information, understanding and compassion.

My good friend, Scott, suggested that we do something to help the other 300 million looking to connect with others.  So, together, we started Ben’s Friends Patient Communities.

We needed your help to make this happen.  And you responded.  

You Made This Possible

You ran marathons.  You ran obstacle courses. You asked your friends to help.  You made sure that everyone knew about our fundraisers.  You supported us over the last 5 years to help patients in need.

We used your money to build new patient communities.  Communities that patients joined and found the support they were looking for.  They made friends.  They joined a family.  There were no longer all alone.

In only 8 years, you helped change the lives of hundreds of thousands of patients in over a hundred countries.

How You Can Help Now

So what’s next?  There are still hundreds of millions of rare disease patients in need of support.  And what we need to help them is a new online community platform.  A new home.

Right now, we have a waitlist of over 100 communities that we can’t launch because of outdated technology.

That is easily a million more patients we could be helping, if we only had a new home.

We talked to the best technology people in the world.  They told us it would cost at least $100,000 to get this new home built and help millions of rare disease patients find the hope and support they desperately need.

Help Us Build a New Online Home

So, starting today, join us and fundraise to help change the lives of patients in need.

A $100 donation can change the lives of hundreds of patients.  Can't donate right now? You can still help by posting a link to the campaign on your Facebook wall to help spread the word.

Our mission is to guarantee that anyone with a rare medical condition has a safe place to go and connect with others like them.  

Help us build a new online home and change someone’s life.

story:
My Journey in Fitness 

Hi everyone! 
My name is Annaliese and I am asking for your help to support me in my upcoming competition.  I am entering a body building contest on Oahu and need to raise funds to do so. 
This has been a long hard journey for me. I started getting into fitness around June of last year, and really figured out my goals towards December. I've grown up always being the girl who was "too thin", "so skinny", and even been told I was anorexic. I never had any eating disorders, I was just born with a very fast metabolism.   I would eat, eat and eat and yet nothing changed.  
Later in life I discovered I had high blood pressure, and started a membership at a local gym to get my health in better shape. Being at the gym I started with simple workouts and routines. I remember walking in the bathroom and seeing flyers posted of bodybuilding competitions. Women on these flyers were thin, beautiful AND Athletic. They had major muscle definition and it was obvious  they worked hard for it. 
This inspired me to build my body and one day enter a competition. I wanted to be that girl on the flyer to motivate others. 
I began working with trainers, and in Febuary of this year I started to notice a big change in my body. I was gaining muscle! I decided I would set a goal which is June 27 to enter the competition. 
I started with only being able to push 50 pounds on a leg press. and as of today I'm pushing 385 pounds plus. All natural might I add. I do take protein after my work outs to help with muscle recovery. I went from being this skinny girl who couldn't gain weight,  to a girl who's gained almost ten pounds of muscle. Through out my journey in the gym other woman started to notice and began to ask me for advice and workout routines. That's the moment I realized i wanted to help others feel the way I felt.
I want to inspire woman. I want to make them feel accomplished and accepting of themselves. For me, entering this competition is a way of reaching only the beginning of my goals and being the inspiration for other woman to do so as well.  
Thank you for taking the time to read my story. If you'd like to support me in this I would greatly appreciate you. Any unused funds will be donated to a Gym that could use it, or to a woman who I inspire to compete. With your donation I will give back by giving you workout plans and meal preps. Help you achieve your fitness goals. If you'd like a signed picture of me from the show I'd be happy to send one as well. I want to inspire others. 
Warmest aloha, 
Annaliese. 
If you don't wish to donate you could help support me by spreading the word:)

story:
TVHC is dedicated to promoting the health and well-being of our community by providing accessible, high quality care.

Why are Community Health Clinics necessary?

·  97% of the patients served at TVHC make less than $39,580 for a family of three. Our typical family: a single parent and two children.

·  71% are making less than $19,790 for the same size family

Patients are seen without regard for their ability to pay.  No one should have to choose between health and the basics.

We want to continue expanding access to our services to make it as easy as possible for our community to take advantage of the full scope of services we offer.

We provide care with the utmost quality standards, going above and beyond to improve the health and well-being of every patient, as well as the community as a whole.

We pride ourselves on being a culture of care and giving, ensuring that we earn and maintain the trust and confidence of the communities we serve.

We need your help.  Approximately one out of three patients is uninsured – many of them youth in need of mental and physical health care.

You can help with by making a donation to Tiburcio Vasquez Health Center.  A contribution of any size makes a huge difference.  For example:

·  A gift of $150 helps provide one child care with a back to school exam

·  $50 pays for a variety of lab tests

·  $25 helps one of our Health Educators conduct a parent health workshop

·  $2-10 help build up supplies of tooth brushes, floss and plaque tablets

Over the last 45 years, TVHC has expanded from its first site in Union City to a 15-site network of community health care facilities stretching from San Leandro to Fremont. With the addition of the new clinic in San Leandro, we will provide medical and dental services to more than 25,000 area residents annually. You can help today.

story:
Hi! 


We are two best friends, trying to raise money for a woman we've never met. When we heard about a woman from Uganda who was attacked with a bucket of acid, and couldn't get to the US to get treatment, we decided to do something about it. It's so rare that we have the opportunity to help one person who needs it, and this woman only needs about $80,000 to change her life forever.

Read more about Christine's story below, and please donate if you can. Even $5 would make a huge difference to Christine!

Happy 2015,

Carrie and Claire

Us, eating salad!

Meet Christine

In 2011 Christine Nakato, 19 years old and unknowingly pregnant, heard a knock on her front door and went to see who it was. What she found would change her life forever.

In a jealous rage, a disturbed ex-lover of Christine’s current boyfriend doused her with a bucket of caustic acid, permanently damaging Christine's face and upper body. Miraculously she and her child survived but the damage done to both Christine’s body and spirit was immediate and debilitating.


Nearly four years later, Christine now lives in fear every day. If she leaves her home, she may be stared at, mocked, or even attacked again. Tragically, many assume that an acid attack survivor must have deserved her assault.

Christine is a bright, energetic woman with a passion for design. She is currently taking tailoring classes, and before her attack, planned to open her own business. However, because of her appearance no one will buy from her.

We are trying to raise $80,000 for Christine in the next two months, to get her to the United States for intensive surgeries. While major services are donated by the Grossman Burn Foundation, Christine still needs help for travel to the US, transportation, room and board, nursing care, medical supplies, and to have a prosthetic eye made to replace the one destroyed in the attack.

We so rarely have the opportunity to help one person in need so directly, and Christine's story will give other victims hope. 

Why Do Acid Attacks Happen?

Unfortunately, acid attacks are a grim reality for many people in the developing world. Because women in Uganda are treated so poorly, almost as possessions of their male partners, desperate women sometimes try to destroy a former partner's new "property" by making her a damaged "commodity."

The facts are shocking:

  • According to Amnesty International, the greatest cause of acid attacks is the marginalization of women.
  • One in every five Ugandans knows an acid attack victim.
  • 16% of victims die.
  • 1 in 4 female survivors are abandoned by their male partners, while only 1 in 33 male survivors are abandoned by their female partners. 
  • 31% of survivors are blind or partially blind.
  • Almost all survivors experience extreme social anxiety and are afraid to leave their homes.
  • In order to convict an attacker, a government chemist must confirm that acid was used in the attack. Yet there is only one government chemist in the entire country. This and other factors make convictions rare and punishments meager.

Your Gift Will Change a Life

For Christine, having these surgeries means getting her life back; being able to leave her home, get an education, and start her own business. It means fighting back against the war on women in her hometown and serving as a beacon of resilience for the rest of the world.

Any funds raised above $80,000 will be used to assist  other acid burn victims, so that they too can have hope for a better future.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even $1 will help Christine get her life-changing treatments. A gift of $5 represents about one week's income for someone in Uganda.

If you can't give right now, visit grossmanburnfoundation.org or amnestyusa.org for more information on what you can do to stop acid attacks. 

Thank you for helping to change Christine's life.

story:
Send Thomas to Rugby 7s in Las Vegas

UPDATE!

Tom got THE scholarship to the Australian Brumbies/ASU Development Academy.  AND, he was accepted to the NRFL Combine on January 14th at the LA Coliseum!  He will compete side by side with professional athletes for a chance to play with the first US Rugby League.....

I LOVE RUGBY.  I was just invited to play in the amateur tournament that is part of the IRB Sevens World Series held in Las Vegas every year.  I will compete against 100+ other top athletes for one of 24 places on the elite side team .  Over the course of the week long tournament activities, I will train and compete where national and international coaches will be looking for talent.  This is a once in a lifetime opportunity to get the chance to play professionally.

Since being introduced to rugby almost 10 years ago, I have had a fire burning in me to play at a professional level.  Although I have continued to train at competition level, as a husband and father I have had more pressing priorities than chasing my dream.  I recently attended the rigorous ASU/Brumbies combine which happened to be only 1 1/2 hours from where I live.  I caught the attention of world famous Super Rugby Coach Larkham.  He was impressed with my performance and I received top scores at the camp.  I was approached by him personally about a scholarship to attend their development academy.  Rumors of my performance made their way to the right connections and I was promptly invited to compete in Las Vegas.

I feel very confident that with this opportunity to compete I will be selected for the elite side team and catch the eye of every coach that sees me play.  I have the full support of my family to pursue this opportunity, however, there are costs associated with it, the same that have made pursuing this dream impossible in the past. 

It's not just a Dream

Rugby is definitely my passion.  I live for competition.  But the opportunity to play professional rugby is a career opportunity and an opportunity for a better life for my family.  I am driven to achieve this success, however, I cannot do it at the expense of my family.  Although there is an inevitable emotional cost,  I am seeking sponsorship to lessen the financial impact on my family.

Training for Success

Although I have already been training at competition level, I will spend the next few months in intense training for the tournament so I can be fully prepared to take advantage of this opportunity.  I am preparing every inch of my body through mental, physical, nutritional and athletic training.  I am training one on one with a coach that is donating his time to help me realize this goal.

This isn't Easy

After running two businesses and raising 3 children, there isn't a lot of time left in the day to train, let alone pursue individual goals that are this intense.  Gratefully, I have the support of my wife and extended family, a network of friends and a sports community that believes in my ability to succeed.  With a little financial support, I will have all I need to make this dream a reality.

You make the difference

I appreciate EVERY bit of support, whether it's an encouraging statement, a prayer, an idea, a contact, a dollar...or the generous contribution that was made to provide accommodations for my family for a week so they could join me in Las Vegas.  The money from this campaign pays for my accommodations for a week, transportation and CIPP registration card.  I will personally be funding everything else including equipment, food, loss of work and other incidentals.

Thank you for considering contribution to this campaign!

story:
At the end of July, our dear friend Heather went to see her doctor for a routine checkup as she had some swelling under her eye. Within days she underwent brain surgery to remove several tumors that were leaning on the pituitary glands.

Compounding the stress, Heather has been caring for her husband for the past year as he is quite ill himself. Being out of work on short term disability and with bills mounting up from her husband's medical care, has brought about great financial stress to Heather.

At a time like this, we want Heather to focus on her health and get better. She has always been the one to take care of everyone else and this is a time where we need to support her.

Let's all give what we can to ensure that the current financial burden is lightened for Heather.

story: September is currently 23 weeks pregnant and was diagnosed with Stage 2b Invasive Squamous Carcinoma of the Cervix on June 18th, 2012.  We currently live 140 miles from the treatment center and have been driving to and from and staying at hotels.  We are hoping to get accepted into the hospital's care campus so our living expenses will be less.  We are currently seeing five doctors for her care and are in touch with the National Tumor Board and with various other doctors around the United States.  The hospital at which we are getting treatment is Providence Hospital and Medical Center, Anchorage, AK.  If there is anything you can give, even words of encouragement, or possibly you or a loved one has been through this, it would be welcomed.  You can email us at mklumb@gmail.com or septemberlloyd@gmail.com or write to us at PO Box 801, Soldotna, Alaska 99669.  I will keep people informed as more information is brought to us.

story:
"Your talent is God's gift to you. What you do with it

is your gift back to God."       ~ Leo Buscaglia

Who We Are

In 2012, OperationUNITE was founded to honor the lives of loved ones we lost to cancer.  Music is the rhythm of our hearts. Dance is a universal language that transcends music race gender and self awareness. Art inspires imagination; to be completely free and in the moment at the same time.

What better way to heal the world and lend our support? Open level dance workshops integrate live music by industry musicians and DJs who donate their talent to provide an electric environment! Fundraising events combine dance, visual art, fashion, and wellness.

We are artists from every expression, using our passion to inspire and give strength to families affected by cancer. Uniting people from all walks of life together to fight against a disease that knows no color lines.

In the fight for your life, spiritual strength can be your saving grace. Lend your support at our events and workshops July-September or at the annual toy drive in December.

Donations can be made year-round at www.OperationUNITE.net

Operation Unite is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, an arts services non-profit organization. Donations to Fractured Atlas on behalf of Operation Unite are tax-deductible to the fullest extent permitted by law.

 

What We Need

$15,000 or more!

We have until September 8th to make this dream a reality!

 

Goal:$10,000 = sustains program for 1 year

The Drea's Dream program enlists board certified dance/movement therapists (BC -DMT) to engage medically fragile children in movement therapy, supporting physical development, anxiety reduction, and creative expression. 

Through dance/movement therapy, emotions are accessed, and then released through expressive movement and a positive transformation takes place within the patient, facilitating the overall well being of the child. Small group and bedside sessions are scheduled to meet the child's physical and emotional needs.We hope to build enough support to expand the program to work with patients of all ages. (default picture)

Goal: $5000
 
Private cancer care facilities can give patients a weekly report of their treatment progress, one-on-one time to ask the doctors any questions, and additional nursing assistance. 
 

& What You Get

Each perk package includes OU gifts and keepsakes for you to treasure but the hope you give to cancer patients is priceless. Clothing sponsors share a message of strength, faith, and self worth.


God Swagg Apparel by Joe Melendrez is a cutting edge faith based clothing line inspired by Ephesians 6:10-18. The slogan “Rep What You Believe” is a phrase that encourages all disciples to be proud to represent their faith, wear it every day, and truly let God be their fashion. @GodSwaggApparel

Wealthy Minds, Inc. mission is to infect over one billion people with success, motivation, and wealth. Their quotes encourage and inspire you to develop a Wealthy Mind.  "Speak your dreams into existence and dream with your eyes open." -Billionaire P.A.

 ~~

The more people we reach the more fragile lives can be changed! Hopefully we surpass our goal but if we miss the mark, all of the funds we accumulate will be divided between our screened list of recipients.

 ~~

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to provide financial assistance, we can also make arrangements for exchange of services (in-kind) for advertisements or other consideration.

We appreciate you sharing this link and our website with your friends, family, and coworkers.

 

Instagram @OperationUNITE #RockYourRibbon

Twitter @operationunite #CancerWontWin

 

There's more to discover...Indiegogo has amazing share tools to keep us connected!

Thank you in advance for your support and prayers.

story:
A Residential Hospice in Beautiful Topanga Canyon, CA

We are currently renovating a house in Topanga Canyon to create a 6-bedroom residential hospice home that will provide a peaceful, healing place for terminally ill people and their loved ones in the last weeks and months of life.

The 6 bedrooms open out onto the patio that wraps around the house. We are looking for funds for new windows and wide French doors that will allow hospice patient beds to be wheeled out onto the patio so that bed-ridden patients can enjoy the natural beauty of the creek, the California native plant gardens, and the canyon birds and wildlife.

The Los Angeles Hospice at Anam Cara was founded in 2013 as a hospice and provider of compassionate care. Set in a nurturing, home-like environment and surrounded by the natural beauty of Topanga Canyon, the hospice is based on a non-medical, social model that encompasses the mind, body, and spirit through various holistic therapies such as arts and music, meditation and yoga.

Other Ways You Can Help

If this resonates with you, please support us with a donation and/or by posting about our campaign on Facebook or other social media, and passing it on to others who may be interested in supporting this important work.

If you would rather donate by check, please send your donations to:

Anam Cara
1178 N. Topanga Canyon Blvd.
Topanga CA 90290

story:
Short Summary

Tanner Simpson has the Opportunity to Compete for 6 Different World Championships at the National Black Belt Leagues Super Grands World Championships... Please Help Him Live His Dream!   

  • Tanner is a Black Belt who does Hyper/XMA, Rock Solid Kenpo, MMA, and BJJ
  • Raise Money to Attend the National Black Belt Leagues Super Grands
  • Tanner has been working so hard his whole life, sacrificing so much to achieve this opportunity, Once he conquers the expenses of going, he will get to live a dream and goal!

What We Need 

  • some of the cost are Transportation/ Airline tickets during the Holiday Season which is close to $2000 for him and his father. His accommodations for 7 to 10 days is close to $2000, his entry fees are around $650, plus a few hundred for food and expenses.
  • Tanner is Ranked #1 in 6 Different Divisions for the Northwest Region ... He gets to represent our area
  • If Tanner does not reach his Financial  Goals then all moneys collected will go to the Team Rock Solid Parent Association to help fund him and his team mates tournament competition  next year. though as tanner puts it "Failure is not an option!"

The Impact

  • Tanner is a Leader and Role Model to so many children... For them to see that he can set a goal and find a way to achieve it is a Powerful Positive lesson to those he mentors.
  • Tanner has a history of Winning, he knows how to win....His chances of bring home a World championship is very good!
  • Its Powerful, Its Real, and It is Finally Going To Happen w/ your Help!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please share this with everyone and anyone you can
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you!

story:
Niagara VegFest 

Are you a fan of Niagara VegFest? 

Perhaps you attended the festival in 2012 or 2013, and while you were there you enjoyed some great food, were inspired by one of our internationally renowned speakers, or had your face painted by one of our fabulous volunteers. Perhaps you are just hearing about us now for the first time, but are excited by the idea of VegFest in Niagara. 

In just short two years this humble festival has grown beyond our wildest dreams! We are excited and so very honoured to be able to put something like this on in Niagara. This is a wonderful community, and there is clearly an interest in having a VegFest here! 

We are committed to keeping Niagara VegFest free and open to all. We have never charged admission, and we don't intend to do so. However, as we grow the costs to put on the festival also increase. 

We are reaching out to our friends, fans, and supporters for some assistance to help ensure the future of Niagara VegFest. If you have enjoyed Niagara VegFest in the past or if you are looking forward to taking part in Niagara VegFest in the future would you consider making a donation to help sustain the festival? 

We have some great thank you gifts for contributors who give $20 or more to this campaign. You can keep them for yourself to show your Niagara VegFest pride, or you can share them with friends and family--they make great gifts, and the holidays are just around the corner! 

Other Ways You Can Help

-share this campaign with your friends and family

-sign up to be a Niagara VegFest volunteer

-Run a business or have a special talent? Perhaps you would rather give an "in kind" gift in support of Niagara VegFest. We would love to hear from you!

Want to stay up to date on Niagara VegFest news? You can sign up for our newsletter, find us on Facebook, or follow us on Twitter.

story:
Breast Cancer sucks!
I'm signed up for the Inaugural Ironman Chattanooga as a charity participant. The Ironman is a grueling 140.6 mile triathlon that participants must complete in a 17 hour time frame. Next September, I will swim 2.4 miles, bike 112 miles, and run 26.2 miles all for The Susan G. Komen Foundation and Stand Up To Cancer.


Why Breast Cancer?
When you're diagnosed with cancer, everyone else around you is diagnosed as well. A close friend of mine beat breast cancer, and I had the unfortunate opportunity to watch her entire journey from start to finish. She lost her hair. She had a mastectomy. She went through hell, but the good news is that she won. For every good story, there are plenty of bad ones.

Here are some breast cancer statistics...
   •   About 232,340 new cases of invasive breast cancer
   •   About 39,620 deaths from breast cancer
   •   The most common cancer among women in the United States, other than skin cancer and the second leading cause of cancer death in women after lung cancer.

Ways You Can Help...

1. Contribute to awareness charities like Stand Up To Cancer
2. Participate in your local Komen Race for the Cure
3. Come to Chattanooga September 28, 2014 for the Ironman and have a blast cheering on athletes
4. Help me get the word out
5. Share, Tweet, and do whatever it takes to make some noise with this campaign!

Who Am I?
My name is Jeff, and I'm an app developer/web designer who has a passion for endurance sports and the ability to make a difference. When I'm not being a nerd, I enjoy being active and spending time with family and our two basset hounds.

This campaign is important to me because I couldn't imagine being without my wife because of this disease. I would be beyond lost. The loved ones of 39,620 women...and some men will experience this loss this year. I also have to nieces who I hope will never have to go through this awful disease.

What I Need

I need you to help me make it 140.6 miles to the finish line by giving me a reason to push myself harder and further. Join me and #ShowYourSupport for breast cancer. The profits from this campaign will be split between the Komen Foundation and Stand Up To Cancer.

What You Get


Angel Acknowledgement: It's not much, but every little bit counts. This is the equivalent double finger gun with a wink.

All Out Shout Out: This is the equivalent of a high five. I will personally call you to thank you for your donation, as well as give you a video shout-out over YouTube.

Pink Out SOLO Cup: Wear your pink and come on down to party and cheer on athletes as they make their way to the finish line. Backers will receive a bottomless SOLO cup for the keg to help you cheer louder.

#Showing My Support T-Shirt: This shirt will turn heads because there is no better to show your support than to actually show your support. This trademarked shirt was crafted for awesomeness and can be branded specifically for your business.

Sign My Singlet: Donors at this level will get to do the Ironman with me. Backers will email a scanned signature or name of someone who has been affected by breast cancer. I will have that signature screen printed on my singlet and will carry them along the entire 140.6 miles. This can be "In Memory of..." or "In Honor of..." or whatever you want.

Novlene W. Package: Donors will receive a Pink Out SOLO Cup as well as a #Showing My Support T-Shirt. Novlene is a five-time world and three-time Olympic medalist.

Sharon A Package: Backers will receive everything in the Novlene W. Package as well as an opportunity to Sign My Singlet. Sharon is an active survivor who invests in education, training and other initiatives at her local cancer center.

Linda H. Package: Donors will receive everything in the Novlene Package as well as a handwritten thank you card and an opportunity to put 2 signatures on my race singlet. Linda is an accomplished triathlete and a 3+ year cancer survivor.

Gayle O. Package: Corporate Sponsorship. Backers will receive...
- One-on-One lunch
- One-on-One Training Session
- 25 Personalized #Showing My Support Shirts
- 25 Commemorative Pint Glasses
- 25 Headsweat Hats
- Entry into The Breast Cancer Marathon (February 23, 2014)
- Couch to...Marathon, Half Marathon Training Plan
- Singlet Ad Space for your company
  4 12" x 4"

Gayle was an accomplished marathon runner who unfortunately lost her battle.

story:
Samuel's Heart

OK, let me start out three years ago, before I was even born.  My mom and dad met at a dance, and although they were from two very different countries, fell in love.  They were soon married and expecting their first child, my sister Khanali.  The excitement and anticipation of her arrival only contributed to the love they already formed for her even before she was born.  To their suprise she was ready to come 8 weeks early!  When Khanali was born she was so active and healthy!  Unfortunately she became ill about two weeks later and passed away taking her last breath in my father's arms.  That was so difficult for my mom and dad, but they have slowly overcome some of their grief in her passing and have found joy in my life.  

I was an unexpected blessing for my mom and dad.  They did not think they were able to have another child so soon after my sister, but here I am!  I too could not wait to come into this world and arrived a few weeks early.  Weighing 4lbs. 5 oz I was in the hospital for about two weeks.  I was being tested for multiple things, and while there they found that I have a congenital heart defect.  I also need special formula to keep on my weight.  I may look big, but I still am just 8lbs at three months old.  This has led to multiple visits to the hospital, testing, and more treatment and care that my parents are struggling with.  Although I love the nice nurses because they cuddle with me, I would rather be with my mom and dad, healthy and happy.  I really need help with the expenses of the procedures for my pulmonary stenosis.  One procedure involves putting a little balloon in between the heart valve to widen it.  Although I love balloons, I am a bit nervous if I have one in my heart!  I know after my mom and dad lost my sister, this is very stressful and I just want to ease their burden without having to worry about the funds to pay the medical bills.  Any bit of your contribution will help us cover the expense for my treatment!  With the proper care I know I will grow big and tall like my dad, and maybe even be a Kenyan runner like him!

   

What We Need & What You Get

We need help in raising funds to contribute to my medical expenses for my heart and other health issues.  Any contribution will be greatly appreciated.  The $5000 dollars will pay the medical premium for my heart monitor and EKG's and special formula I need to eat to be healthy.  Anything in addition to that will help with other procedures for my pulmonary stenosis.  In return for your kind contribution and gesture we will be forever grateful!  If a monetary contribution is not something you can do, then please volunteer at a local hospital in the children/infant unit.  They love seeing happy faces and people that care, it helps them take their minds off of why they are there! Thanks again for taking time to read my story, and help me out.  Even a prayer for me would be appreciated! 

For contributing at least $25 dollars my mom is offering this perk: 

 

 
 It may not look 100% identical because it is hand made by her...with love.

 

We want to thank everyone that has contributed so far....with monetary donations, prayers, and sincere well wishes! We are blessed to be in a world where thoughtfulness, generosity and brotherly love still exists! We still have a way to go...so please don't stop sharing! Thank you.
story_txt:
Samuel's Heart
OK, let me start out three years ago, before I was even born.  My mom and dad met at a dance, and although they were from two very different countries, fell in love.  They were soon married and expecting their first child, my sister Khanali.  The excitement and anticipation of her arrival only contributed to the love they already formed for her even before she was born.  To their suprise she was ready to come 8 weeks early!  When Khanali was born she was so active and healthy!  Unfortunately she became ill about two weeks later and passed away taking her last breath in my father's arms.  That was so difficult for my mom and dad, but they have slowly overcome some of their grief in her passing and have found joy in my life.  
I was an unexpected blessing for my mom and dad.  They did not think they were able to have another child so soon after my sister, but here I am!  I too could not wait to come into this world and arrived a few weeks early.  Weighing 4lbs. 5 oz I was in the hospital for about two weeks.  I was being tested for multiple things, and while there they found that I have a congenital heart defect.  I also need special formula to keep on my weight.  I may look big, but I still am just 8lbs at three months old.  This has led to multiple visits to the hospital, testing, and more treatment and care that my parents are struggling with.  Although I love the nice nurses because they cuddle with me, I would rather be with my mom and dad, healthy and happy.  I really need help with the expenses of the procedures for my pulmonary stenosis.  One procedure involves putting a little balloon in between the heart valve to widen it.  Although I love balloons, I am a bit nervous if I have one in my heart!  I know after my mom and dad lost my sister, this is very stressful and I just want to ease their burden without having to worry about the funds to pay the medical bills.  Any bit of your contribution will help us cover the expense for my treatment!  With the proper care I know I will grow big and tall like my dad, and maybe even be a Kenyan runner like him!
   


What We Need & What You Get
We need help in raising funds to contribute to my medical expenses for my heart and other health issues.  Any contribution will be greatly appreciated.  The $5000 dollars will pay the medical premium for my heart monitor and EKG's and special formula I need to eat to be healthy.  Anything in addition to that will help with other procedures for my pulmonary stenosis.  In return for your kind contribution and gesture we will be forever grateful!  If a monetary contribution is not something you can do, then please volunteer at a local hospital in the children/infant unit.  They love seeing happy faces and people that care, it helps them take their minds off of why they are there! Thanks again for taking time to read my story, and help me out.  Even a prayer for me would be appreciated! 
For contributing at least $25 dollars my mom is offering this perk: 
 

 
 It may not look 100% identical because it is hand made by her...with love.


 
We want to thank everyone that has contributed so far....with monetary donations, prayers, and sincere well wishes! We are blessed to be in a world where thoughtfulness, generosity and brotherly love still exists! We still have a way to go...so please don't stop sharing! Thank you.
